loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is 46 years old, married to Samson, and they have eight children. She has been practicing small-scale farming in her locality for the last 20 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 5,000.

She is borrowing her first loan with KADET of Kes 20,000 which she will use to purchase farm inputs, i.e., fertilizers and seeds. With the anticipated profits she will educate her children and also improve the farm.

She dreams of improving her farm and producing more and educating her children to greater levels.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, i.e., fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Santos Maria

texts.en:
My name is Holy H., and I'm dedicated on sale of products of popular consumption, has my business for 3 years. My business generates income to me for the sustenance of my family. My goal is to increase my inventory to have a greater assortment of product to sell. I'd like to give my son an education.

Mi nombre es Santos H., me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi clientela es muy buena ya que yo personalmente los atiendo y son los vecinos de mi colonia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor venta de productos y tener mas surtido mi negocio con las ganancias que obtenga quiero acondicionar mejor mi negocio y darles estudio a mi hijo.

loans.use: Compra de pan, churros, refrescos, sopas instantaneas, papel higienico, jabon, confites, pan dulce,

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en: Rahim V. lives in Aghsu city where he owns and operates a small store that sells mobile phones and mobile phone accessories. He is married with one child. He has owned this store for the past eight years. With this loan Rahim wants to expand his inventory and purchase more mobile phones and accessories.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of quality shoes for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: A 32 year-old woman, Mrs. Maria I. learnt the trade of selling provisions and drinks for one year before she started her own business in the year 2002. She is married with a child and living in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She says if she gets the amount of $400, she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, provisions, and food items

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ángela is a very hard-working, enthusiastic woman. Since she was ten years old, she has worked, selling shoes. her husband works as a watchman, and they have three children who are studying. It's difficult to meet the home epxenses, and the school fees with only her husband's salary. With the need for extra income Ángela started her own business, first selling very few shoes, but adding more customers. Now she fills large orders.

The desire to give her children a good education and for them to have a better future motivates her to work harder every day. Now Ángela is requesting a loan of $375 which she will use to purchase merchandise for the new season to have a better supply and increase her sales. She promises to return this amount in one month. Be an important part of Ángela's life. She and her family thank you very much for your support.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Ángela es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, desde hace diez años se dedica a la venta de calzado, su esposo trabaja de velador y tienen tres hijos que están estudiando, era difícil cubrir los gastos del hogar y las colegiaturas sólo con el salario de su esposo y ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra Ángela inició su propio negocio, primero vendía muy pocos pares pero pronto fue haciéndose de más clientes y ahora ya surte grandes pedidos.

El deseo de darle a sus hijos una buena educación y que puedan tener un mejor futuro la motiva a esforzarse más cada día, ahora Ángela está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía de la nueva temporada para tener un mejor surtido e incrementar sus ventas, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en un mes. Forma parte importante en la vida de Ángela, ella y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase shoes to resell

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: Galina is a sharp business owner from the city of Vinogradov in western Ukraine. For more than eight years, she has run a successful business selling kitchenware – dishes, pots, and pans. Galina loves what she sells and is dedicated to the success of her venture. By wisely using capital from loans received through Nadiya Ukraine, she has been able to expand her business and increase her income. Her future goals include growing her business further and expanding the assortment of products she has available. Galina has requested a new loan of $500 to add to her working capital, allowing her to purchase new inventory and continue focusing on improving her business.

loans.use: Galina would like to increase the inventory for her kitchenware business.

loans.name: Thi Hay

texts.vi:
Ms Hay is 48 years old. She has 3 children, one is working and the other two are still in school. Since they live near the market (good location), she had opened a clothing store. She has been owning the store for a while now so the revenue from the store is stable. She's requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise for her store. Her husband raises poultry and pigs at home. They would set aside part of their income to pay back the loan

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hay 48 tuổi, chị có 3 con, 1 con đã đi làm và 2 con còn đi học. Chị sống ở khu vực gần chợ nên đã mở cửa hàng bán quần áo. Chị làm nghề này đã lâu và có thu nhập ổn định. Chị vay vốn để mua thêm quần ấo về bán. Chồng chị ở nhà nuôi lợn, gà để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Thu nhập của cả nhà sẽ để dành một phần để hoàn trả vốn vay.

loans.use: To purchase more clothings for sales

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Since marrying her husband 24 years ago and when the responsibility became urgent to Victoria, her husband became independent of his parents with the purpose of growing products in his own fields of crops to create together with his dear wife a strong family. God blessed them with three children, who also now have become important support in the labor. Nowadays they wake with much enthusiasm to continue with the daily work eventhough there is certain distrust due to the climate change that plague the land and habitat nowadays, the increase of rain is a risk for her and all her neighbors but nobody loses hope that the situation will get better. To survive one can’t only dedicate themselves to growing potatoes, peas and barley, they also raise lambs to sell on the weekends at the market of Acostambo. Thanks to this activity she can support the economy of her home when they suffer losses. She desires to purchase fertilizer and insecticiD. for the fields of crops to better the quality of her products. Show your solidarity with Victoria who works for a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

DesD. que contrajo matrimonio con su esposo ya hace 24 años y cuando L. responsabilidad apremiaba a Victoria, su esposo se independizó D. sus padres con el propósito D. sembrar productos en sus propios campos D. cultivo a fin D. forjar junto a su querida esposa una sólida familia.Dios los bendijo con tres hijos, que también ahora se han convertido en un importante apoyo D. sus labores. Actualmente se levanta con mucho entusiasmo para continuar con su cotidiana labor aunque con cierta desconfianza y desacierto debido al cambio climático que sufre actualmente L. tierra que habita, L. escasez D. lluvia es un riesgo para elL. y todos sus vecinos pero aún así no pierD. las esperanzas D. que mejorará esta situación.Para sobrevivir no sólo se dedica a L. siembra D. papa, arveja y cebada, también cría ovejitas para luego venderlas los fines D. semana en L. feria D. Acostambo. Gracias a esta actividad elL. pueD. sostener L. economía D. su hogar cuando ocurran pérdidas. Desea comprar abonos e insecticidas para sus campos D. cultivo a fin D. mejorar L. calidad D. sus productos.Solidarízate con Victoria que trabaja por un futuro mejor.

loans.use: The purchase of fertilizer and insecticide to better the quality of her products.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina D. trades in cosmetics, and artificial hair. She is a divorcee with two children, ages 22 and 18. She wants to increase her sales as well as her income.

She is asking for $500 as additional capital to buy more goods (artificial hair, cosmetics and others) to meet the needs of her increasing customers.

loans.use: To buy more goods (artificial hair, cosmetics) to meet the needs of her increasing clientele.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Araceli is a hardworking woman who likes to fight for her family. A year ago she started selling cosmetics by catalog, in order to help her husband with the household expenses. Little by little her clientele has grown as have her sales, which has allowed her to help support the family. Her husband is a construction worker and his income is not sufficient to cover the needs of their child.

Presently Araceli has several pending orders. As she doesn’t have the money to buy the products to meet those orders, she is requesting a loan of $375, which she will repay in six months. With your help, Araceli will be able to help her family advance.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Araceli es una mujer a quien le gusta luchar por su familia. Hace 1 año comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Poco a poco ha ido haciéndose de clientes y eso ha logrado que ella venda más y ayude con los gastos, ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero y lo que gana no es suficiente para pagar todo lo que necesita su hijo.

Actualmente Araceli tiene varios pedidos pendientes. Puesto que no cuenta con recursos suficientes para poder surtirlos, está solicitando un crédito de US $375, que está dispuesta a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Araceli podrá ayudar a que su familia salga adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Caro

texts.en: Caro I. is a 39 year old woman, who is married and lives in Benin City with her husband and 5 children. She sells women's clothing, shoes and bags. She needs a loan of $1200 to buy more women's clothing, shoes & bags for sale, which, she said, will enable her to retain her customers. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past 3 years and has been a dedicated client. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothing, shoes and bags for sale

loans.name: Huon Sum Group

texts.en: Mrs. Huon S. was born in 1967 and now lives in Svay Kambet Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is married and has three children, one is a garment worker and the other two are students. She is the group leader of a four member group. She is a subsistence farmer and works in the field near her house. Her husband, Vy Thy, is a security guard.  However, his salary is not good enough to support the expenses of the family. Last year, Mr. Vy Thy was ill and could not work, which made things more difficult. This household never received a loan from MFI before.  This loan will allow Mrs. Huon S. to finish building the house she has started on.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Thirty-year-old Man M. lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has a unique business selling lotus flowers and has been doing so since 1999. The lotus is an important cultural symbol in Khmer culture and has even influenced much of their architecture. She earns $5 US per day selling this special flower. Tep Kan, her husband, is a provincial farmer. He earns less than $1 US per day doing back-breaking work in the rice fields. They have six children, and proudly have seen two of them married. Three of the remaining children are students, and one is now a construction worker. Man M. cares for her children’s futures and she wants to see her son obtain more and more jobs in construction work (which is often a freelance profession). She hopes to purchase a small motorbike that he can use for his commutes.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Mrs. Doris G. B. is a partner of the Community Bank, "Santa Isabel," and lives in the San Martin region, district and province of Picota, in the Nueva Union village. She has a store where she sell general goods, products of everyday needs, household cleaning and personal hygiene products.

Her business is located in her own home in Jiron Union village. She believes in order to keep her clientele it is necessary to keep her business well supplied and maintain good service towards her customers. Before she sold "agaujes" (a local fruit) and chicken, which did not go well. So she decided to try this new business, and thanks to the loan that she received, her business is now growing and doing better.

With a loan of $525, which she will return in 6 months, she will buy goods such as: rice, bags of sugar, canned goods, like milk, of different brands and sizes, canned fish in boxes, pallets of eggs, packaged bread, litres of cooking oil, packaged soda pop, sweets, household cleaning items, and personal hygiene products, so that she can supply her business and meet the needs of her customers.

Doris is a young woman of 29 years, lives with her husband and 3 children, one boy and two girls. She is very proud of herself for having achieved all that she has in such a short time, which is fruit of her constant effort and dedication.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Doris Guzmán B. socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Isabel” vive en la Región San Martín Provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, Caserío de Nueva Unión, ella tiene una Bodega donde vende abarrotes en general, productos de primera necesidad, aseo personal y para el hogar. su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa situado en el Jirón Unión del mismo caserío. Considera que para mantener a sus clientes hay que surtir bien el negocio y tener buen trato hacia ellos, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de aguajes, pollo y no le fue muy bien, entonces decidió probar en este nuevo negocio, gracias al préstamo que le dieron, está implementando más y mejor su negocio. Con el crédito recibido de S/.1,500.00 que lo devolverá en 6 meses, comprará productos como arroz, azúcar en sacos, productos enlatados como leche de diferentes marcas y tamaños, conservas de pescado en cajas, huevos en javas, panes en bolsas, aceite en litros, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas, productos para la limpieza del hogar y de aseo personal para así surtir su negocio y cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. La señora Doris, es una mujer joven de 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, un varón y dos mujeres, se siente muy orgullosa de si misma por haber logrado todo lo que tiene en poco tiempo ya que es fruto de su constante esfuerzo y dedicación.

loans.use: Compra al por mayor de productos diversos (abarrotes)

loans.name: Mayram

texts.en:
Mayram T. is the 44-year-old mother of two children. Because her husband was not able to find work locally, he has left for Russia to find a job there. Mayram and her husband are determined to work hard to get ahead and ensure a good future for their children. For the last 12 years, Mayram has run her own business selling shoes. As she has become more involved in her work, she has even begun dreaming of opening up her own store.

Today, she sells shoes for teenagers and men in a store located in her town's central market. Mayram is a friendly and polite woman, and is trying to diversify the range of goods she has to sell so that she can satisfy the needs of clients with various levels of income. Her business is doing well, and Mayram is able to make a considerable contribution to her family's budget, but her children are growing up and expenses are rising. She wants to expand her business to meet the needs of her children. To make this possible, she is seeking a loan for $1,000 to buy late-summer shoes to sell. She will repay the loan within four months. Mayram thanks everyone who supports her, and promises to repay this loan in the same manner that she has repaid previous ones.

loans.use: To buy new goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer A. is 25 year old single lady. She dropped out of school for lack of financial support. She decided to learn a trade to earn a living. She now runs a clothing shop and sells ladies and children wears like blouse and skirts, batik tie and dye, lingerie, underwear, slippers and dressing bags for the past five years. She has insufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase lingerie, underwear, dressing bags and slippers.

loans.name: Thu Ha's Group

texts.vi:
Lê Thu Hà, sinh năm 1973 (Ms 10060007). Chị tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.876.000 vnđ để mở rộng kinh doanh cửa hàng bán mỹ phẩm. Chồng chị là lái xe, hai con chị còn nhỏ. Thu nhập bình quân cùa gia đình chị khoảng 4.000.000 vnđ / tháng. Chị vốn là người có ý thức tốt và có trách nhiệm nên trong nhóm ai cũng tin tưởng chị. Vợ chồn chị rất thích vốn vay trả dần và mong muốn tham gia vay vốn lâu dài tại tài chính vimô Binh Minh. Trong nhóm vay của chị còn có:
Nguyễn Thị Hạnh, sinh năm 1978 (Ms 10060017), tham gia vay mức vốn; 2.204.000 vnđ để đi chợ.
Lưu Thị Huyền, sinh năm 1982 (Ms 10060007), tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư mở rộng hiệu may đo.
Nguyễn Thị Thúy Huyền, sinh năm 1982 ( Ms 10060008), tham gia vay vốn mức: 4.028.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn, gà.
Trần Thị Phượng, sinh năm 1986 (Ms 10060009), tham gia vay mức vốn: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng bán đồ ăn sang(xôi, phở, bánh mì)
texts.en:
Mrs. L. Thu Ha (Ms 10060007), born in 1973, would like to borrow 4,876,000VND to expand her cosmetic store. Her husband is a driver, and her children are still small. Her family's average monthly income is 4,000,000VND (about 242USD). Mrs. Ha is a righteous and responsibL. person so all the group members trust in her. Her husband and she really like the installment basis of payment and thus, would like to continue borrowing through the SEDA Fund. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. N. Thi Hanh (ID Number 10060017), born in 1978, borrows 2,204,000VND to do business.
  • Mrs. L. Thi Huyen (ID Number 10060007), born in 1982, borrows 4,452,000VND to expand her tailoring shop.
  • Mrs. N. Thi Thuy Huyen (ID Number 10060008), born in 1982, borrows 4,028,000VND to raise livestock (pigs and chickens).
  • Mrs. T. Thi Phuong (ID Number 10060009), born in 1986, borrows 4,028,000VND to invest in her breakfast eatery (selling glutenous rice, rice noodles, and bread).

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding cosmetic store

loans.name: Yon Dial 2 Group

texts.fr: Palmarin (http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarinfr.php) est un village riche en fruits et légumes mais l'absence de structures spécialisées dans la transformation pousse à importer des jus de fruits et légumes dans la communauté à des prix exorbitants. C’est pourquoi, les femmes confrontées aux difficultés d’écoulement et de conservation de produits frais (choux, tomates, carotte) viennent auprès de kiva solliciter un prêt pour créer une unité de transformation locale des fruits et légumes. Le produit fini (jus de fruits et concentré de légumes), elles pourront approvisionner les établissements touristiques et satisfaire la demande des populations en grande quantité
texts.en:
Palmarin (http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarinfr.php) is a village rich in fruits and vegetables. Nevertheless, lack of structures specialized in transformation incite people to import fruit and vegetables juices at very high cost. This why this group of women, confronted with difficulties in conserving and disposing of fresh products (cabbages, tomatoes, carrots) are seeking a Kiva loan to create a local fruit and vegetable transformation unit. They will sell the transformed products to touristic businesses and meet a large customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a fruit and vegetable transformation unit

loans.name: Happy R.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Happy M. from Mbeya, married with three children between the ages of two and six. Happy has been running a butchery business since 2003 buying cows and selling the meat to consumers. Assisted by her husband, she works at the business five to eight hours per day, six days per week and earns about $150 each month from her business.

She is now requesting a loan of $650 in order to expand her operations. Happy thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
This is Romana S Mruma. She is 28 years old. She is married with two children aged between 1 and 13 years. She has been running a grocery business since 1999. She is assisted by one employee and her husband in running this business. She is working seven days per week and 14 hours per day. In order to expand her business, she is requesting a loan of 1025 USD so that she can purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, wheat flour, kerosene, sugar and other items for her grocery. In future she is planning to open another business. She thanks for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, wheat flour, kerosene, sugar and other items for her grocery

loans.name: Faamanatuga

texts.en: Faamanatuga L., 54, is married with 9 children. She has many years of experience in a vegetable garden business. She sells to the general public 5 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Faamanatuga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers, taro tops and farming equipment to use in the vegetable garden.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, weed killer, seeds, knives, and taro tops to start a taro plantation

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamín L. vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos en la calle Nueva America de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, la actividad que el realiza es la compra de obras de arte de pintores famosos las cuales las restaura y las vende a mayor precio de esta manera genera sus ingresos y puede mantener a su familia, trabaja con museos y personas que coleccionan pinturas coloniales, el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital ya que las obras de arte son caras.

No es cliente de Impro, pero por la actividad califica para obtener un crédito
texts.en:
Benjamín L. lives with his wife and two children in the city of La Paz. He buys paintings from famous painters, then restores the works of art and sells them for a profit. This is how he earns enough money to maintain his family. He works with museums and people who collect colonial art. The loan that he is requesting will be used as business capital because the paintings are expensive.

He does not have a history with Impro, but his business activity qualifies him to request a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase business capital

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo es soltero vive con su mama. Se inicio en la actividad, una ferretería y tienda de materiales de construcción, con un pequeño capital que su papa le había dejado como herencia después de su muerte.  
El fue juntando su dinero y aumentando cada día más el volumen de su negocio.-
Están  en su local propio es un lugar muy concurrido por  encontrarse en el centro mismo de la cuidad de Hernandarias.-
Según las referencias que conseguimos es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable.-
texts.en:
Guillermo is single and lives with his mother. He opened his hardware and building materials store with monies he inherited from his father when his father died. He saved his money and every day added to his stock to expand his store. His store is in a very busy meeting place in the very centre of the city of Hernandarias. According to the references we obtained, he is a very hard-working and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sand, bricks and other items, and building materials

loans.name: Yánex Edilu

texts.es:
La señora Yánex Edilu, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas”, vive en el Jr. Augusto B. Leguia Cdra. 12, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 47 años y es madre de 2 hijos, los 2 independientes. 

Se inició, con S/. 300.00 y fue por iniciativa propia decidió emprender su negocio y empezó vendiendo productos de belleza.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de Refrigerios, cuenta con un Kiosco especialmente  acondicionado en el paradero de camionetas y autos a los demás provincias de la región.

Con el préstamo de S/3,000.00 que cancelará en un  plazo de 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando sus productos de insumos como papayas, piñas, bananas, maracuyas, veterragas;  para la preparación de sus jugos, también comprando insumos para preparar sus tortas, cremas y como harina y azúcar en sacos, huevos en javas y otras esencias, productos muy requeridos  por su gran cliente que son los pasajeros en transito.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que ahora es muy independiente, seguro y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Yánex Edilu, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Yánex Edilu belongs to the community bank "United Women" and lives at Jr. Augusto B Leguia Cdra. 12, Bellavista district, San Martin state. She is single, 47 years old, and a mother of 2 children, both of whom support themselves. With an initial loan of S/ 300, she decided to start her own business selling beauty products. Currently, she sells sandwiches from a special stand located by the bus and car stop most frequently visited in the region. With this loan of S/ 3,000, to be paid in 6 monthly installments, she will invest in her business by purchasing papayas, pineapples, bananas, and other fruits for the juices she prepares. Also, she would like to purchase items to preparte sandwiches and soups, like flour, sugar, eggs, and other necesities for her big client base. She makes her decisions based on what is profitable for her business. Personally, she feels more independent, secure, and responsible with her monthly financial obligations. Yánex Edilu expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase papayas, pineapples, bananas, and other fruits as well as flour, sugar, eggs, and other necesities for her sandwiches and soups.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis A. is 28 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are currently in the basic school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Mavis is a baker. She bakes and supplies bread to food vendors (mostly beverage sellers). She says she also distributes to retailers in her community. Mavis procures the raw materials such as bags of flour, margarine, sugar, etc., from wholesalers in the nearby towns. 

She has been in business for 12 years and wants a loan to procure ingredients in bulk. She hopes to give her children the needed support she can give them to further their education.

loans.use: To procure bags of flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta T., 75, is married with 10 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the general store business. She sells to the village people/public 6 days per week. She has had 6 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about US $165).  SPBD loans are Ruta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She use her loan to restock goods in her store, improve her home, and for children's school fees.

loans.use: Store inventory, home improvement, school fees

loans.name: Mawaou

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier de « bè gbegnedi », elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits cosmétiques et divers, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, ce commerce marche bien pour elle et la plupart de ses clients sont des coiffeuses. Elle a commencé ce commerce l’année dernière. Elle veut agrandir son stock et sollicite par conséquent un crédit pour acheter  plus de produits cosmétiques et réaliser d’importantes recettes. Elle est mariée et a 1 enfant. C’est avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce qu’elle contribue aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a woman who resides in the “Bè Gbegnedi” district. She earns an income from commerce in cosmetics and various items. She gets her supplies at the grand marketplace of Lomé. Her business is going well for her. Most of her customers are hairdressers. She started this business last year. She wants to expand her inventory and is therefore requesting a loan to buy more cosmetic products and to realize a significant income. She is married and has a child. With what she earns from her commerce, she helps cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Elie, a 45 year-old married man. He and his wife have 3 children of the following ages: 9, 7 and 1, and 4 orphans. This entrepreneur lives in Jabana sector, Gasabo district of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda.

Mr. M. owns a barbershop in his neighborhood called Jabana in Kigali city. He started this business in the year of 2006 and he has 4 workers who run this business. This entrepreneur has a monthly profit of approximately $120 and his wife produces an income of $165 per month.

Mr. M. is requesting his first loan worth 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company. With this loan M. will expand his barbershop by buying other required equipment in order to be able to provide services to women. He intends to reinvest the increased profit in the same business.

This entrepreneur’s daily business starts at 7:00 A.M and finishes at 9:00 P.M.

loans.use: Expand the business.

loans.name: France

texts.es:
La señora France, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco”, ubicada en la ciudad de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 33 años, es madre soltera con 01 hijo, tiene estudios de educación superior completa (educación y auxiliar de contabilidad). 

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00, compró caramelos, galletas, chocolates, yogurts y otros.

Actualmente solocita un préstamo de S/. 500.00, para poder invertir en su negocio de venta de golosinas, utilizara el dinero para comprar golosinas como: chocolates, galletas, caramelos, yogurts y gaseosas.

A ella le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, la unión de sus compañeras y el buen trato de la Promotora. Su mayor sueño es poder comprarse una casa en la Rinconada.
texts.en:
Ms. France is a member of communal bank “Cristo Blanco” (White Christ) which is located in the city of Juliaca, in the San Roman province, district of Puno. She is 33 years old, is a single mother with one son, and finished college (in education and as an accounting assistant).

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the past two years with an initial loan of 300 Soles (Peruvian currency), with which she bought candy, cookies, chocolates, yogurt, and other items.

She is currently requesting a loan of 500 Soles to invest in her sweets business. She will use the money to purchase chocolates, cookies, candy, yogurt, and soda.

She likes the meetings of her communal bank, the unity between members, and the loan officer’s good treatment. Her greatest dream is to be able to buy herself a house in La Rinconada.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of sweets such as chocolates, cookies, candy, yogurt, and soda.

loans.name: Kishwar Rasheed Ahmad Group
loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: Cucilda

texts.en:
Cucilda B. is 38 years old and has been an elementary school teacher for the past 16 years. She has spent the majority of her life in Boane, Mozambique. After the 12th grade Cucilda was forced to stop studying and begin working. She was trained to be a teacher at the Mozambican Institute of Education. As a teacher Cucilda makes MT 4,627 a month and is able to save a little bit each month. 

Cucida is requesting this loan to help finance the construction of her home. This will be the second loan she has taken out with Hluvuku for this reason. She successfully paid back her previous loan and has begun construction on her home.

Cucilda is the married and is the mother of two children. She also supports two  nieces that live with her. Her dream is to finish construction of her home and to take out another loan to start a small business. 

About housing loans in Mozambique: In rural Mozambique many people still do not live in proper homes. Years of civil war and economic shocks have inhibited residents from accessing capital and buying building materials for their homes. The last several years have been relatively prosperous and many residents are using microfinance as a means to commence construction of their home.

loans.use: Construction Materials

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Josefa es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Josefa vende leña en su casa, la leña lo adquiere en los diferentes pueblos de la región, además Josefa junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el cual realizan transporte de carga.
Josefa necesita un préstamo de 3500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña y para cambiar los neumáticos de su carro.
Josefa sueña con que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Josefa is a member of the village bank "Amauta."

Josefa is married, 40 years old, and has three children. Josefa sells firewood from her house, which she obtains in various towns of the region. Additionally, Josefa and her husband have a car which they use to transport cargo.

Josefa needs a loan of 3500 soles to invest in buying wood and changing the tires of her car.

Josefa's dreams are that her children finish their studies and can become professionals and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood and change the tires on her car

loans.name: Hech

texts.en:
Hech N., age 23, is married and has a young child. She lives with her husband and her child in the Takeo province. She is engaged in a business of selling Cambodian traditional cakes made from palm fruit, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is employed in a private club in the city, earning an income of $2 per day. 

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, N. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, N. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike and its trailer to transport her cakes to sell in the village and other nearby places. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to raise a good standard of living.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike and its trailer

loans.name: Inocensia

texts.en:
Inocensia B. operates a room rental business for private employees. She is 52 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. Inocensia has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Inocensia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC, Inocensia is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This will be her sixth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve a business

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.fr: K. Clotilde est née en 1980 à Covè au Sud du Bénin. Mariée à LOKO Martin un chauffeur, Clotilde est mère de deux enfants. Clotilde réside depuis six ans à Abomey-Calavi, au Sud du Bénin. Seul le conjoint de Clotilde supporte les charges de la famille. Clotilde exerce une activité de vente de sachets emballages qu’elle achète au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Clotilde a déjà dix ans d’expérience dans ce domaine. Clotilde ambitionne devenir financièrement autonome et renforcer son fonds de roulement. C’est pour cette raison que Clotilde s’est rapprochée de ALIDé pour obtenir un crédit.
texts.en:
Clotilde K. was born in 1980 in Covè, Southern Benin. Married to Martin Loko, a chauffeur, Clotilde is the mother of two children. She has lived for the past six years in Abomey-Calavi, in Southern Benin. Clotilde and her husband alone are responsible for the family's finances. She works selling gift bags which she buys in Togo, the country next to Benin. Clotilde has ten years of experience working in this domain. She would like to become financially independent and build up her working capital. It is for this reason that she has approached Kiva partner Alidé to request a loan.

Translated from French by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing dozens of gift bags

loans.name: Ty

texts.en: Ty T., 46, is a widowed farmer who lives with her two children. Living in the Takeo province, she typically makes US$1 every day and is aided by her daughter who works in a garment factory. The Takeo area has not seen favorable weather conditions for farming this past year. Along with increased inflation, it has been a difficult year economically in much of Cambodia. As a farmer, Ty T. is taking a lot of the brunt of the economic downturn. That is why she has approached CREDIT with a request for a loan. Ty T. is asking for a loan of US$300 to purchase fertilizer and a motorbike for her daughter to commute to work, a purchase that she sees as a good opportunity to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and a motorbike.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma D. is a fish vendor in Dauis, Panglao. The income she receives from her business supports the studies of her three children, the eldest being 18 years old. She works hard so that her children will have a good future.

Gemma joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to ask for financial support for her business with a low interest rate. She’s requesting a loan of Php 10,000 as additional capital to continue with her business.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie B. is married to Romeo B., who works as a carpenter. They are blessed with four children and they are happily residing in Culalabat, Cauayan City, Isabela. Rosemarie has been engaged in the hog raising business for three months. Her net profit every time she disposes of one hog is Php3,000. Recognizing the potential for success of the business, Rosemarie is requesting a loan of Php6,000 from KIVA lenders for her to continue to manage it. This is her 3rd loan cycle. She plans to use the loan to buy  feed and for the improvement of her pig pens.To gain more income for her family, Rosemarie also provides laundry services for her neighbors to have an alternative source of income.

loans.use: To buy hog feed and materials for the improvement of pig pens

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is a 39-year-old married man and the father of three school-aged children. Since 1999 he has owned a bee business, producing honey and delivering it to shops and customers. Today, Jihad is asking for a loan of $1,200 USD to buy an additional quantity of bees to increase his business productivity.

loans.use: To buy an additional quantity of bees

loans.name: Yndira

texts.es:
La señora YNDIRA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUEVA LUZ DEL MAÑANA” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco del Departamento del Cusco. Es conviviente, tiene 29 años y tiene tres hijos: Vidal Antonio tiene once años y esta en el nivel primario en el sexto grado, Juan Carlos esta en el nivel primario en el tercer grado y Estafany tiene 3 meses de nacida.     

La socia trabaja en una empresa privada donde realiza la labor de hacer cotizaciones. Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motiva abrir su propio negocio de imprenta con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar. Ya son varios años en el trabajo y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su labor. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades. La socia requiere el préstamo para implementar su imprenta comprando maquinaria, papeles y tintas. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Miss Yndira is a member of the "Nueva Luz del Mañana" Communal bank of the Arariwa Association in the Cusco province. She lives with her partner, is 29 years old and has three children: Vidal Antonio is 11 years old who is studying the 6th grade, Juan Carlos in the 3rd grade, and Estafany who is 3 months old. The partner works for a private company where she does the pricing. Her character and the wish to fulfill her dreams motivated her to open her own printing business whose profits would contribute to the economic income of her home. She has already been working for some years and she has done well thanks to the dedication to her work. Our partner is a working and entrepreneurial mother that brings her family forward despite adversity. The partner needs the loan to start her printing business by purchasing machinery, paper and ink. The partner is very thankful for the opportunity given to her through this means and is committed to pay according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase machinery, paper and ink

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane J. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City. She is 36 years old, is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Mary Jane is just starting this retail business.

In 2005, Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the tenth loan that she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Ouk S., 53, is married and lives with her two school-aged children in Kompongcham Province, Cambodia. S. is working within the agriculture sector, raising pigs. She also sells ice-filled sweet syrup, earning an income of $7 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been with this business since 2008. Her husband is an officer for a tax-collection department in the province, earning an income of $9 per day to help assist his family. 

S. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, S. is requesting a loan of $600 from CREDIT, a Kiva partner. She wants to use the loan to hire people to help her grow banana trees on a 5-hectare plot of farmland. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To hire people to help her family grow bananas trees

loans.name: Vinh's Group

texts.en:
Vĩnh Thị Kiều is 52 years old. (id: 010103080006). She has three children. She lives in Nghia Vu village, Duc Tu, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her husband and her children. She and her husband are farmers. They also breed pigs and poultry. They have a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. She feels happy when she is taking part in SEDA because  ,she can save money daily, weekly easily. This time, she needs 5,450,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
  About the other borrowers in her group: 
 Lụt Thị Nguyễn is 56 years old. (id: 010103080010).  She is breeding pigs. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND to buy food for pigs.
 Lượng Thị Nguyễn is 58 years old. (id: 010103080008). She sells vegetable and pork in the market. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VDN  for her small business.
 Nguyên Thị Lê is 49 years old. (id: 010103080012). She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
 Lan Ngọc Nguyễn is 39 years old. (id: 010103080011).  She sells electric equipment. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her electric shop.

loans.use: To breed pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento PRIMAVERA esta compuesta por una mesa directiva que esta formada por:

La Sra. Antonia, es la Presidenta,  tiene la actividad económica de venta de coca por taquis y por raleo, vive en la casa de sus padres y actualmente lleva los gastos de la familia, ella es soltera y esta estudiando, su deseo de ella es salir profesional y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida, el dinero del credito es para la compra de sacos con coca para luego poder vender a un costo mas elevado.

La Sra. Maria Esther es la tesorera tiene la atividad de venta de comida en el mercado de la coca actualmente ella colabora al  sustento de su familia, es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos que ella sola saca adelante, es muy trabajadora y con el dinero de la coca quiere comprar abarrotes para la elaboracion de sus comidas.

La Sra Nancy es la Secretaria de Actas su actividad es la venta de ropa nueva y calzados a pedido en su domicilio. 

Estas tres personas  son la Cabeza del Banco de Emprendimiento MI PRIMAVERA que estan constituidas por  diez personas quienes se garantizan mutuamente, porque se conocen y saben que es la garantia solidaria, mancomunda e indivisible todas viven en La zona de las Delicias ubicada a tres cuadras de Villa Fátima. Son Madres de famila Responsables y dispuestas a sacar adelante su familia y su negocio.
						
Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The board of directors for the PRIMAVERA communal bank group is composed of: Antonia, the president, works selling coca by the taque and raleo (units of measure). She lives in her parent's house and currently is responsible for the family's expenses. She is single and a student; her wish is to become a professional in order to improve her quality of life. The money from the loan is for the purchase of bags of coca with the goal of selling them at a higher price. Maria Esther is the treasurer and sells food in the coca market. Currently, she is providing the family's income. She is a single mother of two children that she is raising alone. She is very hardworking and with the loan money she wants to buy ingredients for the preparation of her food dishes. Nancy is the secretary and works selling new clothing and shoes by order in her house. These three are the board of directors of the PRIMAVERA communal bank group, which is composed of 10 people that mutually guarantee each other's loans because they know each other and know that it is an indivisible community bond. They all live in the Delicias zone located three blocks from Villa Fátima. They are mothers of responsible families and are ready to push ahead their families and businesses. All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown by the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos 2 Group

texts.en:
Bladimir is the coordinator of his group Unidos Venceremos (Together We Will Overcome), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Bladimir’s group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, an area dominated by the sugarcane industry and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his longterm partner and their two children.

Bladimir is excited to be taking his fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business running a small cafeteria by purchasing sugar, oil, rice, beans and some perfumes to sell on the side.

Bladimir will use the profits to invest in saving towards a vehicle which will help his business and family at the same time. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil, rice and beans for his cafeteria plus perfumes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost his businesses

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 26 years old and married with a two year old child.  She runs a boutique at Rongata Rongai a few kilometers from the capital city Nairobi. With her income she assists her husband with the household expenses.   She has been in this business for one year and hopes to grow the business into a wholesaler in the future.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy clothes for sale.  She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos. Reside en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en la localidad de Palmapampa, donde tiene su casa propia.

Apenas terminó la escuela primaria debido a que su familia no tenía recursos económicos y por le problema de inestabilidad debido al terrorismo en su zona. Años después logró establecerse con tranquilidad en su comunidad, se casó y tuvo hijos; pero pasó mucha necesidad y falta de dinero antes de lograr implementar su tienda de abarrotes. 
Ahora se siente contenta por lo que viene realizando, pues la experiencia vivida le enseñó a visualizar las oportunidades frente a los problemas. Establecida en su negocio, anhela ampliar su tienda de abarrotes obteniendo nuevos productos, pero en mayores proporciones, para vender al por mayor y menor. 
Su tienda está en su propia localidad y en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, quienes son la razón de seguir esforzándose con el pasar del tiempo.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente agradecida con la institución por la oportunidad que le brindan, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas; además agradece a su banco comunal por la responsabilidad que tienen cada uno de sus socios. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en la compra de más productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 31 years old, a single mother and has three children. She resides in the beautiful Ayacuchana forest, located in the Palmapampa locality, where she has her own home. She barely finished primary school due to her family's economic resources and the instability caused by terrorism in her area. Years later, she was able to establish herself in her community. She got married and had children, but she went through many years of turmoil and challenges before she successfully opened her grocery store. Nowadays, she is happy with what she has accomplished. Her experience taught her to visualize the opportunities when confronted with problems. Well-established in her business, she hopes to expand her shop by obtaining new products but in larger bulks, in order to sell more at a cheaper price. Her store is located in the same locality where she lives and on occasion she receives help from her children, whom are the reason for why she continues to work hard. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very grateful for the opportunity that the bank gives her and she promises to pay back the determined loan payments. In addition, she is grateful for the responsibilities that the communal bank gives to each one of its members. She plans to invest the money that she is applying for on purchasing basic products to stock her store with.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Mrs. Thach Eam Village Bank Group

texts.en: These fourteen people live in Ping Pong village in Kandal province and they have requested a village bank loan. Mrs. Thach E. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. Each member will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Thach E. is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her children and her husband, Mr. Kao Men, who is a laborer. Although they work hard, their income is low. In order to improve condition her family's living conditions, Mrs. Thach E. is seeking this loan to buy a mother pig to breed, to start a new business. She is a mother of three children who are laborers.

loans.use: To buy a mother pig to breed

loans.name: Noche

texts.en:
Noche A. is from the village of Cabu-an, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 37 years old. Noche is single. To make a living, Noche owns & operates a business venture cultivating fruit trees like coconut fruits and bananas & harvesting its fruit for sale. Noche has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Noche joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Noche is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pesticides and fertilizers. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Noche from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Đặng's Group

texts.en: H. Đặng Thị (20201050065) is a 43-year-old female living in the town of Thị Trấn Chờ, Huyện Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. H. is the group leader of this five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Phú Mẫn 2 Nhóm 12 (Nhóm 12). H. is married and has three adult children. She owns and operates a business raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 2,200,000 VND a month. In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. H. is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND which will again be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 2nd from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Nguyễn Thị D. (0) is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business. 2. Nguyễn Thị D. (0) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business providing recycling services. 3. Nguyễn Thị M. (0) is a 60-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 4. Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** H. Đặng Thị (20201050065) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thị Trấn Chờ - huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phú Mẫn 2 nhóm 12 (Nhóm 12). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 2.200.000 VND. Vào 2009, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị D. (0) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. 2. Nguyễn Thị D. (0) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế. 3. Nguyễn Thị M. (0) là 60 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Henrieta

texts.en:
Henrieta C. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 64 years old. Henrieta is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Henrieta owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily-use products in the local community. Henrieta has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Henrieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Henrieta is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Henrieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Amparo Dicenia

texts.es: Doña Amparo Dicenia D. C. de 30 años de edad es una madre de 4 hijos. Amparo se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion en la colonia Bello Horizonte en El Triunfo Choluteca. Por medio de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo han logrado mantener a sus hijos en la escuela. Amparo se dedica a la iglesia en su tiempo libre. Con el prestamo, Amparo podra comprar mas productos para tener mas surtida su pulperia. Amparo utilizara las ganacias para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar y sacar mas adelante a su familia que es lo mas importante para ella.
texts.en:
Amparo Dicenia Dávila Chavarría, 30, is the mother of four children. She has a small grocery store in her home where she sells general use items. She lives in the Bello Horizonte neighborhood in El Triunfo, Choluteca. With profits from her work and help from her husband she has managed to keep her children in school. In her spare time, Amparo is involved in church-related work. Amparo will use the loan to buy more stock items for her store so that she can have it better stocked. She will use the profits to cover household expenses and to get her family ahead in life which is the most important thing for her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted groceries.

loans.name: Carimatou

texts.fr: Née en 1972, A. Carimatou vit depuis une quinzaine d'année à Tanto, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Carimatou est mère de quatre enfants, dont seulement un est encore à sa charge. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Carimatou est une veuve qui vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Carimatou a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Carimatou vend des produits de soins et de beauté, de même que des divers (sucre, allumettes, etc.) à son domicile. Carimatou achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Carimatou sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d'accroîre sa clientèle. Le premier crédit dont Carimatou avait bénéficié a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Born in 1972, Carimatou A. has been living for about 15 years in the Tanto district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Carimatou is the mother of four children, of whom only one is still in her care. Some of the children go to school. Carimatou is a widow; she lives on her own and supports herself. She has had very little formal education. In order to provide for her needs, she sells personal care and cosmetic products, as well as other miscellaneous items (sugar, matches, etc), out of her home. Carimatou sells her products in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. This is the second time that Carimatou is seeking a loan from ALIDE in order to expand her business and grow her customer base. Her first loan has been duly repaid.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing personal care products and cosmetics

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; La socia esta ubicada en el barrio de Arcopata, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago , provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Adelaida; ella tiene 33  años de edad y es casada tiene 2  Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de lavandera, ella estudio la secundaria incompleta, La socia también vende productos de belleza por catalogo y tenerlos en reserva para sus futuras ventas, ella aprovecha cada oferta y las compra. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza por catálogos. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a part of the “Vamos Juntos” (We Go Together) communal bank. She lives in the Arcopata neighborhood, within the Santiago province, in the Cusco department. Adelaida is 33 years old, married and has 2 children. She did not complete junior high school and works as a washerwoman. She also sells beauty products through a catalog and keeps some on hand for future sales. She takes advantage of every special offer when she buys them. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy more beauty products to keep on hand. She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es de la ciudad de Caacupé, tiene 26 años y actualmente se encuentra trabajando en una empresa que se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, desempeñándose como cajera y vendedora. 
Ella tiene 5 hermanos 2 de ellos aun en etapa escolar y 3 hermanas también mayores de edad que se encuentran trabajando en distintas empresas como empleadas de las mismas. 
Gabriela se encuentra cursando el segundo año de la carrera de Ciencias Administrativas en la Universidad del Norte. 
Gabriela tiene deseos de realizar un curso de Secretariado Ejecutivo para lo cual necesita un pequeño crédito y en la ocasión decidió apostar en la Fundación Paraguaya y solicitar su crédito para solventar los todos gastos del curso.
texts.en:
Gabriela is from the city of Caacupe. She is 26 years old and works as a cashier and saleswoman for a company that sells appliances. Gabriela has 5 brothers and sisters, two of whom are in school. The other 3 are grown and working for different companies where they are paid employees. Gabriela is in the second year of an Administrative Sciences degree at the Universidad del Norte. She would like to take an Executive Assistant course but she needs a small loan to pay the fees. She decided to approach the Fundacion Paraguay to apply for a loan to pay the course fees.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Course fees.

loans.name: Katega Development Group, Mubende

texts.en:
Hard work and a social nature with a sense of determination has made B. Francis of Katega Development Group, Mubende, what he is today. This all began after taking a training course to become a professional tailor.  This has developed his future in the tailoring business which he operates from the Kanyogoga Trading Centre in Mubende. 

This seems to be fulfilling for him as he is in a position to earn 200,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis. This has made the 38-year-old married father of four children able to care for his family's needs as he looks forward to achieving his dream of owning a big business in the area and buying himself more sewing machines.  With this loan he hopes to buy more stock of materials from which he can make good designs for the customers as he looks at future business expansion.

loans.use: For business expansion through buying more material and sewing machines

loans.name: Rosa Vilma

texts.es:
Doña Rosa de 56 años posee una tienda donde ofrece productos para el hogar, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel y vive con su esposo quien le ayudo a iniciar el negocio, ella no tiene un horario fijo para atender a los clientes y por el momento desea invertir en artículos que le son demandados pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para realizar la inversión.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como Maíz, Aceite, Arroz, Frijoles, jabón que son los que más buscan los clientes pues estos son consumidos en todos los hogares.
Con este préstamo crecerá su negocio, atenderá mejor a los clientes pues su inventario estará surtidos de muchos productos; Las proyecciones de Doña Rosa son aumentar sus ventas, recibir mejores ingresos que les permita solventar sus necesidades y mejorar sus condiciones.
texts.en:
Rosa is 56 years old. She owns a store where she offers products for the home. She lives in El Transito, in the San Miguel Department. She lives with her husband, who helped her to start the business. She does not have a set schedule for serving customers. At this time, she wants to invest in the products that her customers want. However, she does not have the capital necessary to make the investments.

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase corn, oil, rice, beans and soap, which are the products asked for and used most often by her clients.

With this loan, she will grow her business and serve her clients better, since her inventory will be better stocked. Rosa’s expectations for the future are to increase her sales, to receive a better income in order to take care of her necessities and to improve her situation.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, sugar

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik M. was born in 1957 in Sarighygh village, Ijevan area. He is married and has three sons: The eldest one is a student, the middle son lives and works in Russia, and the youngest one serves in the Armenian Army. From 1988 until 1992, Edik participated in the Nagorno-Karabakh war conflict.

In 2003, Edik organized his own business: He takes an order and sews clothes. He sews men’s and women’s suits and trousers, and leather outerwear as well. Edik makes clothes from raw materials that he bought himself and he also sews from materials that his clients bring to him. 

Edik says his work is very hard and at the same time, it is very profitable, so he can support his family.

Edik asks for a 300.000 Armenian drams loan to buy raw materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for his business

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
Derlis es de la ciudad de San Ignacio Misiones, tiene 24 años de edad, está estudiando en la Universidad Católica Nuestra Señora de la Asunción en San Ignacio, es un joven luchador y con su espíritu emprendedor ya se encuentra en el 2do. Año de la carrera de ciencias económicas con especialidad en  Administración de empresas y también Ingeniería en Informática que ya está por terminar, a pesar de todos los obstáculos que debió superar continúa con sus estudios. Actualmente se desempeña como cajero en el Banco Continental de la ciudad de San Ignacio.
Solicita el préstamo para los gastos manutención como, pasajes, libros, exámenes que tienen  el estudio.
Derlis agradece este préstamo ya que le ayudará en su estudio y al mismo tiempo podrá contar con referencias crediticias que en el futuro será  de mucha importancia para concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Derlis is from the city of San Ignacio Misiones. He is a 24 year old student attending Our Lady of the Assumption Catholic University in San Ignacio. Derlis is a determined young man with an enterprising spirit. He is already in his second year of study toward a degree in Economics with a specialization in Business Administration. He has already completed studies in Systems Engineering. Despite all the obstacles he has had to face, Derlis is able to continue with his studies. He currently works as a cashier at Banco Continental in the city of San Ignacio.

Derlis is requesting a loan to cover expenses such as travel, books, and exams required for his studies. He is grateful for this loan because it will help him with his education and build up credit references, which will be of great importance in pursuing other projects.

loans.use: Pay for educational expenses such as travel, books, and exams

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery store business. His shop is located in the market. He has been involved in this business for past eight years. Now because there are more grocery stores in the same street he is facing tough competition which is affecting his sales. To overcome this problem, he has decided to sell grocery items in bulk quantity.  Naseem and her husband hope the loan Naseem receives from Asasah will prove helpful for the growth of his business.

Naseem is the mother of two sons and two daughters. None of them could get an education due to poor financial conditions. Both of her sons now work in a hospital for low wages and her daughters stay at home and manage the household chores.  They live in a city named Samundri in Pakistan. Their residence is a three-room brick house.  This is Naseem's first loan application with Asasah. She hopes it will be a profitable experience for her.  

Note: In the photo that accompanies this profile, the woman holding the Asasah Passbook is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy inventory in bulk for a grocery store.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel E. is 26 years old, married, and supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and a fish vending business. She lives in Purok 1, Brgy. Culipapa, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living condition with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.

By working hard in her general store and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Maricel is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can continue to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maricel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell
