loans.name: Erkingul

texts.en:
Erkingul B. is 59, married and has two sons; her eldest lives on his own and the younger one lives with parents and supports them. Erkingul graduated from Trade College and worked as an accountant for 38 years at Kyrgyzmail. Now she is on pension. But being a very energetic person, she decided to start her own business in cattle breeding. With the initial capital of 15,000 KGS, she managed to raise her floating capital to 35,000 KGS and now has a farm with sheep. 

Erkingul is applying for a loan of 60,000 KGS to purchase one milk cow and sheep in order to increase the number of cattle. With the revenues, she plans to pay for her son’s marriage.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Haydee Crisabel

texts.es: Haydee Crisabel A. C. es una persona muy esforzada, quien trabaja muy duro por el bienestar de su única hija de 5 años de edad, Haydee vive junto a ella en el municipio de Sensuntepeque en el departamento de Cabañas. Haydee se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños, y adultos, la cual comercializa en el mercado regional de Sensuntepeque, un mercado bastante grande que cuenta con una gran afluencia de personas. Ella es una madre de familia muy esforzada quien desea mucho que si hija tenga una vida mejor, razón por la que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para invertir en más ropa y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Haydee Crisabel A. C. is a very hard-working person who works hard for the well-being of her only daughter who is 5 years old.  She lives with her daughter in the town of Sensuntepeque, in Cabañas department.

Haydee sells children's and adults' clothes in Sensuntepeque regional market.  This is a large and very busy market.  Haydee is a very hard-working mother who wishes very much for her daughter to enjoy a better life.  She is requesting this loan so that she will have the money she needs to invest in buying more clothes so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia V. is from the village of Miputak. She is 58 years old, widowed, and has 1 adult child. Rosalia operates a family member's business selling different kinds of home products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Rosalia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Rosalia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia G. esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito.  
A la vivienda de la señora Silvia G. le está haciendo falta la elaboración de una barda y terminar los acabados del exterior de la casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora.
Doña Silvia G. es viuda y tiene dos hijos adolescentes baja su responsabilidad y desea lo mejor para ellos.
La señora Silvia trabaja en una casa particular como niñera, este ingreso una parte de esté ingreso será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Silvia G. is grateful to Kiva lenders who helped to fund her previous loan.  She currently needs to build a perimeter wall around her home and to finish off some work to the outside of her house.  However, she doesn't have the money she needs to carry out these improvements.

Silvia is a widow and has two teenage children in her care.  She wants the best for them.  Silvia works as a nanny in a private home.  Some of the income that she makes from this job will be used to pay back her loan.

loans.use: To build a perimeter wall

loans.name: Michael Mwai

texts.en:
Michael is 32 years old and has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. He practises mixed farming, keeping dairy cows and also planting potatoes.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans in full and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow, fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

In the future Michael hopes to practise large scale farming.

loans.use: To  buy a dairy cow, fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is from Al Bayader.  He is a 37-year-old single man who owns a small shop where he repairs car exhaust systems. Ibrahim started his business many years ago and he applying for a loan of JD1800 to purchase new equipment to enlarge his project. His aspiration is to develop his project further,  hiring more employees and increasing his income.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment to develop his project

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha L. is a 37-year-old married lady with four children, all below the age of 18. Asha has been operating a local hotel for the residents of the Barani area in Malindi, Kenya, for the past four years. The business enables her to earn a monthly income of about 6000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses to provide for her family’s needs, such as educating her children. 

Asha requested a loan of 20,000 KES from KADET. This is her third loan from the organization. She intends to use the loan to purchase more serving plates, water jugs, tea cups, tea spoons, and benches for her ever-growing clientele.

In the future, Asha hopes to use the profits from her business to sustain and grow her hotel and to open up a charcoal business near the hotel with a view toward making more money from the two businesses and thereby being able to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase dishware and benches

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Doris, es comerciante, posee un negocio D. fruta y verdura, tiene 45 años D. edad, vive con su familia, tiene dos hijos D. 15 y 16 años D. edad, residen en San Miguel,  el negocio lo tiene instalado en el mercado D. la Cruz hace ya 13 años, ella tiene experiencia en el negocio.
Actualmente doña Doris está solicitando un préstamo, el cual necesita para comprar mercadería (frutas y verduras), ella pretenD. aumentar su inventario y ofrecer a la clientela diversidad D. productos frescos, agradándolos y teniendo mejores oportunidades D. venta.
Su objetivo es trabajar siempre, ayudar a su familia y potenciar cada día el negocio para mejorarlo y ampliarlo.
texts.en:
Doris runs a business selling fruits and vegetables. She is 45 years old and lives with her family. She has two sons who are 15 and 16 years old, and they live in San Miguel. Doris has had a stand in the Cruz market for 13 years, so she has business experience. 

Doris is now asking for a loan to buy merchandise (fruits and vegetables). She would like to increase her inventory and offer her clients a wider variety of fresh products in order to increase sales. 

Her goal is to continue working, to help her family, and to make her business stronger by improving and expanding it.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (fruits and vegetables).

loans.name: Genobeba

texts.es:
La señora Genobeba es socia D. banco comunal Nuevas Amigas D. Distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos.
Lleva 3 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, dinero que lo invierte en la compra de mercadería, todavía tiene 2 hijos que están a su cargo pero que a la vez la ayudan en su casa, atienden a las personas que la visitan para comprar la mercadería que tiene, la misma que trae de lima.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 6 vestidos, 12 pantalones, 6 shores, 2 docenas de polos, 6 camisas, 12 polos para niños, 12 blusas, 6 faldas de jean.
Trabaja para ayudar a su esposo, quien es  empleado público y el dinero que gana no alcanza y es por eso que  tienen que trabajar los dos.  Dos de sus 5 hijos están estudiando una carrera y tienen que solventar todo los gastos, no quiere que les falte nada para que pueden estudiar y ser profesionales.

Hace algunos días la Sra. Genobeba enfermó, por estos días son sus hijos quienes están apoyandola en su negocio.  En la foto se muestra descansando ya que por ahora no puede dedicarse a la venta de su mercadería. (no mostró reparos en salir así)
texts.en:
Señora Genobeba is a member of the Nuevas Amigas (New Friends) Community Bank in Calleria District in Ucayali Department. She is 54 years old, married and has five children.

Genobeba has had loans from Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years. She has used the money to buy merchandise. She still has two children at home who help her in the house as well as serve the people who come to buy the clothing she brings in from Lima.

With this new loan of S/.2,500 she plans to buy six dresses, twelve pairs of pants, six pairs of shorts, two dozen sports shirts, six shirts, twelve children’s t-shirts, twelve blouses, six jean skirts.

Genobeba works so that she can help her husband who is a public employee. The money he earns is not sufficient to support the household so they both need to work. Two of their five children are taking college courses so all their expenses have to be paid for. She does not want them to go without so they can study hard and get good jobs. 

Recently Sra. Genobeba has been ill and her children are helping with the business. In the photo she can be seen resting as she is still not well enough to work.

loans.use: to buy shorts, pants, dresses, shirts etc.

loans.name: Nargiza's Group

texts.en:
Nargiza S. is the leader of this group. She is 42 and married. Her husband is engaged in cattle breeding. Together they are bringing up a son and two daughters. All the children study at school. 

The family cultivates agricultural products to make a living. With money gained from selling the harvest, Nargiza bought a cow and started to sell milk. In this way she earns 6,000 KGS per month. 

She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase more farm animals in order to resell them at the higher price after fattening. In the future, Nargiza wants to provide her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more good quality cloth and different kind of threads

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is from the village of Pahindong, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old. Jocelyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a mini-restaurant, serving a variety of different meals to customers, like adobo, bulalo and afritada, in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $186 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant.

Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients like meat and spices. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat and spices.

loans.name: Jeleta

texts.en: Jeleta is 55 years old, widowed, and has nine children, one of whom attends school.  She is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Jeleta is requesting a loan for 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional livestock.  She has been raising livestock for two years and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Jeleta would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock

loans.name: Loida

texts.en: Loida, 39 years of age, is married to a farmer and is blessed with 1 child. Loida has been operating her food vending business for almost 2 years. She's asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional frozen foods to sell in the public market. Her net income is 12,000 PHP a month. She would like to continue receiving loans of larger quantities in her next loan cycles to further assist in the growth and development of her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Hercilia

texts.es:
Doña Hercilia, vive en una localidad que se llama San Juan  estado de Chiapas. Ella es madre soltera con un  hijo de once años de nombre Orlando Havel en quinto de primaria.

    Ella es ama de casa y se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y legumbres, en donde lleva  tres años y cinco meses, lo que nos platica que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un mejor ingreso en su hogar y solicito el préstamo para comprar más mercancía.
L
    o que lo motivo ha esta actividad fue ella misma  ya que es   una mujer sola que solo depende de ella y para mejorar su ingresos económico decidió poner este  tipo de actividad que si le está dando un buen resultado.

    Lo que más desea es  que con el tiempo ella pueda tener su actividad más  grande  y asi seguir trabajando con el crédito.
texts.en:
Doña Hercilia lives in an area known as San Juan in the state of Chiapas. She is a single mother with an eleven-year-old son named Orlando Havel in the fifth grade. 

She is head of her household and devotes her time buying and selling fruits and vegetables, which she has been doing for three years and five months. She tells us that it is going very well since she has had greater earnings for her household. She requested the loan in order to purchase more merchandise. 

What motivated her to start this business was herself, since she is alone and depends only upon herself. In order to improve her financial earnings she decided to go into this line of business which is in fact producing good profits. 

What she wishes for most is that with time she would have a larger business and thus go on working with the loans.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Santhiaba Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Santhiaba  est créé le 9 décembre 2010, il est composé de dix huit femmes qui habitent le même quartier et font du petit commerce.

Maguette la responsable est âgée de 71 ans; mariée elle est mère de six enfants, elle mène un petit commerce de divers produits; elle capitalise plus 20 ans d'expérience dans ce domaine. Sur la photo elle est tout à fait à droite habillée en boubou khartoum vert blanc.


Elle achéte ses produits (parfum, draps, chaussures, habits,....) dans les grandes villes et revend dans son village.


Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité.

Avec les bénéfices obtenus elle soutient ses enfants pour les dépenses de la famille et compte augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Santhiaba was created on 9 December 2010 and comprises 18 women who live in the same area and run small retail businesses.

Maguette, the leader, is 71 years old, married, and has six children. She runs a small retail business selling various items, and has gained more than 20 years of experience in this field. In the photo, she is all the way on the right, dressed in a green and white khartoum boubou.

She buys her items (perfume, sheets, shoes, clothing,...) in the large cities and re-sells them in her town.

Her loan will allow her to strengthen her business.

With the profits from this business, she provides for her children and intends to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy various items for resale.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina, 55, is married to Julio, a farmer. They lived in the village of Villa Marzo Cordon. The couple is blessed with three children, the eldest of whom is married. The second child has already stopped studying, while the eldest is currently enrolled in high school.

Josefina has been engaged in the hog raising business for almost 20 years and she used to raise three hogs. The family get their income from hog raising and from buying and selling cows. Josefina is thankful that her husband helps her in maintaining their businesses. 

Her family's expenses have increased due to expensive basic commodities. Josefina would therefore like to ask for 25,000 PHP of additional capital. She will use this amount to purchase livestock feed and to buy and sell cows. She hopes her loan request will be granted so that she can increase her income to be able to save some amount to use when she becomes weak.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and to buy and sell cows.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 32 years old, married and the father of one child, an infant. He and his family live in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where he has made a living for the last 10 years by providing transportation services on his motorcycle. He enjoys his work and is happy to provide it come rain or shine, and earns about PHP 4,000 a month. 

Earlier this year, Julius joined GDMPC as a way to improve his business and increase his income. He is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tires and accessories that will allow him to earn a better living. If he can earn enough money, he would like to buy a television so that he can be better informed about what is happening in the world around him.

loans.use: To buy tires and accessories for a transportation business.

loans.name: Sengedorj

texts.en:
Sengedorj is 48 years old and lives with his two daughters and wife in a ger, Mongolian yurt  in Hovd province of Mongolia. His eldest daughter is a college student and the other one is a high school student. His wife works as an assistant researcher at the Power Station. 

Sengedorj started to trade livestock, meat, and hay in 2002. Every year, from August 15th to September 10th, he harvests hay. From August 20th to the end of October, he buys livestock, and then sells his goods and livestock in the spring. He stores meat in a rented warehouse. He has collected much business experience in the last years. He is a diligent man who says "I want to build a warehouse for meat in my fence (yard)." He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock, and gasoline for his tractor to harvest hay.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock, and gasoline for his tractor

loans.name: Patricia Leonor

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal 8 De Diciembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Patricia, tiene 44 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y uno de 11 años, los mayores estudian en universidad y el menor en escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven  con ella.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse la vida y poder darles lo mejor a sus hijos hace 4 años puso una heladería en su casa, ella trabaja con la marca de Helados Pingüino pues dice que son los mejores helados, trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 21h00, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio cuando ella no puede estar allí, nos cuenta además que aquí en su negocio a mas de ganarse el sustento diario también se entretiene y se olvida de todos sus problemas.

Este crédito es para comprar helados en todos los modelos y sabores, tortas heladas, colas entre otras cosas. Lleva 4 años y es la secretaria del grupo y le gusta por la responsabilidad y porque el grupo es muy ordenado.
 
Sus metas son seguir ampliando su local y adecuándole cada vez con mejores cosas para atraer a mas clientela.
texts.en:
The members of the "8 de Diciembre" [Eighth of December] village bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Reales Tamarindos Trees.

This is where we meet Patricia, 44. She's divorced from her husband, with whom she has three children: two grown and one eleven-year-old. The older children are in college and the younger one is in school. They all still live with her.

To earn a living and give the best to her children, our friend Patricia put an ice-cream parlor in her house. She sells Pinguin brand ice creams because they're the best. She works every day from 9AM until 7PM. Her children help her with the business when she can't be there. She also tells us that in addition to providing her a living, the business keeps her busy and she forgets all her problems.

This loan is to purchase all types of ice-cream, treats, ice-cream cakes, sodas, etc.  She's been with her group for four years and is the secretary. She likes it because the group is responsible and organized. 

Her goal is to keep growing her business and stocking it with the right products to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream, ice-cream cakes, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Parcel

texts.en:
Parcel is a 41-year-old businessman, married with six children. He runs a motorcycle transport business to make a living. He has been driving his usual routes for five years. A problem with motorcycle parts has been detected that pushes him to request a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos. This loan will be use to purchase interior and exterior [parts] for his motorcycle. He says this loan could be a big help to fix the problem he's encountered with his motorcycle and  allow him to resume business operations immediately.

In the future, Parcel hopes that he can improve his transportation business so that he can send his children to school and meet their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy interior and exterior part for his motorcycle

loans.name: Lutfullo

texts.ru: Лутфулло  ответственный, честный предприниматель. Он занимается предпринимательством более 4 лет и уже накопил опыт.  Лутфулло работает в  собственном магазине у него всегда  свежий товар и разнообразный ассортимент. Он старается хорошо обслужить каждого клиента. Также Лутфулло любящий  муж и заботливый отец троих  детей. Этим бизнесом он занимается  самостоятельно. Лутфулло хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы был дополнительный доход и семье и развить бизнес, ему нужен займ в размере 3000$ США. Лутфулло надеется, на вашу помощь и поддержку и благодарит вас за помощь.
texts.en: Lutfullo is a responsible and honest entrepreneur.  He has been involved in entrepreneurship for over 4 years and already gained experience.  Lutfullo works at his own store, where he always has fresh merchandise and various assortment.  He tries to serve each customer well.  Lutfullo is also a loving husband and a caring father of three children.  He runs his business independently.  Lutfullo wants to expand his business in order to have additional income for the family and to develop the business.  He needs a loan in the sum of $3000 for this purpose.  Lutfullo relies on your help and support and thanks you for your help.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of products

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella, tiene 64 años y 8 hijos, es casada, es socia D. FINCA Peru desD. hace 15 años.
Aljandrina tiene un Estudio Fotográfico, que es uno D. los estudios mas antiguos D. Ayacucho y es muy recurrido por todo Ayacucho, siempre estuvo en Finca y siempre tuvo su negocio, recuerda que con el primer préstamo pudo comprar una filmadora, y así poco a poco pudo seguir adelante gracias a todas las capacitaciones que ha recibido en temas como el sobreendeudamiento.
Alejandrina esta muy agradecida por el ahorro, por ello pudo cumplir sus metas, como hacer su casa, ahora su meta es poder comprarse una computadora e impresora para las impresión D. las fotos, ahora el préstamo comprara mas papel fotográfico.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the communal bank "Anabella". She is 64 years old and she has 8 children. She is married and she has been a member of Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 15 years.

Alejandrina has a photography studio. It is one of the longest established studios in Ayacucho and it is highly visited by all of Ayacucho. She has always been with Finca and she has always had her business. She recalls that with her first loan she managed to buy a camera and this is how she gradually started to move forward. It is thanks to all of orientation that she has received on topics such as indebtedness.


Alejandrina is very thankful for the savings and it is through them that she has attained her goals, including having a house built for her. Her new goal is to buy a computer and a printer to print photos. The loan will be used to buy photographic paper.

loans.use: to purchase photographic paper

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en: Evelyne is a young lady of twenty-two years. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the tailoring business for five years. Her hardship is the lack of enough capital, and she also dreams of business expansion plus constructing her own house. Evelyne is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: María Ismelda

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 39 años edad, es casada con cinco hijos.
Ella se dedica a la corta D. café desD. los seis años, ese ha sido el trabajo que ha realizado con su familia y ahora con su esposo, también tiene la actividad D. crianza D. cerdos. María es una persona muy trabajadora, sale D. su casa a las 4 D. la mañana a cortar café a unas haciendas situadas a una hora D. su casa y sale a cortar unas 50 libras D. café.
Como se dedica también a la crianza D. cerdos, estos los compra  el día del comercio D. un cantón, ella va a los tiangues (lugar donD. se comercializan animales) a adquirir los cerdos.
María solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 500 tejas y cuartones D. madera, para el techo D. su casa, que es lo que le hace falta para terminar la construcción y para pagarle a una persona, que le ayuD. a su esposo, ya que él es albañil y se encarga del manejo del trabajo.
Con la inversión ellos tendrían el material para el techo D. su casa y no sufrirán con las lluvias que se moje su vivienda. Además vivirán mejor los siete miembros D. la familia, pues cozaran D. seguridad por cualquier eventualidad que se pueda presentar.
En el futuro, María desea continuar construyendo su casa, para que cada miembro D. la familia, tenga una habitación o los varones una habitación y las mujeres otro. Actualmente solo  tienen una habitación para todos ellos, a demás desean repellar las paredes D. la casa, para que se vea más bonita.
texts.en:
María, 39, is married and has five children.  She’s worked picking coffee beans for six years, a job she used to do with her family and now does with her husband.  She also raises pigs.  María is a very hardworking person.  She leaves home at 4am to pick coffee in some haciendas located an hour away from home; she picks about 50 pounds of coffee. Since she also raises pigs she buys them on her canton’s market day at the tianguis [places where livestock is bought and sold].

María is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy 500 roofing tiles and wooden beams for the roof on her house which is all that remains to be done to finish building it.  She also needs to pay a person to help her husband since he’s a bricklayer and he will take care of doing the work.

With this investment, they will have the materials for the roof of their house and they won’t suffer with the rain that can wet their house.  In addition, the seven family members will live better because they will be safe from any possible eventuality.

In the future, María wants to continue building her house so that each member of the family will have their own room or maybe the boys in one room and the girls in another.  They currently have just one bedroom for all of them.  She also wants to plaster the walls so that it will look prettier.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs to repair the roof.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita believes that, "an optimistic person will become successful in the future." She is now 56 years old and has seven adult children. She owns and manages a variety store while her husband works in one of the government institutions. They help each other earn income and support the education of their children. They have endured hardships and problems in life.  As a fruit of their sacrifices, all of their children have become professionals and found  good jobs. All of them are already married and settled down with their own family.

Despite this, Pacita aims to improve and continue the business to earn and save for future emergencies and help some of her cousins who are in need. In this regard, she wants to request a loan of P50,000  to buy soft drinks, junk foods, beverages, soaps, shampoos, noodles and splash products to sell. She believes that her efforts will bear good fruit someday.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, junk foods, beverages, soaps, shampoos, noodles and splash product to sell.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 40, married and has six school-age children. Due to lack of job opportunities, he engages in vegetable production to earn a living and support his family. As a responsible father, he wants to continue sending his children to school so that they will earn a degree and one day, find a good job. 

Although farming is a difficult occupation his strong determination to be successful means he can endure hardships and pursue his business.

Due to financial constraints, he is requesting additional capital of PHP 18,000 to buy the pesticides he needs to maintain vegetable production. 

He believes this loan will enable him to improve the business and ensure a good harvest. He hopes that his patience and hard work will make his dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides needed for the maintenance of his vegetable production business

location.town: Bitnong Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3  children. 

Marisa has a shop that sells clothing like t-shirts, blouses, and slippers. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy stocks like slippers, blouses, and t-shirts to sell.

Marisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks like slippers, blouses, and t-shirts to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married with 2 children. Lilian is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Lilian operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years and every month she earns 1,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in her business.

Lilian has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Lilian hopes to finish the study of her children and to gain a double income from her business.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Fifonsi Aa1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFONSI AA1 est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Germaine Paulette, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Germaine Paulette est âgée de 50 ans et une veuve. Germaine Paulette est mère de six enfants tous scolarisés dont deux restent encore à sa charge. Germaine Paulette vit seule avec ses deux enfants encore à charge et assure seule ses divers besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Germaine Paulette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis une trentaine d’année, Germaine Paulette exerce comme activité, la vente de nourriture au Bénin, et de façon secondaire, la vente de maïs, des charbons de bois. Germaine Paulette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de la famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Germaine Paulette désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Germaine Paulette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFONSI AA1, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: FIFONSI AA1 is a group composed of 3 people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group representative, Germaine Paulette, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Germaine Paulette, 50, is a widow. She is the mother of 6 children, all of whom go to school. Two of them are still her dependents. Germaine Paulette lives with her two dependent children and, alone, provides for herself and her two children. Germaine Paulette never went to school. For about 30 years, Germaine Paulette has been selling food in Benin. In addition to that, she has been selling corn and charcoal. Germaine Paulette buys those items in a market in Benin. This occupation enables her to somewhat easily meet the needs of her family. In order to better meet the needs of her customers, Germaine Paulette would like to increase her stocks, and therefore her business. To that effect, Germaine Paulette, along with the other members of FIFONSI AA1, is applying for this first loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and bags of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a chuffcutter and poultry birds

loans.name: Tulai

texts.en:
Tulai is forty-six years of age and is married with four children. She owns & operates a business venture, selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  Tulai needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to expand the business.

In 2010, Tulai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tulai's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Ricardo Miguel

texts.es:
Ricardo es un joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, Ricardo no ha podido estudiar la carrera de Computación e Informática, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Ricardo trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Ricardo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de dos camas, ya que actualmente él y sus dos hermanos menores comparten la misma habitación donde tienen solo una cama, de esta manera Ricardo podrá brindar mayor bienestar y seguridad para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 19 years old, and he lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings.  He is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person that has a great desire to succeed.  Sadly, due to a lack of economic resources and the need to work to support his parents, Ricardo hasn't been able to study the field of Information Technology, but he would very much like to do so.  In his free time he likes to listen to music and at times cook a delicious seco de pato, a duck leg confit in black beer sauce over cilantro rice, to share with his family.

By his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Ricardo works as a laborer in an agricultural farm in his city.  He works everyday from early in the morning and can do it for approximately 10 hours.  He feels at ease carrying out his work and believes that it's going well because of his good performance and his kind treatment of everyone else.

Ricardo is very thankful to encounter Kiva, since thanks to the help offered he will be able to buy two beds, since currently he and his two younger brothers share the same room where they only have one bed.  In this manner Ricardo can offer greater wellbeing and security to his family, and he will continue working and making an effort to achieve his dream of being a good professional.

loans.use: to buy two beds.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva works hard to support her family. Minerva has a horticulture business in the Philippines.

Minerva requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional equipment for her horticulture business like scissor, nail polish, knee-per, kneel cutter, etc.

Minerva has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for her horticulture business like scissor, nail polish, knee-per, kneel cutter, etc.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a poultry business where he rears and sells poultry. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy poultry feed and other items for the business. His business goal is to expand his poultry business within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be successful.

loans.use: buy poultry feed and other items for his business.

loans.name: Bella Luna Group

texts.en:
20 minutes outside of the city of Santa Cruz El Quiché in Northwestern Guatemala, a rural community called Patzité is found, the place where 7 motivated women meet to form the “Bella Luna” trust bank. Between the ages of 20 and 48, most of the ladies were able to study in primary school, and some reached a level of secondary school, as well. Now, several are married, with up to 8 children, and others are single, all of the women running small businesses to build a future for themselves and their families. 

Caterina, the 22-year-old secretary of her trust bank, is single, living with her parents and 9 sisters and brothers. Caterina was only able to achieve a second grade education, and to contribute to her family income, she raises animals to sell. This determined young woman is requesting a loan to buy more chickens, pigs, and turkeys to sell in the local Quiché market .The profits she will gain with this loan will not only improve her own life, but the lives of her family members, as well. 

Caterina and the members of “Bella Luna” trust bank are extremely grateful for Kiva investors who give them access to microloans that enable their businesses to thrive.

loans.use: to buy more chickens, pigs, and turkeys to sell in the local Quiché market

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.en:
My name is Rosibel A. and I sell products for daily use. I have had my business for 3 years and it is very good now that I have my business located in frony of the medical school. My business generates an income that supports my family, my goal is to increase my inventory and to increase sales and with the profits, support my family and most importantly to finance the education of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase juices, sodas, churros, quesadillas, rosquillas, water, ice and sweets.

Mi nombre es Rosibel A. me dedico a la venta de productos comestibles de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio desde hace 3 años y mi clientela es muy buena ya que estoy ubicada frente al hospital escuela, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es poder incrementar mi inventario y tener una mayor venta de productos y con los ingresos que obtenga poder mantener mi familia y lo mas importante darles estudio a mis dos hijos.

loans.use: Compra de jugos en lata, refrescos, churros, quesadillas, rosquillas, agua, hielo, confites,

loans.name: Anar

texts.en:
Anar is a very active and responsible man.
8 years ago he decided to start a small business. This business has allowed his family to have a better income.
Having borrowed $400 he bought foodstuffs.
Now he needs a loan of $700 to expand the area of his store. 
Anar is 29 years old. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Shusha town, settled in Khaladj village, Salyan region. Anar is single.

loans.use: To expand the area of his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by buying more stock of tea.

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en: Marcel  Chuckwu spent five years learning the basics of business from others before opening his own company in 1996.  He is 42 years old, married and lives with his wife and four children in Benin City.  He is confident that he can expand his business, and has come to us for a loan of $750 to make that expansion possible.

loans.use: To buy more materials to sell

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu S. is thirty five years old, married, and a mother of four children.  Musu survives through her business.  She sells local cooked food in the open space in Magburaka town.  She has a good market and is able to purchase her stock on wholesale.  She would like to improve her eating shelter and buy more ingredients.  She is requesting a loan of $200.

loans.use: Improve her restaurant shelter and purchase additional ingredients.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled lives with his wife and his 4 children in the surroundings of Tyre, south of Lebanon. Khaled is a very courageous 39 years old man. His business has been robbed, but that incident did not stop him from starting his business again. He owns a butcher shop where he sells chickens. He needs a refrigerator in which he can stock the chickens for sale. This business is the sole source of income of his family.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for his business

loans.name: Seyfulla

texts.en: Seyfulla is 41 years old. He is married and lives with his 4 children in the small villiage in the southern part of Azerbaijan. He sells dairy products to the local bazaar traders. He started his business in 2001. One cow is not enough to cover all the needs of such a big family. To improve conditions of his life he applied for 900 USD to purchase one milk cow  to increase number of sales, and for fodder for the cow.

loans.use: To purchase milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Venancia

texts.es:
Mrs Venancia is married and has 3 small children. Her husband works as a employee in a refrigeration company in the area. Venancia was a saleswoman of lotteries and games of chance and, thanks to loans offered by the Paraguayan Foundation, she was able to begin her micro-business, a pantry.

Venancia is an enterprising and sacrificing woman. With a lot of effort she has already built up her business. With the profits she was able to build her own house that before was made only of wood and sheets.

She markets all kinds of consumer goods, primarily sugar, milk, noodles, carbonated waters, fruits, and vegetables, among others. Today she requests a new loan with which she will be able to acquire said merchandise in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra Venancia es casada y tiene 3 hijos pequeños; su marido trabaja como empleado en un frigorífico de la zona. Venancia era vendedora de loterías y juegos de azar y gracias a créditos otorgados por la Fundación Paraguaya, ella pudo montar su microempresa, una despensa.

Venancia es una mujer emprendedora y sacrificada, ya que con mucho esfuerzo logro sacar adelante su negocio y con las ganancias pudo construir su propia casa que antes era solo de madera y chapas.

Ella comercializa todo tipo de artículos de consumo primario tales como azúcar, lácteos, fideos, gaseosas, frutas, hortalizas, entre otros. Hoy día solicita un nuevo crédito con el que podrá adquirir dichas mercaderías en grandes cantidades.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sugar, flour, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: César Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Cesar S. lives in the Sabana Grande region, which is an area populated by very needy families. Mr. S. is married and has a 3 year old daughter. Along with his wife, he has a business selling prepared food at night.

Previously they worked in a stand at a market selling brand new clothes. Later on they decided to take a chance and try the business of the "Fritanga". A Fritanga is a street side food stand that sells inexpensive meals to passersby. They rented the stand they had at the market to a family member.

They are doing very well in this new business. They have been able to get ahead and are expanding constantly. They need the loan to purchase a new stove to cook their roasts and to buy foodstuffs to prepare their meals. They hope that the loan will help them attract more customers.

Translated from the Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Don César habita en la comarca Sabana Grande, un lugar con muchas necesidades para las familias que ahí residen. Don César es casado y tiene una pequeña hija de 3 años, junto a su esposa tiene un negocio de venta de fritangas por la noche.

Anteriormente trabajan en un tramo de una Mercado, vendiendo ropa nueva, pero decidieron aventurarse en el negocio de la Fritanga. El tramo que tenían en el mercado se lo alquilan a un familiar de ellos.

El negocio de la fritanga les ha salido muy bueno, han salido adelante y están creciendo constantemente. Necesitan el crédito para comprar una estufa para poner sus asados, y también para comprar alimentos para hacer sus comidas. Esperan poder atraer mayor cantidad de clientes al contar con mayor capital de trabajo.

loans.use: To purchase a stove and foodstuffs

loans.name: Prek Svay I Group

texts.en:
This loan will be shared between 29 members of the Prek Svay I Village Bank in Kandal Province, Cambodia.

Mrs. Chantha N., age 46, is the Village Bank president. She and her husband are farM. and, between the two of them, make around $11 per day. She has five children. Her eldest child works in a factory from 1:00-5:00 p.m. every day, and is also a student. The other four children do not work, but attend school. She would like to request a loan in order to buy fertilizer, as well as food that she would then sell. She would also use the money to support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy food, fertilizer, and support their childrens' education

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga K. is married with two children. She is a small entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. Olga owns a vending kiosk where she sells dishware, souvenirs, and gifts at the Yubileinyi market. She always plans her business policies very carefully, which brings her good profits and helps in the success of her business. Olga has been in this trade for 10 years. Currently, her working capital is about $5,400. Her monthly net profit is about $1,200.

Olga loves working in this sphere of commerce because she believes the gifts and souvenirs she sells bring more smiles and happy moments to people’s lives and make their lives brighter and more diverse. She would like to continue expanding her venture. Today, Olga is requesting a loan of $1000 to increase her turnover capital which she believes will help her be successful in maintaining the stable growth of her business.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Rim Sum Group

texts.en: Mrs. Rim S. was born in 1975 and now lives in Tang Tbeng Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is the group leader of a four member group. Mrs. Rim S. is a farmer and is married to Mr. Vith S., who is a lumberjack. They have four children, two of whom look after the cows while the other two attend school. Last year, Mrs. Rim S. obtained a loan from Brasac Co. Ltd. to buy a rice field. She sold some of  her cows and now would like to buy new ones.  This is why she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy cows to breed

loans.name: Kyosiga Women's Group

texts.en:
M. Joyce, 50, is the chairperson of the Kyosiga Women’s group in Kayunga. She is both a farmer and a business woman, selling ladies' clothes (mostly underclothes) to women in their offices, hospitals, schools and homes as a side business since 1990. Joyce buys her inventory from Kampala, mostly on Thursdays and Mondays every week.

As a farmer, Joyce grows beans, potatoes, and cassava and sells her crops to tenders, who supply this food to schools and usually pay her each week. At times when the season is not favorable for her, Joyce buys crops from fellow farmers and then supplies them to her customers. She has enough land for this farming and employs laborers to quicken the work. She is married with three grown children and she cares for 8 grandchildren at home.

Joyce needs a loan to buy dried beans for sale. She will share the loan with the 14 other members of her group.

loans.use: To purchase dried beans for sale

loans.name: Rofelia

texts.es:
Rofelia G. P. is a partner of the LAS MARGARITAS II communal bank. She lives in the department and province of San Martin in the Banda Shilxcayo district.

She is a professor who, upon not being able to find a teaching position, decided to go into business. She chose to invest in CD's and DVD's to sell and rent. District residents, who frequent Rofelia's business to find their favorite films and music videos, are her clients. Rofelia's moderate pricing and amiability have increased her sales.

The loan of S/.1000.00 will be re-paid over the course of 4 months and will be used to buy CD's and DVD's of a variety of music, films and cartoons, so that clients will be able to find everything they want and are looking for.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rofelia G. P., es socia del banco comunal “LAS MARGARITAS II”, vive en el departamento y provincia de San Martín y distrito de la Banda Shilxcayo, se dedica a la venta y Alquiler de CD Y DVD de distintas variedades como películas y músicas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. José C. Mariátegui Nº 158 del distrito.

Es profesora pero al no encontrar un puesto de trabajo, decidió dedicarse al negocio, optando en invertir en CD y DVD ella los vende y alquila, teniendo como clientes a los pobladores del barrio que recurren buscando sus películas y videos musicales favoritos , el precio cómodo y la amabilidad que tiene hace que se incrementen sus ventas.

El crédito recibido de S/. 1000.00 que será devuelto en el transcurso de 4 meses, comprará CD’s Y DVD’s de distintas músicas, películas y dibujos animados, de manera que los clientes encuentren todo lo que deseen y buscan.

loans.use: Purchase of various CD's and DVD's

loans.name: You

texts.en: Mrs. You S., 54, has a stand at home selling Khmer noodle soup and porridge to the people in her area, making on average about $2/day of net income. She started this business in 1998. Her husband is a farmer growing rice and vegetables on his farm land, typically earning around $1 per day in revenue. One of her children is now employed as a garment worker, another two are construction workers and the rest are married and live outside the family home. Mrs. You S. would like to request a loan from KIVA to purchase two cows to assist in plowing farmland.

loans.use: Purchase two cows to assist in plowing

loans.name: João Cris&oac

texts.pt:
João Crisóstomo A. tem 53 anos, nasceu e cresceu em Inhambane, é casado e Pai de 6 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 24 a 7 anos respectivamente .O mais velho esta a trabalhar na  visinha Africa do sul, o segundo está fazer 1°ano de faculdade e os outros mais novos estão a frequentar o ensino Geral. João mudou –se para Namaacha uma vila  fronteiriça  com a Swazilandia a pos a conclusão do seu curso de agronomia ( nivel medio).

Em 1977 João começou a trabalhar na Escola Agraria de Namaacha como professor e no ano seguinte contraio matrimonio com a sua Esposa. Nesta Escola trabalhou apenas durante 4anos e foi transferido para Direcção Distrital da Educacão de Namaacha, onde trabalha até então como funcionario permanente, ocupando a função de Tecnico de Produção e Alimemtação Escolar e aufere um salário liquido de 4.500,00mtn mas não consegue poupar nada no final do mês devido ao custo elevado de vida. João vive actulmente com a sua familia numa casa cedida pelos serviços e está a construir a sua propria casa no mesmo distrito. Para alem da sua familia João responsabiliza-se pelo sobrinho orfão de pais que vive em Inhambane, manda lhe uma sexta basica mensalmente no valor de 500.00mtn.

João para iniciar a sua obra contraiu primeiramente um emprestimo no Banco Internacional de moçambique ( BIM) no valor de 16,000.00mtn e pagou num periodo de 2anos. Em 2007 conheceu a hluvuku atraves dos colegas e solicitou um emprestimo no valor de 8,000.00mtn e foi usado para compra de material de construção para sua obra, este é segundo emprestimo com hluvuku e o primeiro com kiva no valor de 9.000,00mtn e será usado para mesmo fim.
Pretende futuramente contrair mas emprestimo para mobilar a sua casa e construir muro de vedação.
texts.en:
João Crisóstomo A. is 53 years old. He was born and raised in Inhambane. He is married and the father of 6 children with ages between 7 and 24. The oldest is working in neighboring South Africa. His second is in his 1st year of college, and the younger ones are in general education. João moved to Namaacha, a town bordering with Swaziland and concluded his course of agronomy (middle level). In 1977 João began working in the Agrarian School of Namaacha as a professor, and in the following year he was married to his wife. He worked in that school for only 4 years and was transferred to the District Direction of Education of Namaacha where he worked as a permanent official occupying the function of Technician of Production and School Food. He earned a salary of 4,500MT but was unable to save any money due to the elevated cost of living. João currently lives with his family in a house given up to the services and is building his own home in the same district. Besides his family, João is responsible for his orphaned nephew that lives in Inhambane. He sends him 500MT on a monthly basis. To begin his work João first received a loan from the International Bank of Mozambique (BIM) for 16,000MT and paid it off after 2 years. In 2007 he came to know Hluvuku through some coleagues and solicited a loan for 8,000MT which he used to purchase construction materials. This is the second loan with Hluvuku and the first through Kiva for 9,000MT which will be used to the same end. In the future he intends to ask for another loan so he can furnish his home and construct a wall.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie M., 47 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois des Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara depuis 4 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des thioubs (tissus teintés). Elle veut renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Marie sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Marie M., age 47, is married and has five children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Femmes Catholiques de Vélingara for four and a half years. Her business consists of buying and selling "thioubs" (dyed fabrics). She wants to bolster her commerce. Her income enables her to help cover family expenses. Marie is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell thioub (dyed fabrics)

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La señora Paula tiene 57 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal San Luis y al comedor popular de su caserío. Vive en el barrio La Laguna del Caserío de Motil, distrito de Agallpampa, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Paula se auto educó y aprendió a escribir algunas palabras y a firmar su nombre, porque sus padres nunca la pusieron en una escuela, ya que pensaban que la educación solamente es para los hombres. Se casó con Santos P. Rosales y tuvieron 6 hijos, 3 de los cuales dependen de ella.
Paula trabaja con la compra y venta de leche y también queso que ella misma fabrica, reparte a sus clientes en Motil y Agallpampa. Manifiesta que ha logrado tener mucha autoestima desde que está con Manuela Ramos, ahora sabe que tiene derechos y que como mujer vale mucho.
Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles, cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo utilizó para comprar material para la fabricación de quesos.
Con este crédito de 800 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa comprar víveres para vender en su casa ya que por su barrio no hay tiendas de víveres.
Paula sueña con viajar y conocer todo el Perú.
texts.en:
Señora Paula is 57 years of age. She is a member of the community bank San Luis and in charge of the popular cafeteria in her country home. She lives in the neighborhood La Laguna del Caserío de Motil, in the district of Agallpampa, province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad, Perú. Paula is self educated and learned to write some words and sign her name, because her parents never put her in school since they thought education was only for the men. She married to Santos P. Rosales and they had six children, three of who depend on her. Paula works in purchasing and selling milk, and also cheese that she makes, and delivering it to her clients in Motil and Agallpampa. She has come to gain a lot of self-esteem since she has been with Manuela Ramos; now she knows that she has rights and that as a woman she is worth a lot. Her first loan was for 300 Soles and was paid back in four months; she used it to buy material for making cheeses. With this loan for 800 Soles, which she will repay in six months, she plans to buy supplies and provisions to sell in her home since her neighborhood doesn't have any such shops. Paula dreams of traveling and getting to know all of Perú.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy provisions to sell in her home.

loans.name: Eliza J.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 54-year-old Eliza M. from Mbeya, married with four children between the ages of 10 and 20. Eliza has been running a crop business since 2007, buying rice wholesale and retailing it locally. Working at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week, Eliza currently earns about a $60 monthly profit.

She is now requesting a loan of $750 in order to purchase more rice in bulk, and in the future plans to expand her business. Eliza thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice in bulk

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 33 años, es casada, vive con  su esposo y su hijo. Se dedica íntegramente a la venta en la tienda que logró abrir hace un  par de años, negocio en el cual le va muy bien, gracias a la acogida que tiene  entre las  personas, a ella le agrada satisfacer las necesidades de los pobladores que ya necesitaban una tienda cercana dentro de su  zona. Para Beatriz su negocio es  rentable, debido a la necesitada de consumo de sus vecinos, todos acuden desde muy temprano a su  tienda a poder realizar sus compras del día, sobre todo las  amas de casa. Lo difícil es adquirir mayor cantidad de productos, porque son muy costosos y requieren de mayor capital. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Beatriz invertirá 1000 soles en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 33 years old and lives with her husband and son. She works full-time in the grocery store she opened a few years ago. The store is doing well, having been well received by the community. She's happy to fulfill the needs of the neighborhood since there was a need for a nearby store in their zone. Beatriz's business is profitable due to the neighbors' consumer needs: they arrive very early to do their daily shopping, especially the housewives. The challenge is to keep a sufficient stock of products in supply, because it is expensive and requires major capital. This is her first loan with MFP. Beatriz will invest 1000 soles to buy a large stock of products to supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock of products for the store

loans.name: Tofig

texts.en: Tofig is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. He is now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. He was born in 1950, and is married with three children. Tofig started his general store business five years ago. He is requesting a loan so he can buy more foodstuff stock and offer more items to his customers. This will increase his income and help him raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff for a general store

loans.name: Hector Rafael

texts.es:
Héctor Rafael Chamarro Gutiérrez tiene la edad de 20 años, su estado civil es casado este joven Héctor tiene 1 hijo de la edad de 5 años y cursa el 2 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida labora no trabaja, sus propósitos son de mantener su clientela ya que ellos son los que hacen posible que su negocio continúe adelante y para brindarles a ellos la atención necesaria, sus sueños son de consolidar su negocio al punto de tener mayor cobertura ya que sus clientes buscan la mejor tecnología que se les pueda ofrecer y además no todos cumplen con las necesidades que sus clientes piden, sus deseos son de ampliar mas el ciber por que tiene muy pocos equipos y sus clientes se retiran por falta de equipo por lo que no tiene el espacio suficiente para la instalación de mas equipos y así conseguiría  mas ingresos para su familia y podría pagar las deudas contraídas con la institución.

La actividad económica de Héctor es de servicios de ciber, la ubicación de su negocio es de Dilectus ½ cuadra al norte, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 años, Héctor da inicio a este negocio por un sueño que quería se cumpliera ya que cuando empezó su mayor sueño era independizarse son su propio negocio y empezó a relacionarse con amigos que ya tenían cierta experiencia con este tipo de negocio y un amigo le brindo la oportunidad de trabajar en su ciber mientras el guardaba lo que podía de sus ganancias y poco a poco fue trabajando hasta lograr comprar una computadora y la otra la consigue por amigo quien se la vendió en un precio favorable por lo que mas tarde decide realizar otra compra de computadora obteniendo así 3 computadoras y trabajaba con 2 computadoras por lo que al empezar le fue muy difícil ya que la compra de cada una era muy elevada pero al ver los frutos de su ciber que fueron muy pocos consiguió otra computadora y se hicieron 3 computadoras mas por lo que mas tarde decide realizar un financiamiento para saldar las cuentas pendientes y desde entonces  empieza a trabajar con Fundación León 2000 por lo que ahora pide un financiamiento para capital de trabajo ya que quiere cambiar los accesorios del ciber, mejoras para sus equipos y la capacidad de la resolución de sus programas por lo que le gustaría que su financiamiento pudiera lograrse por medio de la Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones que contribuyen para su causa.
texts.en:
Héctor Rafael Chamarro Gutiérrez is 20 years old and married. Young Hectór has a 5-year old son who attends primary school in the 2nd grade. His wife does domestic work but does not have a job. His goals are to maintain his customer base, since they make his success and growth possible, and to offer them essential services. His dreams are to strengthen his business to the point of having better coverage, since his customers seek the best technology offered and, furthermore, not all their needs are met. His wishes are to increase his Internet capabilities because he has limited equipment, and his customers leave for lack of equipment. He does not have sufficient space for the installation of more equipment with which he could bring in a better income for his family and pay his contracted debts with the institution.

Héctor works in Internet services. The location of his business is a half block north of Dilectus. He has run his business for three years. Héctor started his business because it was his dream, along with his bigger dream to become independent with his business. He started off by making acquaintances with others who have experience in the business. One of his friends offered him the opportunity to work in his Internet café while saving what he could of his pay, and little by little he earned enough to buy a computer. He then bought another computer from a friend at a good price because, to obtain three computers later on, he would sell him another. Starting off with two computers was very difficult because the cost of each computer was high, but seeing that the profits from his Internet café were very low, he acquired another computer to make three computers. He decided to look into loan options to pay off outstanding accounts. Since this time he has worked with the Fundación León 2000. Now he is requesting a loan to invest in his business. He would like to add Internet accessories and improve his equipment and the resolution of his programs. He would be pleased to work with the Fundación León 2000, and the organizations that contribute to its cause, to be able to make this investment.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Investment

loans.name: Adegoke

texts.en: Adegoke O. is 36 years old and married with 2 children. All her children are in school. Adegoke sells dried yams for making yam flour. She is requesting for the loan amount of $350 to purchase more dried yam to sell. She says thanks to all the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried yams to sell

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa O. is forty-nine years old. She is widowed and has given birth to nine children, six boys and three girls. She says all her daughters are married and live independently. The sons, however, are still in school – junior high and primary school. She lives with some of her children in a family house in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are into trading activities and palm oil production. She lost her husband thirteen years ago.

Yaa is into palm oil production. She procures palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms to prepare palm oil. She distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. Yaa wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to the increasing number of her customers. She has been in business for eight years and is hopeful to improve her living standard and give her children the best support she can.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel A. is 31 years old, married and father of a young child. He lives with his wife at Eguase in the central region of Ghana. 

Daniel is very hardworking young man who wants to work hard to provide his immediate family with the needed support. Daniel is a dealer in electrical and electronic parts such as radio sets, speakers, transistors, screw drivers, wires, television cords, antennas, etc. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices at Accra and sells to his customers at retail prices. 

He is also a hardware dealer who sells items such as paint, net, roofing sheets, etc. Danny, as he is called by his pals, has been in business for eight years now. But he says prices of raw materials have shot up significantly, which is making it difficult to stock his shop. 

He requests a loan to enable him to procure increased stock of electrical, electronic parts and hardware goods. He hopes to increase his savings to expand his shop to include sound systems and television. He would be very grateful for your support. He belongs to a village bank called "Won som" which means "let all help."

loans.use: To procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en:
H. Sherali is a 40-year-old married man who lives with his two children and wife and owns a cattle-breeding business. Sherali has nine years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Sherali has become a very successful businessman. Sherali has a friendly family who are always try to help each other. Thus with the cattle-raising business, his wife and son help him.

He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now Sherali wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. So Sherali applied for a loan of $1,000. He promises to repay the loan within nine months and thanks all lenders for their support. With your help Sherali can get ahead.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz es socia del Banco Comunal Legión.
Beatriz es casada, tiene 69 años tuvo 10 hijos D. los cuales solo 1 hija vive con ella, Beatriz tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 D. abril en donD. venD. carne D. res, porcino, ovino, actividad que realiza todos los días, los animales los adquiere en las ferias a donD. viaja su esposo y luego lo beneficia en el camal D. la ciudad.
Beatriz necesita un préstamo D. 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ovino y porcinos.
Los sueños D. Beatriz son tener una tienda en su casa.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovino y porcinos.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon. Ali has owned a barber shop since 2006. Ali requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his shop like scissors, hairdryer, as well as change the décor of his house. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. 
Ali is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and is always aware of hair’s fashion. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Ali decided on doing his business because of his experience since he learned it when he was young. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by opening another barber shop.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to urchase tools for his shop like scissors, hairdryer, as well as change the décor of his house.

loans.name: Lamisi

texts.en:
Lamisi A. is 23 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. 

Lamisi is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She sells her products on a tabletop in a school compound in her community. She sells in the mornings. Lamisi wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and save for her future before she gets married.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Koko

texts.fr: Koko A. est un homme de 42 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Lomé. Koko souhaite avec ce crédit  acheter une nouvelle moto.  ceci lui permettra de limiter les diverses dépenses que lui cause les réparations et de mieux épargner pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koko A. is a 42-year-old man, married, and the father of three. He is a motorbike taxi driver in Lomé. He wishes to use this loan to buy a new motorbike. This will enable him to limit the various expenses due to repairs and to save more money for meeting the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new moto

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac O. sells top up cards for mobile phones at Abura. Isaac has received senior high school education. He is single and has no dependants. Isaac has been selling top up cards since 2005. He is responsible for paying for fees and clothing. His loan will be used to buy more top up cards for sale. He hopes to save the new profits from his business and re-invest.

loans.use: To buy more top up cards for sale.

loans.name: Las Estrellas Del Mar Group

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA IRACEL P. C., TIENE 30 AÑOS DE EDAD Y SU FAMILIA ESTA FORMADA POR 6 INTEGRANTES, SU ESPOSO Y 4 HIJOS, VIVE EN UN PEQUEÑO POBLADO LLAMADO OMETEPEC UBICADO EN LA COSTA CHICA DE GUERRERO, ELLA TIENE SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE MERCANCIAS DE CONSUMO BASICO EN SU DOMICILIO PARTICULAR, EL CUAL INICIO HACE 6 AÑOS CON LA FINALIDAD DE AYUDAR A SU ESPOSO CON PARTE DE LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES.

LA SEÑORA NECESITA DE UN FINANCIMIENTO QUE LE AYUDE A  AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO Y TENER MAYOR VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS QUE OFRECER A SUS CLIENTES Y CON ELLO OBTENER MAYORES INGRESOS PARA PODER DARLE UNA MEJOR OPORTUNIDAD DE EDUCACION A SUS HIJOS YA QUE ELLA NO TERMINO LA SECUNDARIA.ES POR ELLO QUE SE ACERCÓ A FUNDACIÓN REALIDAD JUNTO CON 9 PERSONAS PARA FORMAR EL GRUPO QUE LLEVA POR NOMBRE "LAS ESTRELLAS DEL MAR" EN SU MAYORIA SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE COMIDA ECONÓMICA, ROPA Y MERCANCIAS DE CONSUMO BASICO, AL IGUAL QUE IRACEL TODO SU GRUPO ESPERAN PODER EMPRENDER SUS NEGOCIOS PARA MEJORAR EL NIVEL DE VIDA DE SUS FAMILIAS.
texts.en:
Group Name: “Las Estellas del Mar” (The Stars of the Sea) Members: 10 Representative: Iracel P. C. Iracel P. C. is 30 years old and her family includes 6 members – herself, her husband, and 4 children. She lives in a small village called Ometepec located on the small coast of Guerrero. She has a business where she sells general goods from her house. She started this business 6 years ago with the objective of helping her husband with the family’s expenses. She needs financial help to increase the size of her business and to have a bigger variety of products to offer her customers.
