With that she can increase her income and be able to provide better opportunities in education for her children since she herself did not complete secondary school. It’s because of this that she came to Fundación Realidad (Reality Foundation) with 9 others to form a group that they call “The Stars of the Sea.” The majority of the group sells low-cost food, clothing and general goods. Like Iracel, her entire group hopes to embark on their businesses in order to improve the standard of living of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer O. is from the town of Tukuran. She is 38 years old. Jennifer is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

Jennifer joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jennifer from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Makunguru Group

texts.en:
Maura is a member of the Makunguru borrower group in  Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 50  year old woman, she is married and a  mother of  7 children.

Maura has owned a shop business selling rice, cooking oil , sugar for 6 years. She works 7 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately  60,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Maura`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Maura hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Yovita and Faines are another member of the same borrower group, they also requested the loan amount of 200,000 each one  Tsh in order to expand  their  business.

loans.use: To buy more  commodities for shop business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La sra. Rosario se dedica a la confección D. edredones, sábanas, y ahora está elaborando carameleros en forma D. muñecos D. nieve, es una cliente antigua y puntual, es muy conocida en la zona por sus productos que son D. muy buena calidad; sus hijos ya son independientes vive en la casa con su hija menor que recién tuvo su bebé, su esposo se encuentra en la ciudad D. Sucre por problemas D. salud. El crédito será invertido en la compra D. tela polar para la elaboración D. los muñecos ya que tiene pedidos para las fiestas naviD.ñas.
texts.en:
Rosario makes quilts and sheets. Now she is making snowmen to fill with candy and sell. She is a long time, punctual client. She is very well known in the region for her very good quality products. Her children are now independent. She lives in her youngest daughter’s house. This daughter just had a baby. Her husband is in the city of Sucre because of health problems. The loan is to buy by fleece to make the snowmen. She has orders for the Christmas holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fleece

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying clothes

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 38 years old and married. Her husband is working in Australia as a welder. They are blessed with three children: Mathew, 22 years old; Timothy, 20 years old and Christopher, 18 years old.  All of them are college students.  She is a responsible mother and helps her parents in supporting their daily needs through her direct-selling business of AVON products. She is persevering to succeed in this business to give her family a progressive living someday. Her family is residing in the agricultural-based community of Larion Alto, Tuguegarao, City, and farming is their family's main source of income. 

Asuncion is requesting a loan from the Kiva lenders amounting to PHP10,000. She will use the amount to purchase more AVON products, like cosmetics, apparel and other items that she can offer to her customers. She believes that the more capital she can roll into her direct selling, the higher the income she could get.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her personal products business

loans.name: Kolab

texts.en: Mrs. Kolab I. lives in Thommoney village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a field to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Uy Thorn, is a fisherman. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Kolab I. decided to ask for a loan to buy a buffalo for breeding and for plowing the field. Mrs. Kolab I. is the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, another is a construction worker, and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for breeding and for plowing the field.

loans.name: Maimona

texts.en:
Maimona C. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 42 years old. Maimona is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Maimona owns & operates a general store. Among other things, the store sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste to the local community. Maimona has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Maimona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maimona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maimona is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional merchandise. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Maimona from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doris Elizabeth es una mujer dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 29 años, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en un aserradero.
Doris se dedica a la venta de carbón y plátanos y es socia del Banco Comunal “Madres Coraje” desde hace un año y medio. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los  que utilizó en la compra de madera para la fabricaciòn de carbón que posteriormente vendiò a sus clientes.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados para continuar con la fabricaciòn de carbón. 
La meta de Doris es tener una tienda de abarrotes y aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Doris Elizabeth is a dynamic woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 29 years old, the mother of two young children, and has financial support from her husband, who works in a sawmill.

Doris sells charcoal and bananas and has been a member of the “Madres Coraje” (“Courageous Mothers”) Communal Bank for the last year and a half. She invested her first loan for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles in the purchase of wood to make charcoal to sell to her customers.

She is currently requesting a loan for 300 nuevos soles to use to continue making charcoal.

Doris's goal is to have a grocery store and to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies to make charcoal

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda E. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 47 years old. Erlinda is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Erlinda runs a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nineteen years and earns approximately $150 a month from this activity.

In 2005, Erlinda joined the Kiva field partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Erlinda is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 10th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dugenia

texts.en:
Dugenia N. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old. Dugenia is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Dugenia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Dugenia is just starting this business.

In 2009, Dugenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dugenia is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Dugenia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Maroun

texts.en:
M. is a 53 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife. M. has been working in agriculture since 1990. He owns livestock and produces dairy products. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a cow so that he can increase his dairy products and livestock. This is his second loan and he has always paid on time.
M. is well known for his good products. His clients are people from his region. When he started his business he had to face competition as there is a lot of agriculture in his region. M. decided to run his business because of his experience: he took over his family’s business and learnt it when he was young. He plans to keep expanding his business by producing more.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel  es soltero, tiene 25 años,  vive con su madre.
Había montado el vivero, gracias a un pequeño capital que había  ahorrado con su madre durante varios años. 
Quiere comprar  plantas al por mayor, pues, así consigue más barato y tiene un margen importante de ganancia.
El  señor Daniel  es una persona muy activa tiene un espíritu emprendedor, y cuenta con un carácter muy agradable por lo que muchas personas siempre están a su alrededor. Manifiesta que quiere mejorar su negocio ya que es la fuente de su ingreso, por lo que considero que es una persona a quien debemos apoyar constantemente, ya sea económica y moralmente.
texts.en:
Daniel is 25 years old, single and lives with his mother. He started a nursery with a little savings that he and his mother accumulated over the years. He wants to buy wholesale supplies of plants because they are cheaper and the extra margin would increase his earnings. Daniel works hard and has an entrepreneurial spirit, along with an agreeable personality that draws others to him. He says that he wants to improve his business because it is his main source of income. Daniel is a man that we should support, both economically and morally, in whatever we can.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plants for nursery business.

loans.name: Esquipula Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esquipula está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras y esforzadas una de ellas es la señora Educebia López quien desde muy pequeña trabaja en la realización de tortillas cuyo oficio aprendió en ceno familiar. Ella se independizo a sus 18 años cuando forma su propia familia a la que también trasmitió este conocimiento.

Desde entonces han transcurrido 30 años en los cuales ha trabajado arduamente por su familia y su bienestar. López invertirá el crédito en la compra de maíz, leña y cal  que son la materia prima para realizar dicho producto. 

Sus compañeros de grupo son la joven Ignacia del Socorro U. Ramírez quien también realiza y vende tortillas con la esperanza de poder brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos y Margarito Antonio R. V. vende ropa desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The Esquipula group is composed of three hard-working people. One of them is Educebia López, who has been a tortilla maker since a very young age; she learned this skill in the bosom of her family. At the age of 18, she became independent when she started her own family to whom she also passed on this skill. Since then, ít's been 30 years in which she has worked hard for her family and for her wellbeing. She will use the funds to buy corn, firewood and lime powder, which are the raw ingredients for tortillas. Her fellow group members are: Ignacia del Socorro U. Ramírez, who also makes tortillas to provide a better future for her children and Margarito Antonio R. V., who has sold clothing for the past two years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood and lime powder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Sanubar

texts.en:
Sanubar H. was born in 1962. She  is a married woman with one child.  Sanubar and her family live in Absheron region.  Sanubar has had a bakery for 10 years. 

In this picture, you can see Sanubar creating the traditional national sweets for the "Novruz" holiday including "shekerbura" (sweet pastry filled with nuts and sugar) and "pakhlava" (baklava).  (Novruz is a feast of spring and the coming of the New Year).  These two sweets are special to Novruz and the rest of the year she bakes cakes and other sweets.  Sanubar is asking for a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy butter and other ingredients for baking cakes, shekerbura, pakhlava, "qogal" (a sweet roll), etc. in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy butter and other baking ingredients.

loans.name: Lucia De Socorro

texts.es:
Cuando muchas personas del barrio La Paz de la ciudad de Barranquilla se casan, remodelan su hogar o tiene otra necesidad, es común que busquen a Lucía C. S. para encargarla de conseguir un vestido de bodas, un juego de cuarto u otro artículo de segunda mano. Lucía tiene más de 25 años negociando y desde un inicio comprando y vendiendo ropa y zapatos, ahora consigue tanto  motos y carros, como muebles. A pesar de sus años de negocio, no ha tenido un local donde vender su mercancía y es esto lo que quiere hacer con el crédito que ahora solicita: planifica hacer una remodelación enfrente de su casa para tener donde vender sus artículos.
Lucía comenzó con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace alrededor de 25 años cuando reunió un grupo de mujeres del barrio y montó entonces una confección con su prima, antes de dedicarse por completo a la compra y venta de mercancía. Gracias al apoyo de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ha podido construir su casa y sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, que ahora tienen entre 26 y 30 años; y esto lo ha tenido que hacer sola, ya que es madre cabeza de familia. Su sueño mayor es dejar un negocio a cada uno de sus hijos para que no dependan de ella y con este fin, dos de ellos están estudiando en el SENA.
texts.en:
When many people in the neighborhood of La Paz in Barranquilla get married, remodel their home or have another need, it is common for them to look for Lucía C. S. in order to ask her to make a wedding dress, a bedroom set, or another second hand article. Lucía has spent more than 25 years working, from the beginning buying and selling clothing and shoes. Now she also has motorcycles, cars, and furniture. Despite her many years in business, she has not had a location to sell her wares, and this is why she wants to do with the loan she is asking for: She plans to remodel in front of her house in order to have a place to sell her merchandise. Lucía began with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo about 25 years ago when she met with a group of women from the neighborhood and began dressmaking with her cousin, before she dedicated herself totally to selling and buying merchandise. Thanks to the help of the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she has been able to build a house and improve the lives of her three children, who are currently between 26 and 30 years of age. She has had to do this alone, as she is the female head of the family. Her greatest dream is to leave a business to each of her children so that they might not depend on her, and with this goal two of them are studying in SENA (a Colombian vocational college).

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling of Lucia's Business

loans.name: Mrs. Keath Vorng Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nine people living in Chheu Teal village in Kandal province are requesting this village bank loan. Mrs. Keath V. is the village bank president, meaning that she was selected by all the group members. Each member will use a loan for a different purpose so that it can improve their businesses in the future. She is a widow with two children who are seamstresses in garment factory. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to sell to support her family. Her problem is that her field is on time to do farming. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Keath V. is asking for this loan in order to farm this year. All the members are shown in the photo but one of them is blocked.

loans.use: To farm

loans.name: Chenar Group

texts.en:
Abdul is the group leader of 'Chenar' group. He lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives in a family of seven members with his wife and children. He is a hard-working man and works hard in order to provide support for his children to get a better education and have a bright future. 

He is a butcher and works in his shop seven days a week. He needs the loan to purchase cows, sheep and other animals for slaughtering. 

He is confident that he will make the repayments on time and will request another loan very soon.

loans.use: to expand his butcher's shop

loans.name: Almoudou

texts.fr:
Âgé de 45 ans, Monsieur Almoudou T. est marié et père de 4 filles. Il réside avec sa famille à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, il s’est très vite initié depuis plus de trente années à la couture, auprès de son oncle à Sikasso. Son atelier se situe au grand marché de Sikasso et la plupart de sa clientèle est composée des hommes surtout les forains. Avec une telle expérience dans le domaine, il jouit d’une parfaite confiance de la famille des tailleurs ce qui lui a valu la présidence du Comité de Surveillance de l’Association des Tailleurs de Sikasso (A.T.S.). En plus de la couture, il achète des machines à coudre à Lomé (république de Togo) et des tissus pour  homme afin de les revendre aux tailleurs de Sikasso. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire des commandes de plus en plus croissantes, il sollicite ce deuxième prêt auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est en partenariat il y environ deux ans. 
Ce deuxième prêt lui permettra d’acheter, 15 machines à coudre et 10 complets tissus.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses personnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son atelier.
texts.en:
Mr. Almoudou T., aged 45, is married and the father of four girls.  He resides with his family in Médine, one of the working-class districts of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  Not having had the chance to advance in school, he quickly got introduced to tailoring from his uncle in Sikasso over thirty years ago.  His workshop is located at the big market of Sikasso, and most of his customers are men, particularly market vendors.  With such experience in this domain, he enjoys the complete confidence of the family of tailors which has earned him the presidency of the Comité de Surveillance de l’Association des Tailleurs de Sikasso (A.T.S.), the supervisory committee of the association of tailors of Sikasso.  In addition to being a clothier, he buys sewing machines in Lomé (Republic of Togo) and men's fabrics in order to resell them to Sikasso tailors.  Concerned about doing better in meeting his continuously increasing orders, he is requesting this second loan from the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with which he has had a partnership for about two years.  This second loan will enable him to buy fifteen sewing machines and ten sets of fabric.  With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 250,000 francs CFA.  With the profits earned, he plans on resolving important personal expenses of his, to help cover family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in his workshop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various items

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Santa Librada se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Yaguarón en fecha 20 de febrero de 2009.
La Sra. Adelia P. es una de las integrantes y posee una Despensa, la cual es bastante concurrida por los pobladores de la zona, siendo que está bien surtida y por la amabilidad que caracteriza a la señora.
Ella desea ampliar el negocio, con la compra de artículos de primera necesidad, enlatados, empaquetados, artículos de limpieza, mercería, bazár, ferretería, librería; todo esto en mayor cantidad, de modo a mantener los precios bajos y ser buena competencia en el mercado y al mismo tiempo incrementar sus ingresos por este fin solicita el prestamo.
texts.en:
This excellent group of women is called Santa Librada. The group was formed in the city of Yagauarón on February 20th, 2009. Adelia Periera is one of the members. She has a grocery store, which is much frequented by the area’s inhabitants. This is because it is well stocked and because of her characteristic friendliness. She wishes to expand her business by purchasing basic needs items like canned goods, packaged goods, cleaning supplies, notions, bazaar items, hardware, and bookstore products. She will buy all of this in greater quantity. That way she will keep the prices low and be good competition in the market. At the same time her income will increase. That is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater quantity of basic needs articles like canned goods, packaged goods, cleaning supplies, notions, bazaar items, hardware, and bookstore products

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El señor Hernan G. González  es de Gral. Resquin, con casa propia, es casado, tiene 2 hijos.  

 Se dedica a la venta de articulos de celulares, accesorios, reparación de celulares, maxi y mini cargas, su señora tiene un comedor, con clientela formada con muy buena ubicación.

   Esta es la quinta operación que realiza  con esta institución, excelente cliente, señor muy trabajador, tambien tiene animales vacunos.

  Solicita el prestamo para la compra de celures para ofrecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Hernan G. G. is from Gral. Resquin and a home-owner. He is married with two children. He sells mobile phones, accessories, chargers and he also carries out mobile phone repairs. His wife has a food stand with a regular client base thanks to its very good localtion. This is his fifth operation through the institution. He is a good client and a hard-working man. He also owns cattle. He is requesting a loan to purchase cell phones to offer through his business.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy mobile phones.

loans.name: Maria Delia

texts.en:
Ma. Delia I.'s  main source of income comes from gathering and selling seaweed at the market. She is from the town of Talibon, Bohol. Maria Delia has spent her whole life growing seaweed to earn an income for her family. She has three children and her ambition is that someday she can send them all to school.

Maria Delia would like to apply for a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos. She will use the loan to buy seaweed seedlings and knot that will be used in planting seaweed. What she likes about CEVI's services is that the loan is paid in easy installment terms and the program implementers are very accommodating.

loans.use: To purchase seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Tsedensodnom

texts.en:
Tsedensodnom M. is a 40-year-old handicapped person who lives with his wife and son in Huvsgul province, western of Mongolia in their own ger--a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His wife sews clothes at their home while his son works for a local road construction company as a carpenter. 

Tsedensodnom operates a taxi service between the countryside and the capital of the province. He and his wife started a sewing business in 1996 with the help of his younger sister and they sell their products out of a local trade market. He repairs his car with his transportation earnings and works very hard to provide for his family. He says, “My only wish is to support my son's education and have him become a good person”. 

Tsedensodnom is a hard working, creative person who wants to enlarge his business line and always encourages his wife's sewing business. He is requesting a 2,500,000 Mongolian tugrug MNT loan to purchase more fabrics and finishing materials for his famliy business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and materials

loans.name: Lylian

texts.en: Lylian is a 30-year-old lady who is married with two children aged 9 and 4.  She sells shoes and clothes to earn a living.  She has been running her business for two years.  She also sells rice to earn extra income.  Lylian hopes to have a permanent business premise in the future.  She also hopes to boost her rice selling business.  She wants to import clothes from the neighboring country, Uganda.  Hence she has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).  This will be her first loan from Faulu Kenya.

loans.use: To import clothes and shoes for sale

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya runs a small business selling women's clothing at the central market in Kherson. She has been in this business for four years. During this time, she has learned that there is a large and constant demand for the items she sells. She also learned that, to be successful in sales, one needs to have a large variety and good client service. She feels this is something she can do well.

Natalya, her husband Andrei, and their 12-year-old son, Daniel, live in a small apartment. Both her son and her husband support her in her business.

Natalya would like to borrow 13,700 Grivnas to increase her assortment of the goods that she sells. She hopes to make additional profit and spend it on current family needs.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of her merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost for his coffee plants & invest in his wife's pig business

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania P. is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old. Epifania is widowed and has an adult child. To make a living, Epifania raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of fruits and vegetables for sale. Epifania has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Epifania joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Epifania has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Epifania is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Epifania from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Migombani Group

texts.en:
Peter L. is in his late fifties and is married with five children. He has been selling leftover construction supplies since 2007 and he is proud of his business. The business is open between 9 am and 6 pm and earns Peter a good monthly profit. 

This will be Peter's third loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his two previous loans to increase his supply of materials, loans which he has successfully repaid. Peter aims to use his third loan to once again increase his stock, which he hopes will lead to further expansion. 

Peter will share this loan with his loan group Migombani, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Peter can be seen 4th from left in the back row.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Johana Aide

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Colon  que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros. En este lugar las personas se dedican a la agricultura en gran parte.

La señora Johana es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y está muy contenta porque gracias a  los créditos a podido financiar en gran parte su negocio y además por la ayuda que reciben también sus amigas y compañeras. Tiene 24 años de edad y está  casada pero en planes de divorcio, de esta relación tuvo tres hijos de 4- 1 año y un pequeño de solo un mes de nacido.
 
Se dedica a la venta de yogurt, ropa y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorio para damas). La venta de yogurt la realiza todos los días en las mañanas y lo que es ropa y Yanbal cuatro días a la semana por las tardes. Sus productos los deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, nos cuenta que ahora realizar su trabajo se le ha hecho mas difícil porque sus hijos están pequeños pero en su situación tiene que trabajar para no perder sus clientes, ya que si se divorcia le tocara a ella sola hacerse cargo de  sus hijos.

Este crédito es para pagar los pedidos de yogurt y parte de los productos de Yanbal. Su sueño  es ser una gran microempresaria.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank Colon gathers every fifteen days in the parish of Colon in the City of Portoviejo, the manabita capital known as the City of the Valley because it is surrounded by many hills.  The majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture.

Señora Johana is a founding member of the Communal Bank and is very happy because thanks to these credits, she has been able to finance a substantial part of her business.  Also, her friends and colleagues have received help as well.  She is 24 years old and is married but is in the process of a divorce.  From this marriage, she has three children between the ages of 1-4 years old and a one-month old infant.

She sells yogurt, clothes, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women).  She sells yogurt every day in the morning and clothing and Yanbal four days a week in the afternoons.  She sells her products by credit and collects payments every fifteen days.  She tells us that working has become difficult because her children are small but she doesn't want to stop working and thus lose her clients since if she has a divorce, then she is responsible for caring for her children.

This credit will be used to pay the cost of ordering yogurt and a part of the Yanbal products.  Her dream is to become a great businesswoman.

loans.use: Purchase yogurt and beauty products.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita T. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Carpo, Brgy. Casay, Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a Sari-Sari (general) store. Her husband, Aurelio T., is 57 years old, works as a Carpenter to earn his living, and helps his wife with her business. They have one child who is 20 years old. Lolita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lolita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14,000, increasing her family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 11,000, which she intends to use to pay for more stock to sell, so that she can continue to save up for her family's future. Lolita T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Togtamurat

texts.en:
Togtamurat I. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and five children in the Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He has been living with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent for past 12 years. His oldest two sons both operate their own private businesses and his middle son is a university student. His youngest two daughters attend a local school. 

Togtamurat and his wife operate a vegetable selling business in their town. He procures his products in the  countryside using his own truck while his wife works as a salesperson in the local market selling a variety of vegetables as a retailer. Their stall is located in a popular spot and attracts many customers which has resulted in increasing their sales. They started buying and selling vegetables in 2000 and have since built a stable operation. After years of successful operation, he was able to provide his family with earnings that has enabled him to pay his son's tuition fees. He uses his truck to convey the goods. Togtamurat is a modest man and says, "All I want is to provide a higher education for my two  daughters."  

He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan in order to increase his working capital for his vegetable trading business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mariluz, es socia del Banco Comunal Geraneos, tiene 30 años, 3 hijos de 10, 7 y 1½ año, es conviviente
Se dedica a la elaboración de queso y yogurt. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de leche.
Mariluz, se dedica a la elaboración de queso y yogurt, su pareja viaja todos los días a Socos y sus alrededores para comprar la leche, trae a Ayacucho y elaboran queso, yogurt, el cual es vendido de lunes a viernes entre sus caseras y los domingos viajan a la feria de Huanta, con el suero de la leche crían chanchos y gallinas que también los venden.
Le gusta Finca porque le dan crédito, puede ahorrar, en las capacitaciones le enseñan como trabajar.
Su sueño es poder ahorrar para comprar un carro y poder recoger la leche.
texts.en:
Mariluz is a member of the Communal Bank “Geraneos”. She is 30 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 10, 7, and 1½).

Mariluz makes cheese and yogurt and will use this loan to buy milk. Her husband travels every day to Socos and the surrounding areas to buy the milk and then brings it back to Ayacucho so that they can make the cheese and yogurt. The products are sold Monday through Friday from her home. On Sundays they travel to the fair in Huanta with the whey produced from the milk. Mariluz and her husband also raise pigs and chickens to sell.

She enjoys FINCA because of the loans, the savings, and the training classes that teach her how to work. Her dream is to save so that she can purchase a car and travel to collect milk.

loans.use: Purchase milk

loans.name: Jhenny Stephany

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jhenny Stephany; ella tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de fotocopiadora, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de servicio de fotocopiadora, ella también trabaja en el instituto nacional de cultura como guía, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de fotocopiadora y tipeos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papel al por mayor para hacer las fotocopias.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jhenny Stephany is a member of the “VIRGEN GUADALUPE-CUSCO” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Jhenny Stephany is 22 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her photocopying business.  She has a small store where she offers photocopying services.  She also works for the National Institute of Culture as a guide.  She would like to expand and improve her photocopying and typing business.  She is requesting this loan to buy paper wholesale for making photocopies.

Jhenny Stephany is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy paper wholesale for making photocopies

loans.name: Ma. Joce

texts.en:
Ma. Joce is 33 years old, married, and supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  B.B.Q Vending and Soft drinks vending businesses.  She lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living condition with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her B.B.Q Vending and Soft drinks vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of 30,000 PHP.  Ma. Joce is borrowing 18,000 PHP so that she can purchase more stocks to sell.  This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Ma. Joce aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase of stock to sell.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Rachael has a small retail shop, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Rachael has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Rachael hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to own a salon.
Rachael is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has aided her prospects for the future by helping her be self-employed.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.es:
El señor Aquilino H. Q. tiene 53 años, vive solo con una sobrina que le ayuda en las faenas agrícolas y cuidado de ganado ellos está en la comunidad de Pisly,  están a 92 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, 
El sr. Aquilino es agricultor produce papa, papaliza, y tiene ganado vacuno, ovino. El necesita un capital para comprar abono orgánico el abono es barato y no tiene todavía ingresos económicos de la producción agrícola, el sr. Aquilino es una persona humilde trabajador y responsable, para él es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad que les piden muchos requisitos. Se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esa zona a otorgar crédito.

El sr. Aquilino está muy contento de haber encontrado la institucion que le de el credito, porque con eso va comprar el abono orgánico oportunamente y tendrá lista para la siembra de este año, así va tener ahorro para ayudar el estudio de su sobrina, como también para mejorar la vivienda que habitan es muy precaria, construida de piedra y de techo de paja.
texts.en:
Aquilino H. Q. is 53 years old, and lives alone with a niece, who helps him with farming and caring for livestock.  They are in the community of Pisly, 92 km. from Cochabamba.  Aquilino is a farmer, raising potatoes, papaliza (palisa potatoes, or ulluscus tuberosus), and he has cattle and sheep.  He needs money to buy organic fertilizer.  Fertilizer is cheap, and he does not yet have the income from his crops.  Aquilino is a modest man, hard-working and reliable.  It is hard for him to go to the city’s banks, which have many requirements.  He took the initiative to come here for a loan.

Aquilino is pleased to have found the institution that will give him a loan, and is now going to buy organic fertilizer at the right time, to have it available for this year’s sowing.  This way, he will have savings to help with his niece’s studies, and to improve the housing where they live, which is precarious, made of stones with a straw roof.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn M. is from the village of Bayabo, Tumuini, Isabela. She is 40 years old. Jocelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn raises livestock, primarily ducks, for sale. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP.

In 2007, Jocelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Jocelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es: El señor Timoteo nacido en Cochabamba El 14 de Octubre de 1955 hace 41 año que el se vino  a radicar a Santa C. a buscar mejor vida y lo encontró en los amarillos a 15 km de Limoncito, el tiene su esposa la Sra. Peregrina y sus 2 hijos. El tiene 10 hectáreas en la cual viven y trabajan en la agricultura y también se dedica a la ganadería pero su fuerte es la agricultura siembra maíz, que esta para cosechar y va a sembrar papa para eso utilizara el crédito para la compra de semillas y para lo que es el preparado de la tierra, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mr. Timoteo was born in Cochabamba on October 14, 1955.  He came to Santa C. 41 years ago in search of a better life which he found in Los Amarillos, 15 kms from Limoncito.  He is married to Mrs. Peregrina and they have two children.  

He owns 10 acres of farmland which is where they live and work.  He also raises livestock but his main activity is growing corn which is now ready for harvest.  He is planning to plant potatoes and will use the loan to buy seeds for the soil he is preparing.  He is a hard worker and grateful to the institution for the support he has received.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds

loans.name: Baselisa

texts.es: Baselisa tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene 02 hijos menores a cargo. Vive en casa propia en el distrito de La Victoria, a unos veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. La zona donde vive es pequeña y urbana marginal. Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio donde vende abarrotes, golosinas, y gaseosas. Tiene un año de experiencia en el rubro. Además, genera una utilidad adicional vendiendo productos de belleza a clientes en su comunidad y sus alrededores. Con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia. Desea ampliar su bodega con la compra de más mercadería el cual la ayudará aumentar sus ventas y ganancias. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en: Baselisa is 50 years old, is married and has two young children.  They all live in a home of her own in the La Victoria district, about 20 minutes from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region in northern Peru.  This is a small urban zone.  She runs a small general store in her home and sells groceries, snacks, and sodas.  She’s been doing this for a year.  She also sells beauty products to customers in and around her neighborhood.  These activities allow her to help her husband support the family.  She would like to expand her store by buying more merchandise and increase her sales, so she has seen fit to request a loan of 500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to expand and stock her store

loans.name: Elchadaï Group

texts.fr: ELCHADAÏ est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à la même Église. La présidente du groupe, Clémence colette  (dont le doigt est levé sur la photo), est née le 12 Mai 1975 dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Clémence colette  est mariée à un instituteur du nom de Dénis. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Il y a près de vingt ans que Clémence colette  vit au quartier Allédjo dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi avec sa famille. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Clémence colette n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour se prendre en charge et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Clémence colette  mène comme activité depuis onze ans, la vente d’ustensiles de cuisine (plastiques, bols, bassines, etc.). De façon secondaire, Clémence colette  vend des tissus, ce qui lui permet de diversifier ses sources de revenus. Clémence colette  achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Clémence colette  sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui permettra certainement à Clémence colette et à son groupe d’accroître leur stock de produits et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: ELCHADAÏ is a three-person group whose members belong to the same church. The group's president, Clémence  Colette A. (whose hand is raised in the photo), was born on May 12, 1975 in the commune of Abomey Calavi. She is married to a schoolteacher named Dénis. The couple has three children of their own and one in their care; all are in school. Clémence  and her family have lived in the Allédjo neighborhood of in Abomey Calavi for nearly 20 years. Together the couple provides for the needs of the household. Clémence never went to school. To support her family and assure the needs of her children, Clémence  has run a business for eleven years, selling kitchen utensils (plastic items, bowls, basins, etc.) As a sideline, she sells fabrics, thereby diversifying her revenue sources. Clémence  buys her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. This is the first time that Clémence  has requested a loan from ALIDé.  This loan will certainly enable her and her group to increase their stock of products and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy bowls, basins, plastic items and fabric.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida C. is from the village of Balide, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. She is 35 years old. Loida is single and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Loida provides a waste management service with tricycle transport. Loida has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7100 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Loida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Loida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Loida is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair existing engine. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Loida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing engine.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, age 48, earns a living by selling used clothing. She has been engaged in her business for seven years and it is thriving. She is glad that it allows her to generate the profits necessary to help send her children to school, particularly since she herself was able only to remain in school through the fourth grade. Her husband works as a security guard and the family lives in the West Point area. 

Beatrice is requesting a loan to purchase more cartons of used clothes for her business. In the future, her primary goal is to see her children educated through university level.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of used clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Jazgul

texts.en:
Jazgul, 21, lives in Tashkomur. She is married to a farmer and they have a new-born baby. In order to earn money the family cultivates agricultural products and sells them on the market. They started this activity four years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms. At the moment the monthly profit is about 20,000 soms. With the profits the young couple celebrated their wedding and purchased bedroom furniture. With money received from this loan, Jazgul wants to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for farming. In the future she dreams to build a big house for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for farming

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Thelma is 58 years old and has one child who is in school. 

Thelma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. 

Thelma has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Thelma would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Cruz Del Socorro

texts.en:
Cruz Del Socorro is a 56-year-old single mother of three adult children.  For the last 23 years, she has sold different milk products, such as cheese and cream, as well as other food items. The loan proceeds will be used to buy more milk, as well as pigs.  

Cruz del Socorro’s goal is to improve her living standards, including some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy milk for making products, such as cheese and cream

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana Rosa tiene 23 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con dos hijos de 7 y 2 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL DIVINO NIÑO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Ana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es tener un nivel de vida estable con buena economia.

Le gusta festejar las fiestas del recinto.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa is 23 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and two children, aged 7 and 2, in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The "EL DIVINO NIÑO' community bank is located in Estero Lindo, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Ana is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Comercial AGRIPAC and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Ana is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy seeds and manure for her corn and rice crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as pests on her crops and a lack of money with which to pay more workers.  Her dream is to enjoy a stable life, in a good financial position.

Ana enjoys celebrating local fiestas.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for her corn and rice crops

loans.name: Florena

texts.en:
A rice farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur, 33-year-old Florena is married and has four sons ranging in age from 11 to 2 years. Her husband works as a farmer and driver.

Florena, who has been growing and selling rice for nine years, earns about 4000 PHP per month and is now requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes for increased farming success.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Qasem

texts.en:
Qasem is a 60-year-old man and married. He has six sons who work as Palestinian National Authority employees with decent salaries. Qasem wants to purchase seedlings to increase crop production, but he doesn't have enough money to pay for them so he is in need of a loan from FATEN in the  amount of $2,500.

When Qasem gets his FATEN loan (that is repaid easily on a monthly basis), he will purchase seedlings. After selling the crops his income will increase and that will lead to improving his work in agriculture and let the family have better living conditions. Qasem appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural seedlings.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 32 years old and married with two children.

Shirley has been raising pigs for ten years in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Shirley is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: This is Mrs. Kong, 35, a resident of the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Riep Province. She and her husband now generate their income with a farming business. Kong is married to Mr. Yon and has six children. To assist their income, Kong and her husband are working as thatch braiders. From this business they earn about $3.75 per day. To help continue the operations of their business, they would like to request some funds with the aim of purchasing a motorbike for operating their business on time. They hope that this fund will make their family meet happiness and gain more profit per day. As a last word, they are very thankful to all lenders that help their family to change their life.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Primetiva

texts.en:
Primetiva is 61 years old and lives in Lawa-an Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children. 

Primetiva sells snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Primetiva has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Primetiva hopes to have a grocery store in order to help her family. She is a hard working mother and has a happy family. Primetiva is a MIGS member of PMPC, She is thankful because PMPC can help her in terms of financial problems.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Khudodod

texts.ru: Худодод  честный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Он начал заниматься  предпринимательством  в 15лет. После занятий в школе он  занимался продажей  продуктовых товаров. Он уже имеет накопленный опыт в этом бизнесе. Худододу помогает в бизнесе его брат. Он продает качественный, разнообразный продтовары. Худодод имеет постоянных клиентов. Он хочет увеличить и разнообразить ассортимент товаров, но у него нет средств. Худодод хотел бы получить займ на сумму 1500$ США для этой цели. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и выражает вам свою признательность за помощь.
texts.en: Khudodod is an honest and hard-working young man.  He became involved in entrepreneurship when he was 15 years old.  He sold food products after his school studies.  He already has accumulated experience in this business.  Khudodod's brother helps him in this business.  Khudodod sells quality and varied food products.  He has many regular customers.  He wants to expand and vary his product assortment, but has no means to do so.  Khudodod wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1500 for this goal.  He relies on your support and expresses his gratitude for your help.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of products

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora reina cuenta con 40 años de edad, está casada con el señor filomon con quien tiene 3 hijas, luz, Ángeles y Guadalupe, de los cuales solo 2 estudian,  la mayor cursa el tercer año de prepa, una mas cuarto de primaria, ya que la mas pequeña apenas tiene 10 meses de nacida, ella tiene una papelería, desde hace mas de 9 años.
Dice que inicio con esta actividad, ya que quería poyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos, también para mejorar un poco su nivel de vida y contar con una solvencia económica, mas estable, y así poder vivir cómodamente, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: hoja, carpetas, papel Bond, cartulinas, cuadernos, libretas, lápices, lapiceros, resistol, marcadores, sacapuntas, etc. Y así tener más surtida su tienda.
El anhelo más grande que tiene doña reina, es el de poder hacer crecer aun mas su negocio, y ampliar un poco mas su local, para así tener muy bien surtido e incrementar un poco mas sus ganancias. 
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad, por toda la ayuda y la confianza que le están ofreciendo, ya que gracias al apoyo recibido su vida ha cambiado mucho al igual que su negocio. “GRACIAS”
texts.en:
Sra. Reyna is 40 years old and married to Sr. Filomon. They have three daughters: Luz, Ángeles, and Guadalupe. Only two of them are in school. The oldest daughter is starting her third year of preparatory school and another one is in the fourth grade. The youngest child is 10 months old. Reyna has a stationery shop that she has managed for more than nine years.

She says that she started this business because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and the education of her children. Reyna also wants to slightly improve their standard of living so that they can have better financial solvency, more stability, and the ability to live comfortably. The loan she is receiving will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise such as individual sheets, folders, bond paper, cards, notebooks, journals, pencils, ballpoint pens, glue, markers, pencil sharpeners, and other products so that her shop will be better stocked.

Doña Reyna’s greatest wish is to grow her business even more and to expand her shop slightly so that she can carry more inventory and increase her earnings. She thanks Fundación Realidad for the assistance and the trust that have been offered to her. Thanks to the support she has received, her life and her business have changed greatly. She says, “Thank you”.

loans.use: to buy individual sheets, folders, bond paper, cards, notebooks, journals, pencils, ballpoint pens, glue, markers, pencil sharpeners, and other products.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. He has been running a retail shop for the last five years. He also sells cereals for more income. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 KES to buy maize and beans for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Nancy Marina

texts.es: Nancy es estudiante de la carrera de química y farmacia, tiene un cyber que es atendido por ella misma. el crédito solicitado será usado para pagar los módulos para finalizar su carrera. Dentro de algunos años espera ser la profesional que un día soñó, dueña de su propio negocio. Le prometió a su padre la obtención del título universitario y está a muy poco de poder conseguirlo. Le ha costado muchoe esfuerzo el poder finalizar sus estudios, y espera poder conseguirlo con el préstamo.
texts.en: Nancy is a student in Chemistry and Pharmacy.  She has an Internet café that she runs herself.  The requested loan will be used to pay tuition for the final course modules to complete her career.  She expects in a few years to be the professional she used to dream of being.  She dreams with having a business of her own.  She promised her father that she’d earn a university degree and she’s very close to attaining it.  It has cost her much effort to be able to complete her studies and she hopes to do finally so with help from the loan.

loans.use: to pay her final tuition costs.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 52 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past 11 years, Nilda has sold noodles, canned goods, biscuits, and other items to earn a living. She earns 3,000 PHP each month. Nilda has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  

Nilda is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to purchase additional goods such as noodles, canned goods, biscuits, and other items to sell. In the future, she hopes to finish building a residential house.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Savana Jitegemee Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Savana Jitegemee Group in Western Kenya! 

Hellen takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Hellen had an excellent maize yield harvesting 24 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Hellen was only able to harvest 16 bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Hellen will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

Hellen is the facilitator of the Savana Jitegemee group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Savana Jitegemee group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Hellen and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jessamin

texts.en:
This is Jessamin, 49, resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Ruperta, a housewife and a mother to her two children, the youngest is still studying in elementary while the eldest is already married. By the grace of God, Jessamin has managed to support his children's schooling. At this time, he is working hard to send his youngest to school. 

Jessamin operates a pineapple growing farm. He grows pineapple and some bananas on their farm located in Cavite, which is in the highlands where it is suitable to grow pineapple and bananas. He sells his product to markets and fruit stores that he regularly supplies and to the local community.  He earns a minimum of PHP 900 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a loan of PHP 41, 000. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for his business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of his farm. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Jessamin dreams of being able to give his family a good and future through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies.

 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed in his business.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales ytambien ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de granos como arbejas y habas,ella lo lleva a la ciudad de cusco y lo vende en el mercado y tambien tiene un pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche entre otros productos,por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar la tienad de abarrores.La socia solicita el préstamo para compara granos como habs y arbejas y tambien para comprar animales como cuyes y gallinas.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member continues with her business of raising animals, but she also engages in a business of selling dry goods such as peas and beans. She brings in these products from the city of Cusco and then sells them at the market. She also has a small grocery store where she sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, and other products. Through these small businesses, she is able to help her children move forward. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. The member is requesting a loan to buy dry goods, such as beans and peas, and also animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

She values this loan and expresses her unending appreciation for the support that has been provided so that she can grow her business and improve her quality of life. At the same time, she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy peas and beans, as well as small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 58-year-old married man. He has five children, ranging in age from 20 to 30 years old. He describes himself as focused. 

Peter operates a school where he provides education. He has been involved in this business for seven years and employs 11 staff members. His primary customers are students who range in age from 4 to 14 years old. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the school. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy 10 additional desks. Peter's business goal is to run a secondary school within five years.

loans.use: To buy 10 additional desks for his school.

loans.name: Faapaolo

texts.en:
Fapaolo is thirty-three years of age and is married with two children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling specialty hand-woven products to tourists and local community members.  She has three years of experience in this business.  Faapaolo needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase items so that she can make products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 500 or US $208 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Faapaolo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faapaolo's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase items such as pandana leaves and chicken feathers so she can make products to sell.

loans.name: Jlg-005-Sooriyanur Group

texts.en:
40-year-old Boomathi leads a group of 3 in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu. She is married and a mother of 4 children. She works hard to sustain her family with the meagre household income of 6,000 INR.

The group has no access to toilets, and therefore have to resort to open defecation using nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery, lacking any privacy. This puts them at risk of infection, molestation or attack, and even insect or animal bites.

Seeking to improve their situation, Boomathi formed a group and now the group is seeking a loan of 42,000 INR to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help these families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.en:
I sell clothes and shoes, My store is called Bazar S., which I have had for 3 years and has produced very good earnings and continues to grow. I have many customers who prefer the quality of my clothes and the good prices. This helps me to support my children and finance their education.

Loan Use: Purchase of clothes and shoes

Me dedico a la venta de ropa y zapatos, tengo mi negocio que se llama Bazar S., del que he tenido muy buenos ingresos ya que tengo 3 años de tenerlo y con los años ha ido creciendo. Tengo una buena clientela quienes me prefieren por la calidad de ropa y buenos precios que les ofrezco. Esto me ayuda a poder ayudar a mis hijos y apoyarles en sus estudios.

loans.use: Compra de ropa y calzado

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en: Bertha lives in Abokobi, a suburb of Accra, Ghana. She has 4 children of school-going age. She sells various items such as candies, milk, milo, soaps, carrier bags, etc. She owns a table-top shop and wants to expand it. She is seeking a loan of $750 from Kiva to enable her carry out the expansion.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is a woman of 47 years old, married with four (4) children, who lives in the semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She started her business in the year 1990. She specializes in the sales of foodstuffs. The above amount will be of good help to her in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand stock

loans.name: Solema

texts.en: Being a hard-working mother is not an easy task, especially when you have to provide for both your children and grandchildren. Starting with selling chips, Solema now sells barbeque and handicrafts. Solema still believes that when there is no pain, there is no gain. At 54 years old, she is on her feet all the time. She uses the money she earns from the sales to take care of her family. Furthermore, she plans to have her own stall in the local flea market.

loans.use: To assist with her business

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma is 55 and a strong and energetic mother of six. She sells charcoal, a business she has been doing for the past three years. She recently obtained business training organized by the Youth Self Employment Foundation. She sells charcoal at her home. She is in need of $225 to help her prosper business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
" I need to build a room for one of my children as the space we have is very limited. I would like to construct it little by little so my family will feel more comfortable. My husband and I have worked very hard to buy this house and we would like to make it bigger for our children. The funds requested to construct a room in my home are $800." Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo la necesidad de construir un cuarto para uno de mis hijos ya que el espacio que tenemos es muy reducido, me gustaria ir construyendo poco a poco para que yo y mi familia estemos más cómodos, mi esposo y yo hemos trabajado mucho para tener esta vivienda y queremos hacerla un poco más grande para nuestros hijos” Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para construir un cuarto en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Add a room to the family home.

loans.name: Ana  Isabel

texts.es:
Mrs. M. started as a traveling saleswoman selling clothes. She then started selling clothes out of her home to her neighbors and soon decided to put a display case in her business to show off the clothes. This allowed her to increase the styles and designs that she offered her clients until she had a well established business. Her objective in life with the help of her husband is to be able to proviD. her three children with a good education and better development opportunities that they didn’t have. Her husband helps her cover part of the family expenses but with what she brings in with her business she is able to adequately cover their necessities. The loan will be used to by new clothing styles and increase size inventory as this is the only clothing business in the area and it’s a shame for the clients to look elsewhere for clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra.
