M. inicio con ventas ambulantes D. ropa luego comenzó llevando ropa a su vivienda y propuso a algunos vecinos este producto, después decidió poner una vitrina en su negocio para exhibir la ropa D. manera que fue ampliando los estilos y diseños que ofrecía a sus clientes, hasta llegar a tener el negocio bien formado como en la actualidad, su objetivo en la vida es poder dar junto a su esposo una buena educación a sus tres hijos que tenga mejores oportunidades D. desarrollo que ellos no tuvieron, el esposo le ayuda a cubrir parte D. los gastos del grupo familiar pero con lo que ella aporta con el negocio cubren a cabalidad sus necesidades, el objetivo con el crédito es poder comprar nuevos estilos D. ropa tener un mejor inventario en tallas y modelos ya que es el único negocio en la zona y es una lastima que los clientes busquen otros lugares D. venta .

loans.use: The loan wil be used to buy shoes, new clothing styles for women and children, toys, and used clothes which her clients request.

loans.name: Telma Alejandra

texts.es:
Telma Alejandra L. is a single woman that for four years, has been working selling food in the Santa Ana market in Chinandega. She knows how to run her business well and in spite of being single, she has been able to, with much effort, keep her home in good condition.

Since she was very young, she has been interested in preparing and selling food, entering into this market to have the responsibility of having her own business. When she started, her booth was in bad condition, without a roof or wall. But since she began receiving loans from Ceprodel, she has been able to invest money to build her business, little-by-little, and at the same time been able to supply ingredients for her food. Her greatest wish is to have more customers so that she can obtain better earnings and reinvest them in the business and in the needs of her children in her home. She has had 18 loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Telma Alejandra L. es una dama soltera que desde hace 4 años se dedica al negocio de venta de comida en el mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega. Ha sabido administrar bien su negocio y a pesar de ser soltera, ha logrado con mucho esfuerzo mantener su hogar en buenas condiciones.

Desde muy pequeña se interesó por elaborar los alimentos y venderlos, incursiona en este mercado por la necesidad y responsabilidad de tener su propio negoico. Al momento de iniciar su localidad estaba en pésimas condiciones sin techo ni pared pero a partir de que comenzó a realizar créditos en Ceprodel los ha invertido para construir poco a poco su negocio y a la vez para surtir de ingredientes para la comida. Su mayor anhelo es captar mas clientes para obtener mejores ganancias y reinvertirlo en su negocio y las necesidades de sus hijos en su hogar. Su record crediticio es de 18 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Invest in food stand

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mr. Van V. is 45 years old and works as a horse cart driver in his village; on average, he earns $3 of profit per day. His wife, Mrs. Sam Lim Heang, is also 45 years old, and since 2005 she has been working as a tailor in Phnom Penh; on average, she earns $2 of profit per day. The couple has five children, one of whom is married and does not live with them at their home. They hope to receive a $500 loan from Kiva so that they can purchase a horse.

loans.use: To purchase a horse.

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Mrs. Srun S., age 34, is married with three children. One child is too young to attend school, and the other two are students. Mrs. S. works as a farmer growing rice on a plot of her farmland. She normally earns around $1 a day. Her husband Mr. Sout Sambuk (pictured here), is 36, and is a motor-taxi driver. He makes a profit of about $2 a day.

Mrs. Samouen requests a loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizer for her farmland. With the remainder of the loan, she plans to buy rice, take the husks off the rice, and then resell to the villagers to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and rice

loans.name: Siwema's Tegemeo Group

texts.en:
Siwema is a single woman and has a child who is 7 years old. Siwema earns money selling charcoal; she started her business in 2007. Every day, Siwema works from 7 am to 5 pm and can earn a monthly profit of about US$190 from the sales.

She now hopes to receive a loan to buy more charcoal for her sales business. Siwema will share this loan with her sub-group members Sophia and H. who also have charcoal sales businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Mirian

texts.en:
Mirian is married to Rogelio and the couple has a three-year-old boy.

Mirian sells clothing in the well-known market located in the city of San Lorenzo. She inherited the business from her mother, who is very old and cannot take care of the business anymore. Mirian’s husband makes the clothes in their house and then they sell it.

After a lot of effort, they were able to build their own house. Moreover, she bought a motorcycle in order to sell the clothing in the neighboring towns.

The couple dreams of opening their own store.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for women and men

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas, a 40-year-old single man, lives in a small village close to Nabatieh in South Lebanon. Abbas is a car painter whose work is very professional. He will get married soon and needs a loan for an amount of USD 1,200 to put ceramic tile on the floor of his newly build house. This is the first time Abbas has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: USD 1,200 to put tile on the ground of his newly build house

loans.name: Rose's Hosana Group

texts.en:
Rose is 25-years-old, married with three children, ages 8, 5 and 10 months. She became a fish and chips seller in 2007. She works from 7AM to 10PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80.

Rose now hopes for a loan to purchase more fish and to start a new business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with grocery stores and food sales.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to increase inventory for resale

loans.name: Henmerenciano

texts.es:
El señor Henmerenciano S. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en concubinato con María López y tienen un hijo de 2 años de edad vive en el barrio San Vicente de Carepegua, hace 22 años que trabaja como carpintero.

Desde muy joven se inicio en esta actividad se inició como secretario en una carpintería grande, de ahí adquirió esta habilidad que hoy día constituye su fuente principal de ingreso. Poco a poco fue ahorrando y así montó su pequeña carpintería y empezó a hacer clientes hoy día es una de los mejores carpinteros de la zona.

Con el crédito el cliente comprará maderas en cantidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Henmerenciano S. is 41 years old, lives with María López and they have a 2 year old son. He lives in the Sah Vicente neighborhood of Carepegua and has been working as a carpenter for 22 years. He began this profession when he was young, starting as a secretary in a large carpentry shop. From there he acquired the ability that today provides his primary source of income. Little by little he was saving his money and in this way started his small carpentry business and began to gain clients. Today he is one of the best carpenters in the area. With this loan he will buy large quantities of wood.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Maryam's Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Maryam is married with 5 children between the ages of 10 and 24 years old. She owns a small food vendor store and she is a clothes seller. Everyday she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $155 from her sales.

Maryam is now looking for a loan to buy more food items and clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Sabiha, who has a businesses dealing with charcoal and cassava sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items and clothes for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Susana Alvina

texts.es:
La señora Susana Alvina tiene 36 años de edad, es la fiscal del Banco Comunal  Mujeres al Progreso y vive en Mz 23 lote 5ª en sector Víctor Raúl II etapa Barrio II A, distrito El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú. 
Estudió primaria completa y ya no continuó estudiando porque tuvo que ayudar en su hogar, ya que su madre en esa época estaba muy delicada de salud. Se casó a la edad de 20 años con el señor Julio Padilla Pereda con quien tiene una hija que es estudiante y depende de ella.
Empezó comprando chatarra y vendiéndola, ahora compra chatarra y la vende inmediatamente y recicla toda clase de desechos.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró piezas viejas en los mecánicos y las desarmó para venderlas.
Con este crédito de 400 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará animales para usarlos haciendo trueque en la sierra, donde cambiará con piezas de reciclaje.
Susana sueña con tener una ferretería grande donde pueda brindar empleo.
texts.en:
Susana Alvina is 36 years old, is a member of the Mujeres al Progreso community bank and lives at block 23, lot 5ª in the Victor Raúl II sector, El Porvenir district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department in Peru. She finished primary school and didn't continue studying because she had to help out in her household, since at that time her mother was in bad health. She married at the age of 20 to Julio Padilla Pereda with whom she has a daughter that is a student and dependent upon her. She started buying scrap metal and selling it; she continues doing this as well as recycling all forms of waste products. With her first loan of 300 Soles, which was repaid in 4 months, she purchased old pieces of machinery and dissembled them to sell as parts. With this loan of 400 Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy animals to barter with in the mountains in exchange for recycling items. Susana dreams of having a large hardware store in which she can provide jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals

loans.name: Paulin

texts.fr: Marié et père de trois enfants, A. Paulin n’à pas continué ses études par manque de moyen financier. Devenu un artiste peintre dessinateur, il a un atelier dans la ville d’Aného où il travaille. Il a pour don la créativité et est reconnu dans la ville pour ses dessins. Dans le souci de professionnaliser son atelier il sollicite ce financement pour faire des achats de matériels pour doubler son chiffre d’affaires et faire plus de bénéfices et assurer ainsi l’éducation et l’avenir de ces enfants.
texts.en:
Married and the father of three children, Paulin A. did not pursue his studies due to a lack of financial means. He became a painter and a drawer, and now has a workshop in Aného, where he draws and paints. He's gifted and very creative, and is well known in the city for his drawings. Anxious to professionalize his workshop, he's seeking this loan to purchase materials to double his revenues and make more profit, in order to ensure the education and the future of his children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for his painting workshop

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y su hija D. 9 años. DesD. hace 30 años se dedica a la venta D. diversos productos, como útiles escolares, ahora por campaña naviD.ña se dedica a la venta D. juguetes en la pequeña tienda que instaló en su domicilio.  A Gladis siempre le gustó la idea D. tener un negocio propio, D. administrar su dinero y vender gran cantidad D. productos, ya que el trato con las personas es lo que le agrada, aunque lo difícil es poder vender en tiempos D. crisis, cuando no hay campañas, ni ferias, es por eso que aprovecha los días festivos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y hasta la fecha no tiene problemas D. pago, gracias a que su negocio va muy bien. Desea invertir la cantidad solicitada en la compra D. juguetes y panteones para venderlos en esta navidad.
texts.en:
Gladis, 47, lives with her husband and her 9-year-old daughter. She has sold various products, such as school supplies, for more than 30 years. Now, for the Christmas season, she will sell toys in the little shop that she put into her home. Gladis has always liked the idea of having her own business, handling her own money, and selling lots of products, but it is dealing with people that really appeals to her. The hard part is getting sales in crisis times, when there is no celebration or fair, which is why she makes the most of festival days. This is her third loan with MFP, and up to now she has not had a problem repaying, thanks to the fact that her business is going very well. She wants to invest the requested funds to buy toys and nativity scenes to sell this Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her shop

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
En el Mercado La estación en la ciudad de León, la señora María R. se dedica a su actividad de venta de ropa usada comercializada en su propio tramo el cual abre desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana para atender a sus clientes.

Es de importancia destacar que su tramo se encuentra en el sector de venta de ropas en el Mercado por lo que debe de ser muy sabia para la venta por lo que tiene muchos competidores que también ofrecen la misma mercadería.
Por esta sencilla razón es que ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para surtir su negocio de mas ropa y así brindándole mayores opciones a sus clientes para comprar el producto.
texts.en:
Mrs. María R. works selling used clothing in the La Estación Market in the city of León. The section where she works opens very early in the morning to attend to the customers. It is very important to point out that María is in the section of the market where used clothing is sold, and one must be very wise about sales in this section because there are a lot of competitors who also sell the same merchandise. For this simple reason, she is requesting this loan from Kiva partner Ceprodel, so she can better stock her business with clothing. This way, she will be able to give her customers more options of products they can buy.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used clothing

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en quechua.
Claudia es casada, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Claudia es panificadora, elabora panes típicos de la zona como chapla, actividad que realiza en un horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado Santa Clara de manera ambulatoria.
Claudia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina por sacos.
Los sueños de Claudia son sacar adelante a sus hijos que sean profesionales, tener una buena casa y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the Communal Bank Llamkasum, which means "Let's Work" in Quechua. She is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children. Claudia is a bread baker who makes bread typical to the area, such as chapla. She bakes in a rented oven, and sells in the Santa Clara market. Claudia needs a loan of 1050 soles which she will use to purchase sacks of flour. Claudia dreams of helping her children get ahead so they become professionals, having a good home, and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of flour

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité fue la Señora Cecilia Pico, ella es integrante del comité Medalla Milagrosa del Barrio Fátima, quien le comento a la Señora Zully López quien a su  vez formo el comité en dicha zona. 
El comité se denomina “Tajy Poty”, y está constituido  por 24 señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona.
Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser Venta de: Pantalones, remeras, tomates, cebollas, cremas para el rostro,  manzanas, bananas, gaseosas, galletitas, caramelos, melones, sandias, azúcar, leche, aceite, escobas, Trapo de piso, detergente, suavizante, Carnes, empanadas cadenas, pulseras, pintura, etc., y otras que emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo.
Las señoras retiran un crédito de Gs 300.000 a Gs 800.000 c/u
El Crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías para y artículos de primera necesidad que lo pondrán a la venta.

Nombre y Apellido	Actividad
Zully Olinda L.	Venta de Ropa
 Leidi L.	Venta de Ropa
Deida M.	Venta Cosméticos
Lida G.	Costura
Silvia G.	Kiosco
Mirta B.	Venta de Ropas y Zapatos
Emiliana T.	Venta de Comidas
Lidia P.(no esta en la foto)	Venta De Comidas
Rosana B.(no esta en la foto)	Venta de Lencería
Marina C.	Cotillón
Cristina P.	Pintura
Celsa M.	Venta de Cosméticos
Dora P.	Venta De Cosméticos
Zoraida B.	Despensa
Maria G.	Despensa 
Margarita S.	Despensa
Maria S.	Copetín
Delia D. 	Venta de Ropas
Selva Díaz	Venta de Plásticos
Sonia P.(no esta en la foto)	Venta De Joyas
Lidia V.	Venta De Ropa
Diona B.	Venta De Ropa
Zully G.	Venta de Joyas
Maria T.	Venta de Huevo y Queso
texts.en:
The group was formed when Cecilia Pico, a member of the Medalla Milagrosa del Barrio Fátima group, talked to Zully López about forming a committee in her neighborhood. The committee López founded calls itself "Tajy Poty" and is made up of 24 very active and supportive women from the same neighborhood. The women make a living in a variety of activities, such as selling: pants, T-shirts, tomatos, onions, facial cream, apples, bananas, soft drinks, cookies, caramels, melons, watermelons, sugar, milk, oil, brooms, cleaning rags, detergents, fabric softeners, meats, empanadas, chains, bracelets, makeup, etc., and others will learn a new trade and make a fixed income. The women increased their loan request from 300,000 Gs to 800,000 Gs, and the money will be used to purchase supplies and items of primary need so they will be able to make sales.

Name Activity

Zully Olinda L. Clothing sales

Leidi L. Clothing sales

Deida M. Cosmetic sales

Lida G. Seamstress

Maria G. Convenience store

Margarita S. Convenience store

Delia D. Clothing sales

Selva Díaz Plastics sales

Sonia P. (not pictured) Jewelry sales

Lidia V. Clothing sales

Diona B. Clothing sales

Zully G. Jewelry sales

Maria T. Egg and cheese sales


Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise and supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodocia es socia del Bancomunal El Sembrador. 
Teodocia es conviviente tiene 48 años, tres hijos de 23, 19 y 12 años, él ultima esta en la escuela estatal.
Cuando Teodocia se separo de su primera pareja  se vio en la necesidad de trabajar en la venta de ropa de segunda, tuvo un puesto alquilado en la Av. Grau, pero lo perdió por que su hijo estaba metido en el pandillaje y tuvo que empezar a vender ropa usada de casa en casa, para estar mas cerca de su hijo.   
Desde que esta en Finca tiene la facilidad de prestamos, que le ayudan a mover mercadería, en el Bancomunal ella aprendió a ahorra. 
Teodocia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para comprar mercadería por maleta a personas que se van de viaje, ella vende a sus vecinos y recomendados.
El sueño de Teodocia es poner un bazar de ropa.
texts.en:
Teodocia is a member of Bancomunal Sembrador. Teodocia is 48 years old and has three children of 23, 19 and 12 years. The youngest attends state school. When Teodocia separated from her first partner, she saw the necessity of selling secondhand clothing. She rented a place in Av. Grau, but she lost it when her son became involved with gangs, and she had to begin selling secondhand clothing from house to house to be closer to her son. Since she has been with Finca, she has found it much easier to borrow in order to purchase merchandise. With Bancomunal, she has learned how to save. Teodocia needs a loan of $275 to purchase clothing for people who travel. She sells to her neighbors and recommended individuals. Teodocia’s dream is to have a clothing bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of clothing for people who travel

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es: Carlota es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante, a sus 59 años ha conseguido tener su propia casa, todavía tiene muchas fuerzas para seguir trabajando y velar por el bienestar de su única hija, Nery de 20 años. Es una madre muy amorosa, se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa y es muy solicitada por sus clientes, a quienes siempre recibe muy contenta, ya que sabe que ellos son muy importantes para el progreso de su negocio. Su puesto está ubicado en el mercado Túpac Amaru (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), donde vende casacas, chompas, pantalones, etc., lo que más le gusta de su negocio es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, a quienes siempre hace reír, debido a la alegría que le pone a todo lo que hace. Lleva 20 años en este trabajo y lo que menos le gusta es permanecer todo el día en su puesto, ya que a veces desea salir a disfrutar de los rayos del sol. Carlota anhela tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender más prendas y atender mejor a sus clientes, sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para mejorar su vida. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta de haberlo obtenido y tiene mucha confianza en que lo pagará a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita comprará más ropa para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Carlota is a woman who has always struggled to get ahead. At her 59 years she has been able to acquire her own home, and she still has the strength to keep on working and look after the well-being of her only daughter, Nery, who is 20 years old. She is a very loving mother and works in the clothes-selling business. She is very sought after by her customers, who she happily attends to as she knows they are very important to her business. Her stand is located in the Túpac Amaru market (an important market in Juliaca) where she sells coats, sweaters, pants, etc. What she likes most about her business is talking with the other sellers, who she always makes laugh because of the good mood she is in all the time. She has been doing this type of work for 20 years and what she likes least about it is having to stay all day at her stand, as sometimes she would like to go out and enjoy the sun. Carlota hopes someday to have a bigger store where she can sell more clothing and take better care of her customers, and she knows she has to work hard to improve her life. This is her second loan with MFP. She is pleased to have it and is very confident that she will repay it on time. She is respected in her communal bank and always gets their meetings under control. With the 2,000 soles she is requesting, she will buy more clothing so she can have more goods to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory.

loans.name: Kodirkul

texts.ru: Кодиркул - мужчина 47 лет. Женат и отец 5-х детей. Имеет высшее образование. Занимается откормом и продажей скота, а также сдает мясо мясникам. Жена занимается переработкой молока, а также переработкой пряжи. Сыновья помогают отцу. Невестки помогают по хозяйству. А в свободное время продают молоко. Кодиркул покупает скот и откормив его, продает мясникам. Кодиркул уже три года берет у нас кредит. Он регулярно покупает скот, и до этого времени у него накопилось большое количество скота. За очередной займ он опять собирается пополнить свое стадо.
texts.en:
Kodirkul is a 47 year-old man. He is married and has 5 children. He has a university diploma. Kodirkul has a cattle rearing business, and he also sells meat to butchers. His wife processes milk and yarn. The sons help their father. The daughters-in-law help Kodirkul's wife around the house. They sell milk in their free time. Kodirkul purchases cattle, and after rearing it sells it to butchers. Kodirkul has been receiving our loans for 3 years. He buys cattle regularly and has a large number of animals. He plans to buy more cattle with his next loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle Rearing and Sales

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr:
Madame S. exerce comme activité le commerce des articles de mercerie. Elle a commencé ce commerce en 1999 et s’approvisionne marché local de Bè à lomé. Son stock actuel de marchandises est épuisé, pour rehausser son stock elle s’adresse à WAGES pour solliciter un crédit pour acheter des tissus, des grippures, des fils, des aiguilles , des boutons et divers articles de mercerie.
 Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. has a business selling sewing notions. She began this business in 1999 and stocks up at the local market of Bè in Lomé. Her present inventory of merchandise is expended and to replenish it, she has come to WAGES to ask for a loan to buy cloth, snaps, thread, needles, buttons, and various other sewing notions.

She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cloth, snaps, thread, needles, and various other items for sewing

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 42-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Samir has owned a barbershop for twenty-five years. Samir requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to change his salon’s décor. This is the first time that Samir has requested a loan.
Samir is special in his work because he does it well and has competitive prices. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Samir decided on doing this business because of his experience since he learned it when he was young. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To change his salon’s décor.

loans.name: Xiomara Isabel

texts.es: Xiomara es soltera,  vive con sus padres, no tiene hijos, trabaja como Alguacil  en la corte Suprema de Justicia desde hace 2 años, está solicitando su 1er credito para la Construccion de una habitacion para asi tener mejor comodidad y privacidad, ella comparte con sus padres los gastos del hogar, se caracteriza por ser una joven humilde en su labor de trabajo y en su barrio, ademas profesa la religion evangelica, actualmente esta estudiando una carrera en la universidad URACCAN en Nueva  Guinea,  su sueño es tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, estabilidad laboral para así  ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Xiomara is single, lives with her parents, and has no children. She has been working as a bailiff in the Supreme Court of Justice for two years. She is now asking for her first loan so that she can add on a room and so have more comfort and privacy. Xiomara shares with her parents all the household expenses. She is considered a modest young woman both at work and in the neighbourhood and belongs to the evangelical religion. Currently she is studying at the URACCAN university in Nueva Guinea. Her dream is to have her own house with better living conditions, and steady work so that she can help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to add on a room to her parents' house

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian G. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, in the province of Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old, married, and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Vivian has recently started a business venture in the agriculture sector, which she owns & operates. While not the only means of generating revenue for this business, the main source of its income is raising pigs for sale.

In 2009, Vivian joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Vivian's first loan through GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership consists mostly of farmers, fishermen and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her agriculture business

location.town: Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine E. M. is married and has 5 dependants. She has received schooling through senior high school. Josephine E. makes and sells palm and coconut oil at Amissano in Elmina, which she has done since 1997. Her husband is a farmer. Josephine E. uses her income to pay bills. She will use the loan to buy more beans and plantain to add to what she trades in. With the new profits from her expanded business, Josephine E. plans to further the children's education.

loans.use: To buy more beans and plantain to add to what she trades in.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is married and has four children, two girls and two boys.  Her oldest child is 18 and will soon finish high school.  Epiphanie lives with her family in Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin. She has been running a general store for two and a half years. She primarily sells drinks, including sodas, juices, and alcohol.  Ephiphanie also keeps a selection of other goods, including fabric, soap, snacks, and medicines. She buys her products in Porto-Novo and also in Cotonou, a large city that is about an hour away.  

Before opening her store, Epiphanie was a hairdresser. She says that she is now more profitable than before, but that business could still be better.  Ephiphanie is seeking a loan from Alide, a Kiva field partner in Benin, to increase her sales. With the help of a loan, Epiphanie would like to buy her goods in bulk. This will help her to save money and to expand her operations. Specifically, she hopes to buy more drinks, candy, and rice.

loans.use: Purchase of sweets, drinks, and rice

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet manages a pharmacy in the public market of Andres Bonifacion in Diffun, Quirino. With the income that she generates from her pharmacy, she was able to help her husband to send their three children to school. 

Now, she needs a loan to purchase additional medical products to sell in her pharmacy. She would like to borrow PHP 35,0000.00 to purchase additional merchandise. Janet and her husband are doing their best to providing their family with a higher standard of living. Janet wants her business to grow because she believes that it is a big help to people in their search for cheaper and effective medicines for their illnesses.   

Janet is 48 years old and happily married to Roy. The couple was blessed with five children. Two of her children have graduated from college and three are still studying. They are Sande Cris, Kathleen, Ilohim, Jinkishe and Jared Omega. She is hoping that her younger children can finish their studies like her two older children.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Ffitig

texts.en: Ffitig M. is currently in the business of selling bread and eggs and is requesting a loan to stock more eggs to sell.  Ffitig is 39 years old and is Married with a husband that is a teacher. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a backery BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stocking more eggs to sell

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Canton Camache Chiquito Group

texts.es:
Grupo de personas trabajadoras de la comunidad deCanton Camache Chiquito, Santo Tomas La 						
Union Suchitepequez, que viven en condiciones  económicas precarias la cual ellas						
con el tiempo han venido superando las condiciones en las se encuentran, atreves de sus						
negocios que emprendieron hace tres años como crianza de animales, tales como cerdos,						
pollos y  venta de blusas, zapatos de hule y como también venta de cacao, la cual estas 						
personas  iniciaron sus  negocios  con la visión de ser  personas ejemplares						
atrabes de apoyar a sus hijos para que tengan un nivel académico aceptable, y así el mejoramiento de sus 						
condiciones de vida, y para lograr alcanzar esta visión se vieron en la necesidad de acudir 						
a la asociación Asdir, a realizar un préstamo que les sirva del fortalecimiento de su capital e						
incremento de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
A group of working women who live in unstable economic conditions of the community of Canton Camache Chiquito, Santo Tomas La Union Suchitepeques . They have improved the conditions with the businesses they started three years ago, such as breeding pigs and chickens, selling blouses, rubber shoes, cacao. They started their businesses with the idea of being model individuals supporting their children to get acceptable academic studies and thus improve their living conditions. To reach this goal they found it necessary to approach Asociación Asdir to obtain a loan to strengthen their capital and increase their income.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Vai

texts.en: Vai Y., 65 years old, lives with her family members in Battambang province in Cambodia. Her husband, Yeng Chhoun, is 67 years of age and they have five married and one single child. Their single child sells cooking ingredients to earn a living. Presently, the couple earns a living by growing rice on their half hectare of land that they inherited from their parents, and they currently earn an average of $2 per day. Vai Y. has asked for a loan of US$700 for her child’s grocery business. She proposes to use the rest of the loan for her farming business.

loans.use: For her child's grocery business.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita and her family live in the village of Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Aguilar and they are blessed with four children. They are all studying in tertiary and secondary education. Despite the hardships and difficulties in life, she and her husband are striving hard to earn a living and to provide them with their educational needs.  

The common source of their income is farming.  Her husband cultivates their farm by planting rice and vegetables. Clarita is engaged in a fish-vending business in their village to help her husband in providing the needs of their family. With a small amount of capital at hand, she purchases her products at the Bayombong public market and then sells them in their village.  She can earn a weekly income of $15. 

Since her business is profitable, she wants to acquire more products so that she can have a bigger income.  She is now asking for financial assistance from the Kiva lenders amounting to PHP13,000.  This will be used to buy additional kilos of fish that she can sell in their village.

loans.use: To buy kilos of fish

loans.name: Melituna

texts.en:
Melituna P. is a 57-year-old businesswoman from Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.  She lives with her husband Eugenio, a pensioner and their three children, one of whom is still in college.

Melituna owns a general store located in their house. She is also into direct selling of cosmetics products.  She earns at least P5,000.00 a month from these combined business activities.

She has been with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative for two years, since 2007.  Now on her ninth loan cycle, she applied for a loan of P8,000.00 from  CCT to purchase more cosmetics products for her clients.  She will also use a portion of the funds for her child’s education.  



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. 

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Démé sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 50 ans et 2 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Konobougou, sous préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à des liens de voisinage et de commerce. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers et collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci d’avoir constamment un appui financier pour leurs activités. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Ce  nouveau prêt servira à acheter, des condiments alimentaires et  une grande quantité d’articles divers tels que les produits manufacturés. 
Les produits sont achetés en grande partie à Bamako et sont revendus sur place, au marché et au bord du goudron à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA  par mois. Les bénéfices sont partagés entre  la nourriture, la santé et  les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Démé group are women with an average age of 50 years and two children. They live with their husbands and children in large traditional families in the village of Konobougou, in the district of Barouéli, in the region of Ségou, in the Republic of Mali. They met each other through being neighbors and sharing a common interest in retail. They sell a variety of materials/products and collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to ensure constant financial support for their activities. They are currently on their second group loan, the first of which was correctly reimbursed. This new loan will allow them to purchase food condiments and a large quantity of diverse articles such as manufactured productions. These products are largely purchase din Bamako and re-sold at the open air markets and on the side of the road to a clientele of both women and men. They hope to each make a monthly profit of approximately 25,000 FCFA [approximately 57 USD], which would be used to purchase food, health products and towards other activities.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of products

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción tiene 65 años, vive con su esposa (Antonia), de 67 años; tiene 4 hijos que ya son mayores y no viven con él, cada uno tiene su propia familia. Los días de este hombre trabajador transcurren en la tranquilidad del campo porque se dedica a la agricultura.

Su rutina de trabajo empieza preparando la tierra con fertilizantes y sembrando la semilla. Los productos que cultiva son la papa, alverjas y choclos, él aprendió a cultivar desde pequeño, aunque no tuvo la oportunidad de conocer a sus padres se crió con personas trabajadoras que le enseñaron a luchar y a salir adelante. 
A Concepción le gusta dedicarse a la agricultura porque es el oficio con el cual ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y es lo que han aprendido a hacer la mayoría de hombres que viven por esta parte del Perú; además lo considera muy rentable porque la calidad de papa, choclo y arveja que siembra le permiten venderlas y obtener buenas ganancias.
A su vez, también cría y vende cuyes de buena raza, él empezó con esta actividad porque una de sus hijas le regalo un par y luego vio una buena oportunidad de hacer negocio y empezó a reproducirlos. 
En el futuro, Concepción tiene pensado sembrar mayor cantidad de papa y llegar a tener una granja de cuyes.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está seguro que será responsable, como siempre, con cada pago; además, está muy satisfecho con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque son personas de confianza. Concepción ya tiene pensado invertir el dinero del préstamo en fertilizantes y abono, también comprará algunos cuyes para continuar con su granja.
texts.en:
Concepción, 65, lives with his wife, Antonia, 67. He has 4 adult children that no longer live with him; each has their own family. His work days pass peacefully because he is a farmer. His work routine begins with him preparing the soil with fertilizers and sowing seeds. He farms potatoes, peas and corn. He learned to farm as a little boy. Although he never knew who his parents were, he grew up among working people that showed him how to work to get ahead in life. Concepción loves farming because it is the line of work that allowed him to see his children get ahead in life and it is what most of the men that live in this area of Perú have learned to do. Besides, he considers it profitable because the quality of the potato, corn and peas that he grows allows him to sell them at good prices. In addition, he also raises a good breed of guinea pigs. He began this activity because one of his daughters gave his a pair as a gift and he saw a good opportunity to make extra income breeding them. In the future, Concepción intends to increase his potato crop and to have a guinea pig farm. This is his third loan with MFP and he is sure that he will be responsible, as always, with each payment. Besides, he is very satisfied with his communal bank's work because they are all trustworthy people. Concepción has already decided that the funds will be used to buy both chemical and natural fertilizers; he will also buy a few guinea pigs to continue with his farm.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Nehemia's Group

texts.en:
Nehemia C. is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 43 years old. Nehemia is the group leader of an eighteen-member group loan offered by the Kiva field partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.The official name of this borrower's group is Nehemia C.' Group.

Nehemia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Nehemia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 500 PHP daily.

In 2007, Nehemia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Nehemia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: T. Nguyễn V. (20201060032) is a 47-year-old male living in the town of Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. He is married and has two school-aged children. T. owns and operates a business providing food services to local community members. He has been engaged in this business for over twelve years and earns approximately 5,300,000 VND a month. In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding his business. T. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND which will again be used to invest in expanding his business. The loan will be his 3rd from SEDA. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** T. Nguyễn V. (20201060032) là 47 tuổi nam. Anh ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Anh ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, T. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ thực phẩm cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 5,300,000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ T. chính giúp cải thiện điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,840,000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ T. chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Sulaymon

texts.ru: Дустов Сулаймон проживает в районе А. Джоми. Возраст, 49 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Дустов Сулаймон в области животноводства работает более 16 лет. Он откармливает и продает скот. Дустов Сулаймон увеличивает их количество, чтобы получить большую прибыль. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
D. Sulayman lives in the A. Jomi region. He's forty-nine years old, married and has six children. He has worked in the field of animal husbandry for more than sixteen years. He fattens and then sells cattle. D. is now increasing the head count of his herd so that he may earn a profit. He's asking for a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor” desde hace 15 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de carne.

Delia nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital y así implementar mejor su negocio.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  carne de cordero, alpaca, porcino, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es incrementar sus ganancias. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Delia has been a partner for 15 years in the “God is Love” Community Bank. She lives in the district of Juliaca, province of San Román, department of Puno. She is 31 years of age, has a partner and 2 children. She studied up to high school and dedicates herself to the buying and selling of meat. Delia tells us that her first loan with “Manuela Ramos Movement,” was S/. 300.00 and was used to increase her capital and thus better her business. She will request a loan of S/. 1,000.00, which will enable her to purchase meats such a lamb, llama, pork, etc. Her future dream is to increase her earnings. What Delia likes most about her Community Bank is their punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meats such a lamb, llama, pork, etc.

loans.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es:
el joven Angel Antonio A. tiene 19 años de edad, esta soltero, es el ultimo de cinco hermanos y se dedica a la reparacion y activacion de celulares desde hace 2 años.
 
su centro de trabajo esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion y desea trasladarlo a una zona mas centrica para captar mas clientes.
esta solicitando el credito para comprar repuestos para reparar telefonos moviles.
 
su sueño es modernizar su taller con nuevas herramientas y ponerse al dia con sus competidores.
texts.en:
Young Angel Antonio is 19 years of age, single, and the youngest of five brothers. For two years he has been repairing and setting-up cell phones.

His work place is located in his home and he wants to move it to a more central area in order to attract more customers.

He is requesting this loan to buy parts for repairing cell phones.

His dream is to modernize his workshop with new tools and catch-up with his competitors.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy screens, keyboards, housings, chargers, and circuits for cell phones

loans.name: Georges

texts.en:
Georges is a 47-year-old married man with three children. He has been working for the past 12 years as a garden arranger. He works at the request of his customers, organizing their gardens and applying pesticides, etc. His children contribute with him to cover the family expenses. 

He already has taken a loan from Ameen and he has been a reliable borrower with on-time repayments throughout his loan cycle. He has also decided to repay his full loan amount several months early. Today, Georges is requesting a new loan of $2,000 to purchase a new developed herb cutter to expand  his business productivity and meet his customers’ demands.

loans.use: purchase a new developed herb cutter

loans.name: Adil

texts.en: Adil A., born in 1971, is married and has two children. He and his family live in the Absheron region, where he has been farming for six years. He is now requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to buy fertilizers and seeds to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa O. is married and has eight dependents. She has received junior high education.  Adjoa cooks 'banku' (a cornmeal-based staple) for sale near a school at Abura. She has been preparing 'banku' for sale for some time now. Her husband is a farmer.  

Adjoa uses her income she acquires from her sales to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more maize to use to prepare her 'banku' for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more maize to prepare her 'banku' for sale

loans.name: Demin Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Demin sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans  et  4 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à KAMALEN SIRAKORO un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Le prêt précédent s’est  bien  dénoué. 
Les membres du groupe font la vente de  poissons fumés (tels Sali K.),  de gingembre et  de fruits et légumes.       
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, Sali K. compte acheter,  50kg de poissons fumés . Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et revend au marché  de Kamalen Sirakoro  et à domicile, au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour devenir grossiste afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The members of group Demin are basically married women having an average age of 35 years old and 4 children. They live mostly in monogamous families at KAMALEN SIRAKORO, one of the villages of the Sikasso district, third administrative region of Mali. They are on their third loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution inorder to meet the needs of their clients. The preceding loan is repaid. Members of the group sell smoked fish (like Sali K.), ginger, fruits and vegetables. With their new loan, Sali K. intend to buy 50 kg of smoked fish. She gets her supplies in the big market of Sikasso town, retails at the Kamalen Sirakoro market and at home for cash to customers made up of women. She envisions to make a monthly profit of 25.500FCFA of which part will be used for saving and the needs of the family, and the other part will be invested in the business. They intend to have more capital in order to become wholesalers to better meet the needs of their clientele.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of smoked fish

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita A. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old and is married with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Esterlita owns and operates a business venture making rope made of abaca, which she sells to local community members. She also produces and sells mats made of abaca. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esterlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 1st loan taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Omukabare Tukundane Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
M. Josephat is a hardworking and well-trained entrepreneur who runs a veterinary drug shop alongside his other coffee and banana sales business in Omukabare, Bushenyi. This business has been in place for a period of twenty-five years and has been bringing him dividends close to 50,000 Ugandan shillings on a weekly basis. As a result,he has been able to make ends meet in as far as consolidating his operations.

This married father of eight has worked tirelessly to see to it that his family's fortunes improve every year. With his business, he has given all his children an education. His main drawback, however, all this while, has been having a small amount of stock which has, in a way, hindered the growth and expansion of his business. With this loan, he looks forward to restocking his veterinary drug shop. He figures he will be in a place of vantage to earn more revenue by buying, and later reselling to his clients, additional veterinary drugs.

Josephat is fully upbeat about his future prospects in his business. This he says on the grounds of his track record of hard work.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs for his shop

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion 6 Group

texts.en:
Dignorah is the coordinator of her group Canal De Bendicion (Channel of Blessing), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her common-law husband and their two children.

Dignorah is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling shoes and beauty products by purchasing more merchandise. She will use the profits to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy Avon beauty products and shoes

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 65 años, es un hombre amante al campo, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 6 hijos. Desde su niñez  se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sembrando lechuga, espinaca y  hierbas aromáticas, siempre y cuando estén en temporada cada producto. Desde entonces esta en constante actividad, aplicando abono y removiendo la tierra, para asegurar que sus cultivos estén bien cuidados. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposo e hijos, tanto en la recolección de los productos como en su comercialización. Para él es importante continuar cultivando  sus tierras y buscar otras estrategias de venta que le generen más ganancias. Su mayor anhelo es tener su granja de patos, gallinas, cuy y conejo; ya que el espacio que tiene en su casa se acondiciona para tal propósito. Este es décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que le crédito le será muy provechoso para invertir en sus cultivos,  por lo que compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas. Sus compañeras de le bromean mucho, por lo que es el único varón integrante a su grupo. El dinero, las va invertir en la compra de fertilizantes para sus cultivos y comprará madera para fabricar corral apropiado para su añorada granja.
texts.en:
Victor is a 65 year old gentleman who loves living in the country. He has his own home where he lives with his wife and six children. Ever since he was a young man, Victor has been dedicated to agriculture, growing lettuce, spinach, and aromatic herbs according to the season. Since then farming has become a constant activity, continually applying compost and plowing the land to ensure that the crops receive the best care. Occasionally he receives the help of his wife and children, specifically with the harvesting of his products so that they can be sold. It is very important for Victor to continue cultivating his land and looking for sales strategies that will generate more profits. His greatest wish is to have a farm with ducks, chickens, guinea pigs, and rabbits since he already has a space at his house that is set aside for this purpose.

This is his tenth loan with MFP. Victor knows that the loan will be valuable for investing in his crops, so he promises to complete all of his payments. The other group members tease him frequently since he is the only male member of his group. His loan will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers for his crops and wood to build an appropriately sized corral for his farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & wood for building a corral

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is currently in the business of selling bread, fried fish and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock onions and cooking oil to sell. She is 24 years old and married to a businessman. She has no children yet. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a rental house.

loans.use: To stock onions and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta Z. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Loreta is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Loreta owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Loreta has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Loreta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loreta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Loreta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Angelino's Group

texts.en:
Angelino S., 50, is married and has eight adult-aged children. He is from the village of Linglingay, part of Angadanan municipality within the province of Isabela on the Luzon Islands. To make a living, Angelino sells fruits and vegetables to the community. He has been in business for over 25 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP monthly. He is also the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

In 2010, Angelino joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. He is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional produce to sell. He plans to use all additional revenue generated to expand his business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional produce to sell

loans.name: Paul  Njenga

texts.en:
Paul, a 23-year-old single gentleman, sells children's and ladies' clothes by hawking in the Nairobi Central Business District (N.C.B.D). He lives in Kangemi and has been in this business for four years, with a monthly income of Kshs.4,000.

Paul came to learn about KADET LTD through the Credit officer, and he is now applying for his first loan of Kshs.10,000 to buy more clothes to sell and to rent a stall which will give his customers easy access to his goods. He hopes to grow his business with the profit generated and later hopes to own a boutique and distribute school uniforms.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and  rent a stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Ashir

texts.ru: Худойбердиев Ашир житель Шахритуского района. Возраст, 43 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Ашир имеет среднее образование. Более 15 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений. Он хочет получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: Ashir K. lives in the Shahrituz region.  He is 43 years old.  He is married and has five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Ashir has secondary education.  He has been in the agriculture business for more than fifteen years.  He rents out a plot of land where he grows vegetables.  He is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer.  He wants to collect a good harvest for resale.

loans.use: Закуп минеральных удобрений

loans.name: Clémentine

texts.fr: H. Clémentine est née vers 1983 à Ekpè, dans le commune de Sèmè-Podji. Clémentine, analphabète, est mariée à AKISSOE Eric, un soudeur. Clémentine est mère de trois (03) enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. La famille vit depuis environs dix (10) ans à Agbalilamè un quartier de la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Les charges familiales sont supportées ensemble par le couple. Clémentine vend principalement de façon ambulante des chaussures qu’elle achète à Dantokpa le marché internationale du Bénin mais également des sacs depuis sept (07) ans. Clémentine sollicite auprès de ALIDé ce nouveau crédit pour augmenter son stock de produits (chaussures et sacs) et développer son activité. Clémentine n’a pas enregistré de difficultés au cours de l’exercice de son activité et a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurement obtenus auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Clémentine was born around 1983 in Ekpè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji.  She is illiterate and is married to AKISSOE Eric, a welder.  Clémentine is the mother of three children, some of whom are in school.  The family has been living for about ten years in Agbalilamè, a district in Sèmè-Podji. Family expenses are covered jointly by the couple. 

For seven years, Clémentine had gone door-to-door selling mainly shoes.  She gets her supplies of shoes, and also handbags, at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is requesting this new loan from ALIDé for increasing her inventory (shoes and bags) and for developing her business.  Clémentine hasn't noted any problems in operating her business, and she has indeed repaid the previous loans she obtained from ALIDé.

loans.use: Buying shoes and bags

loans.name: Jeogelyn Calinga Group

texts.en:
Jeogelyn C. is from the village of Stimson Abordo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married and has two school-aged children. Jeogelyn is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jeogelyn C.’s Group.

To make a living, Jeogelyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. Jeogelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In April 2010, Jeogelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeogelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Jeogelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Jeogelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

location.town: Ozamis-Stimson Abordo, Ozamiz City Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 35 years old and married to a businessman. They have two children who are two and seven years old. One of her children goes to school.

Alice sells vegetables such as peas, tomatoes and beans. She has been in this business for ten years. She would like to get this loan to buy more vegetables to sell. The profit from this business will be used for savings and to construct a house. 

Her business has allowed her to do many things, like paying school fees for her children. She dreams of having a loan amount of one million Rwandan francs in the future.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Santayian Ole

texts.en:
Santayian has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last 20 years. He is 50 years old, married to Nemunyera Ene Satayian and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy  five cows which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In future, Santayian hopes to expand his herd and also develop his plot of land located in Naivasha town centre.

loans.use: To buy  five  cows which he will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: Jina I.  tiene 53 años, es  madre soltera y tiene  7 hijos mayores de edad a quienes ha criado y educado bajo su propio esfuerzo  y dedicación, vive en Puente Piedra y pertenece al grupo “Nuevo Amanecer”. Desde que llego a Lima, hace mas de 30 años  de su tierra Iquitos,  inicio su negocio ofreciendo condimentos, que ella misma compraba y empaquetaba,  a diferentes mercados de su distrito. Poco a poco sus ventas se fueron incrementando y fue invirtiendo más  logrando colocar su mercadería a mercados más lejanos a su distrito. Con estas ventas pudo arreglar su casa que lo adquirió con mucho esfuerzo y dar mayor comodidad a sus hijos. Actualmente se siente feliz de ser parte de este grupo ya que, ello le permite contar con un capital de trabajo para poder incrementar su negocio y lograr ahorrar para poder adquirir un puesto propio donde pueda implementar  con mejores espacios y comodidad para su trabajo. El reciente préstamo será invertido en la compra de mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en: Jina I. is 53 years old, is a single mother and has 7 adult children whom she has taken care of and educated through her own hard work and dedication. She lives in Puente Piedra and belongs to the group “Nuevo Amanecer” (“New Dawn”). Ever since Jina arrived in Lima over 30 years ago from Iquitos, her homeland, Jina began selling seasonings that she bought and packaged, and sold to different markets in the district. Little by little, Jina’s sales increased and she invested more in her business and was able to sell her merchandize to markets more distant from her area. With the sales, she was able to fix her home which she obtained with a lot of hard work to give greater comfort to her children. At present, Jina is happy to be a part of this group since she is able to have work capital to be able to keep expanding her business and save enough to be able to have her own stall where she can work with more space and comfort for her job. The loan will be used to buy merchandize for her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandize for her business.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz J. is from the village of Mansabay Alto. She is 56 years old. Paz is widowed and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, Paz owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Paz has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Paz joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Paz is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Paz from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Senina

texts.en:
Senina T. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 49 years old. Senina is married. 

To make a living, Senina raises crops, primarily rice and corn, for sale.

Senina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Senina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her farm. 

About CEVI:
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides its clients credit, but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Princilla T.

texts.en: Here is Princilla T. S., a small-scale businesswoman in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Princilla sells tailoring materials. She has been in this business for 12 years now. She has requested a loan of SLL 5,000,000.00 from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, she will buy more goods to add to her business--threads, zippers, lace, poplins, etc. Princilla was born in Makeni. She is married to a trader, and the couple has three children.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Ra´món Elías

texts.es:
Después de trabajar durante años como empleado en una ferretería, Ramón Elías M. V., decidió crear su propio negocio con lo aprendido en su oficio y con la ilusión de mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Fue entonces cuando con las ganas, sus manos y su conocimiento sumado a unos pocos ahorros inició su propia ferretería, ubicada en la Plaza de Mercadeo de Guarne, municipio al oriente de Antioquia-Colombia. Además de vender diferentes herramientas y artículos propios de dicho mercado, Ramón repara ollas a presión. 

Para ampliar su negocio y mejorar su servicio de reparación, este emprendedor necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido y adquirir nuevas herramientas para reparar las ollas. En el futuro espera que su ferretería sea una de las más grandes y reconocidas en el municipio.
texts.en:
After working for years as an employee at a hardware shop, Ramón Elías M. V. decided to create his own business with what he learned at his trade and with the dream of improving his quality of life.   

It was then, that with his enthusiasm, his hands and his knowledge, he got together a few savings and started his own hardware store, located in the Plaza de Mercadeo in Guarne, a town located in eastern Antioquia, Colombia. Besides selling different tools and items in the market, Ramón repairs pressure cookers.   

To grow his business and improve his repair service, this enterprising man needs a loan to buy inventory and acquire new tools to repair the cookers. In the future, he hopes that his hardware store will be one of the biggest and most well known in town.

loans.use: To buy inventory and repair tools.

loans.name: Beviena

texts.en:
Beviena M. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old. Beviena is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Beviena owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling products for daily use, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & beverages.  Beviena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Beviena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
