Beviena is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like breads & canned goods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Beviena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like breads & canned goods

loans.name: León Darío

texts.es:
León Darío C. vive en la ciudad de Medellín. Hace 10 años comenzó con su negocio, una tienda donde vendía diferentes productos, pero hace 3 años decidió cambiar su actividad y se dedicó a la panadería. Actualmente él es la única persona que trabaja en el local por lo que debe cerrarlo cuando algún cliente hace pedidos a domicilio. 

León Darío debe salir a entregarlos él mismo por lo que ha pensado en la necesidad de vincular a otra persona que le ayude, sin embargo por el momento, la solución para agilizar las entregas, es poder acceder al crédito para comprar un vehículo (moto) y así poder hacer los domicilios más rápido, lo que evitaría que tenga que cerrar su negocio durante largos períodos de tiempo.
texts.en:
León Darío C. lives in the city of Medellín.  He started his own business 10 years ago: a store where he sold different products.  However, 3 years ago he decided to change business and start a bakery.  Currently, he is the only person who works in his bakery which means that he has to close it when customers make orders for home delivery.

As León Darío must go out to deliver his orders, he has considered working with another person who can help him.  However, at the moment his solution for speeding up his deliveries is to take a loan and buy a vehicle (motorbike) which will help him make his deliveries more quickly.  This will mean that he will no longer have to close his business for long periods of time.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for making his deliveries

loans.name: Olga Marita

texts.es:
La señora Olga es socia del banco comunal Nuevas Amigas del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos.
Lleva un año trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas, esta actividad la realiza en forma ambulatoria en una calle donde hay mucho tránsito de personas desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 soles comprara 5 jabas de gaseosas, 2 paquetes de agua, ½ saco de azúcar, ¼ de canela, ¼ clavo de olor, 5 kilos de maíz morado, ½ medio ciento de  botellas con tapas.

Sus dos hijos son el motivo que tiene para trabajar de sol a sol para que no les falte nada y puedan estudiar sin ningún problema, con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos ha podido surtir un poco mas su negocio, y esta agradecida por las charlas educativos que le ha sido de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" in the Calleria district of the Ucayali department.  She is 44 years old and is a single mother with 2 children. 

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos organization for a year.  She sells frozen drinks from 9 in the morning until 5 in the evening on a street that has a lot of foot traffic.

With this new loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles, she will buy 5 crates of soft drinks, 2 cases of bottled water, 1/2 saco (about 75 pounds) of sugar, 1/4 saco (about 38 pounds) of cinnamon, 1/4 saco (about 38 pounds) of cloves, 5 kilos of purple corn and 50 bottles with caps.  

Her 2 children are her motivation to keep working from dawn til dusk, so that they will lack for nothing and be able to continue their education without any problems.  With the loans from Manuela Ramos, she has been able to better stock her business.  She also appreciates the educational talks provided by the organization; they been a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, mineral water and supplies to make soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two bags of flour, two tins of oil, yeast, sugar and baking powder

loans.name: Nusura

texts.en:
Nusura M. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Nusura has a salon business, which she has run for four years.
To help expand her business, Nusura has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hair oil and braids for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Nusura hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair oil and braids for resale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 27 years old.  He has been operating a business selling charcoal for eight years and has one employee.  Robert has become more business-oriented since he joined Faulu Kenya.  This is because he is able to share business ideas with his group members at Faulu Kenya.  

Being a married man with one child, he works hard in his business to provide for his family.  Robert has requested a loan for 40,000 Kes to buy charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Kombassé Edith

texts.fr:
Mme Edith est une femme mariée. Elle a 3 enfants. Le plus âgé à 8 ans et le moins âgé à 1 an.2 vont à l’école et elle ne prend personne en charge.

L’activité principale de Mme est le mercure : c’est-à-dire vente de tissus et accessoires de mercerie. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 3 ans. Mme s’approvisionne au grand marché de ouagadougou.Ses clients sont ses voisins du quartier et surtout les couturiers.

Elle veut s’acheter 5 roulots de tissus, un paquet de bouton, un paquet de billet de coton, un carton d’huile de machine un demi paquet  de fermeture et un demi-canton de fils à coudre.

Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour agrandir son activité. Mme ambitionne devenir une grande commerçante de tissus et accessoires de couture. Elle veut s’occuper de ses enfants et assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mme Edith is a married woman. She has three children. The oldest is eight and the youngest one year old. Two go to school, and she is not responsible for anyone else. 

This lady's main business is selling lengths of cloth and sewing notions. She has been doing this work for three years. She buys her supplies at the big open-air market of Ouagadougou. Her customers are neighbors in her area and especially dressmakers.  

She wants to buy five bolts of cloth, a packet of buttons, a pack of cotton balls, a carton of machine oil, half a packet of zippers, and half a box of thread. 

She wants to use her profit to expand her little business. She would like to become a big cloth merchant selling sewing accessories. She wants to take care of her children and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy cloth and sewing notions.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 34 years old and is a married woman with 2 children aged 10 and 9. She has had a sari-sari store for 6 years. Beatriz sells items like noodles, canned goods and detergent soap to the people in her community.

Beatriz requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as noodles, sugar, coffee and detergent soap. She hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: buy more products to sell

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra works hard to support her family. Isidra is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Isidra requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Isidra has been in this business for two years.

Isidra would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Arebalo

texts.es: Arebalo tiene 34 años, es un hombre sencillo. Vive en compañía de Julia, su esposa desde hace 14 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los cuales cuida con mucho amor en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Palca. Con tan solo 14 años de edad, comenzó su camino por la agricultura. Su buena disposición en el trabajo le ayudó a obtener buenas ganancias. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arveja, habas y zanahoria. Los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pero le dificulta trabajar sin apoyo, ya que a veces tiene largas jornadas de trabajo, que le disminuye tiempo para comercializar su cosecha en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Él comparte su actividad con el negocio de compra y venta de animales entre ellos; vacas, toros, equinos y ovinos. Asimismo posee  2 toros de raza brown swiss, que es su mayor legado; pero como buen comerciante, una vez al mes tiene que llevar estos animales  a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde los vende a un buen precio. Ahora él se está preparando para comenzar con la segunda y última cosecha del año, donde está seguro que con su esfuerzo y ganas por salir adelante; obtendrá buenos resultados. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Santo Domingo” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además agradece el apoyo brindado por eso se compromete en pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas. Arebalo de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra de arveja y un poco para sus sembríos de papa que dentro de algunos meses cosechará.
texts.en:
Arebalo is 34 years old and a simple man. He lives with his wife of 14 years, Julia. They have three children together, who they care for with great love in a house that they own in the locality of Palca. When he was just 14 years old, Arebalo started down the agricultural path. His positive attitude towards his work has helped him to earn good profits. His main crops consist of potatoes, peas, beans, and carrots. He takes great care of his crops but it is difficult for him to work without support. Sometimes he has very long work days, which reduces the time he has to sell his harvest at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.

He splits his time with another business buying and selling animals like cows, bulls, horses, and sheep. He also has two bulls of the Brown Swiss breed, which are his greatest possession. As a good merchant, he has to bring his animals to the city of Huancayo once per month, where he sells them at a good price. Now, Arebalo is preparing to start his second and final harvest of the year, and he is sure that he will obtain good results thanks to his efforts and desire to get ahead.

Arebalo belongs to the "Santo Domingo" communal bank and this is his first loan through Microfinanzas Prisma. He hopes to receive a small loan to help him achieve his goals. He is very grateful for the support being offered to him and promises to make his repayments on time. When Arebalo receives the loan, he will invest the money in the purchase of several sacks of natural fertilizers for the next time he plants peas, and a little for the potato crops that he will harvest within the next few months.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is a 28-year-old single man who sells household items. He has been in this business for the past two years; he earns a monthly income of KES 15,000/=. which he uses to look after himself as well as business capital.

He has been loaned KES. 30,000/= as his first loan. The client intends to use the entire loan to add more stock to his business inventory by buying additional serving dishes, spoons, eating plates, water basins , buckets, etc. 

He wishes to utilize the anticipated profit from the business to open up another sales point in town and hopes that in future, he may come to own his own supermarket.

loans.use: to add stock to his plastics sales business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, viuva e mãe de 4 filhos de idades entre 15 a 28 anos de idade. Fez a 8ª classe e continua a frenquentar o curso noturno. vive na casa  dos serviços com a sua familia e sustenta mais duas netas enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas despesas de casa.
Saiu de Gaza em missão de serviço, é enfermeira no posto medico do quartel militar ha mais de 34 anos e tem um salario de 9.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja fez emprestimo no BIM destinado a sua obra de construção da casa, o qual conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma colega que tambem é cliente e este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para sua obra  DE CONSTRUCAO DE CASA(areia, pedra, ferro,cimento, e outros ). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 11.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, 20.000.00mt aplicados na habitação.  
Sonha em concluir a sua obra e sair da casa do estado, para oferecer melhor conforto a sua familia, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Violeta was born in Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. She is widowed and has four children between the ages of 15 and 28. Violeta has finished eighth grade and continues to attend night school. She lives in military housing with her family and also supports two granddaughters by sending them money to help with household expenses.

She left Gaza on work assignment. She has been a nurse at the medical post for military headquarters for more than 34 years, and she earns 9,000 meticais per month. She uses this money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

Violeta got a loan from BIM to build her house, and she was able to pay it off without any problems. She learned about Hluvuku from a coworker who is also a customer, and this is Violeta's fourth Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 25,000 meticais to buy construction materials for building her house (sand, stone, iron, cement and other items). The earlier loans were for 11,000 meticais, 15,000 meticais and 20,000 meticais, and they were used for housing.

Violeta dreams of finishing her building project and leaving the state-provided housing so she can make her family more comfortable. To do this, she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her building project (sand, stone, iron, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Wenefrida

texts.en:
Wenefrida is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Wenefrida has a food shop, or carenderia, that sells viands like pork adobo and caldereta. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

Wenefrida has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Wenefrida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 33 years old and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 3 children.

To earn a living, Maribel sells dried fish. She earns about 5000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Maribel has requested a loan of 9000 PHP to purchase 5 boxes of dried fish.

Maribel became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Maribel would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchases 5 boxes of dried fish.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Yolanda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Yolanda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Yolanda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 54 years old and lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nonito, a rice farmer, and mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Caridad makes a living by selling vegetables such as string beans, eggplant, cabbage and carrots while her husband manages the rice field that they are farming. When harvest time comes they sell their products to their contact rice dealers. For her vegetables she offers it in their local community. She earns a minimum of 250 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP17,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of vegetables, fertilizers and other farm inputs needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Caridad hopes for a good harvest and continuous growth of their business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for vegetables and other farm inputs needed in her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Doña Judith tiene 27 años de edad, está casada con el señor Arturo, quien es campesino, y aun no tiene hijos, ella tiene una taquería desde hace mas de 4 años.
Dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, puesto que buscaba la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, aparte de que este negocio genera muy buenas ganancias, también porque quieren terminar de construir su casa, el crédito que recibió lo va a utilizar, para comprar insumos como: carne, chiles, jitomates, cilantro, cebolla, platos, servilletas, tortillas, etc. y así continuar con las ventas.
Ella dice que la meta más importante que tiene y quiere lograr, es la de poner una taquería mas grande y tenerla muy bien surtida, para empezar a ahorrar y asegurar su futuro junto al de su esposo, también por cualquier problema que llegaran a enfrentar.   
La señora Judith está muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva y FRAC, por todo el apoyo y confianza, que le están brindando.
texts.en:
27-year old Doña Judith is married to Señor Arturo. They live in the countryside and as yet do not have any children. Judith has run a taco stand for more than four years.

She decided to start the stand because she was seeking a way to help her husband with the household expenses, a taco stand generates a good income, and they wanted to finish building their house. The loan money will be used to buy meat, chilies, tomatoes, cilantro, onions, plates, serviettes, tortillas etc. 

Judith’s primary goal is to open a bigger, well-stocked taco stand so she can begin saving, ensure a secure future for her and her husband, and be ready to face whatever difficulties arise.

Judith is very grateful to Kiva’s donors and to FRAC for all their support and belief in her.

loans.use: to buy meat, chilies, tomatoes, cilantro, onions, plates, serviettes, tortillas etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 43 years old and is married. To earn a living, she sells secondhand clothes. She has been in this business for five years. She also owns rental houses, with which she earns extra income. Through Faulu Kenya, Josephine has improved her business because she has been trained on business management. Josephine hopes to expand her business in five years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy secondhand clothes.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es:
El señor Wilber y su esposa la señora Marisol son padres de familia y tiene dos hijos de pequeña edad, a quienes les quieren dar lo mejor. 
Solicitan un préstamo para empezar la construcción de un cuarto en la planta alta de la casa, ya que no cuentan con el dinero necesario para comprar el materia que es (cemento, varilla, block, arena y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora). Ya que sus hijos están creciendo y están necesitando su propio espacio en la casa. 
Don Wilber y la señora Marisol desean la seguridad y mejorar el patrimonio que sea para sus hijos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en la ciudad como oficial de transito de carretera, y su esposo se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como empleada de limpieza de una casa particular.
texts.en:
Wilber and his wife, Marisol, are the parents of two young children that they want to provide the best for.  They are requesting a loan to start building a room on the second story of their house because they lack the necessary money to buy materials like cement, rebar, concrete blocks and sand and to pay labor costs to the person who will do the work.  Since their children are growing up they need their own space in the house.

Wilber and Marisol want security and to improve their assets which will be for their children.  He plans to repay the loan with the salary he earns as a highway traffic officer and his wife will take care of family expenses with the salary she earns as a domestic employee in a private home.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
As a responsible housewife, Pacita finds her way of gaining income. She engaged herself in selling Splash products like lotions, body sprays, whitening creams, soaps and rollons in her community. She has operated this business for almost three years and earns a profits of P9,000 a month. She utilized her income for food, clothing and allowances for her three children. Despite many competitors in the area, she still manages the business. She mentioned that being friendly is the best way to win customers.

She aims to increase her product offerings to meet her customers demand, but due to inadequate capital, she wants to ask for an additional of P50,000 to buy additional stocks of splash products like lotions, body sprays, whitening creams and roll ons to sell. She believes that her loan will help her to improveme her business. She hopes that in the future, she will make her business grow as she continue to manages her business well.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of splash products like lotions, body sprays, whitening creams and rollons to sell.

loans.name: Khakakho Group

texts.en:
Caleb is the facilitator of the Khakakho group. Caleb and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Caleb takes care of 10 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Caleb had an excellent maize yield harvesting 24 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Caleb was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Caleb and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Caleb will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Khakakho group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Sisi Kwa Sisi Myangayanga Group

texts.en:
Kevin is a 40-year-old married man with five children, two of whom are attending secondary school. He has worked in farming for over two years, producing coffee, maize, and beans. He has agricultural problems due to crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.

Kevin tries his best to find funds for purchasing fertilizers and insecticides. In five years he dreams to boost his scale of production from five to eight acres and to improve his standard of living by building a good house and having his own private transport.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is 29 years of age and is married with 3 children. She owns & operates a business venture, catching and selling ocean-caught fish.  She has many years of experience in this business. She needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Akenese  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Akenese 's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en: Fausta is 25 years old and a teacher by profession. She has been teaching for 4 years and has no diffuculities in her job. She hopes to build a permanent family home and she is requesting a loan to start the construction of her family home.

loans.use: to construct a family home

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy dozens of shoes to add to her business.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Guillerma requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell on her food stall. She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Guillerma would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
Ermelinda es una mujer de 34 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus 3 pequeños hijos, lamentablemente por diversas circunstancias se separó de su pareja, desde entonces ella se dedica por completo a sacar adelante a su familia, ella es una mujer muy empeñosa y entusiasta que ha trabajado desde muy joven, lastimosamente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder ser profesora de lengua. 
Por iniciativa propia y gracias a su deseo de salir adelante, Ermelinda puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella dedica  a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender un promedio de 25 clientes, ella cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a sus buenos precios y buena atención.
Esta es la segunda vez que Ermelinda se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que requiere comprar clavos, madera,listones y debe pagar la mano de obra de las personas encargadas de la construcción; de esta manera podrá contar con una vivienda en mejores condiciones que brinde mayor bienestar y seguridad para sus pequeños hijos.

loans.use: Para realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda

loans.name: Alma Rosa Nallely

texts.es: Alma tiene 37 años y es madre soltera. Desde que estaba estudiando la secundaria le gustaba hacer manualidades como pasatiempo y cuando se convirtió en madre comenzó a venderlos a diferentes negocios para poder ofrecerles las mejores condiciones de vida a su hijas. Actualmente, además de su empleo como asistente médica, tiene una maquila de artículos para fiestas, que abrió hace un año. En su negocio se encargan del diseño y producción de todos los artículos. Por esa razón está solicitando un préstamo por MXN 10,000 para invertir en material necesario para poder cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendientes. Su sueño es ser económicamente estable para poder tener su propia casa y continuar cumpliendo logros y abrir una maquila, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos. Con este préstamo será capaz de incrementar sus ventas en un 50%, mismas que le permitirán tener las ganancias suficientes para cumplir sus obligaciones en su primer préstamo con Konfío y ahorrar para llevar su negocio a un establecimiento más grande.
texts.en: Alma is 37 years old and a single mother. Since she was in secondary school, she has liked crafts as a hobby and when she became mother, she began to sell to different businesses to provide better living conditions to her daughters. Currently, in addition to his job as a medical assistant, she has a party supplies store, which opened a year ago. In her business, she is responsible for the design and production of all items. For that reason, she is requesting a loan of MXN 10,000 to invest in necessary materials to meet pending orders. Her dream is to become financially stable in order to have her own home and continue fulfilling orders and open a store, allowing her to make more income. This loan will be able to increase her sales by 50%, which will give her enough profit to meet her obligations on her first loan with Konfio and save to move her business to a larger facility.

loans.use: to buy materials for her party supply store.

loans.name: Norosoa

texts.fr:
Norosoa est une mère de famille débrouillarde et travailleuse de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari est un boucher. Le couple est patent de trois enfants qui sont tous déjà grands actuellement, le dernier, qui a 21 ans, seulement reste à scolariser, il vient de réussir son baccalauréat et prépare son entrée à l'université. Les deux autres l'appuient dans l'exercice de ses activités sources de revenu.
Elle vend des vêtements fripes il y a maintenant deux ans pour améliorer son revenu, elle exploite depuis long temps de l’élevage de porc. Le prêt demandé va être utilisé pour renforcer le fonds de roulement dans la vente de friperie. En outre, elle voudrait dans l'avenir étendre l’élevage, elle va élever des poulets de chair.

loans.use: acheter 2 balles de vêtements friperie

loans.name: Marilu

texts.en:
Mrs. Marilu O. is a very entrepreneurial woman. She started her own business after her husband left her. She can’t work on a regular job because her son is 3 years old and requires too much attention. She has to feed her son by herself and works very hard to get some income, that's why she started selling groceries in her store. Mrs. Marilu Contreras would like to have more products in her store and give a better service to her clients. She is asking for a loan of $800.00 and will pay back in 1 year.

Español

La Sra. Marilu O. es una señora muy emprendedora, la cual ha sabido enfrentar los problemas que le han acontecido en su vida, al sufrir el abandono de su esposo hace 2 años y tener que mantener a su hijo por si sola, esto la motivo a emprender un negocio de abarrotes, ya que como su hijo cuenta con 3 años de edad y requiere atención por parte de ella, no puede conseguir un empleo de forma regular, trabaja cada día muy duro para poder sostener a su hijo, por eso comenzó a vender abarrotes y quiere ampliar la variedad de productos y con esto obtener mayores ingresos en ventas, por lo cual solicita un préstamo de $800.00 los cuales piensa pagar en un plazo de un año.

loans.use: buy different products

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margie, as she is called, sell yams and smoked fish. She buys the fish in cartons from the harbour and smokes them herself. She also buys yams from farmers in bulk and sells to the public. She needs a loan of $800 from Kiva because she wants to take in more goods for sale.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Chiyenure

texts.en: A woman of 48 years old and is married with five (5) children.  She beautifies people’s hair in her community. She hails from Benin, Edo State, Nigeria. She wishes to borrow $250 for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more waving equipment

loans.name: Rosalva

texts.es:
ROSALVA IS 40-YEARS-OLD, MARRIED AND HAS A 4-YEAR-OLD BOY. HER HUSBAND WORKS AT A VULCANIZATION PLANT. SHE HELPS HIM INCREASE THEIR TAKE-IN AMOUNT BY SELLING CLOTHES DOOR-TO-DOOR IN HER COMMUNITY. SHE PURCHASES MERCHANDISE IN THE CITY OF COMITAN BECAUSE SUPLLIERS THERE SELL FOR LESS; THUS, MAXIMIZING PROFIT. SHE BELONGS TO GROUP CHIFLON 2 ALONG WITH TWO OTHER LADIES: LIDIA LOPEZ SOLIS, WHO PRODUCES CEMENT BLOCKS USED IN CONSTRUCTION, AND MARTHA HERNANDEZ LOPEZ, A HOME-BASED FOOD RETAILER. ROSALVA WISHES TO SPEND HER SHARE OF THE LOAN TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE AT ONCE AND AVOID EXTRA RESTOCKING TRIPS. LIDIA WILL BUY MORE CEMENT TO INCREASE BLOCK PRODUCTION AND MARTHA WILL USE HER PART TO BUY MORE NON-PERISHABLE FOOD ITEMS FOR HER BUSINESS.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

ROSALVA ESTA CASADA TIENE 4 HIJOS Y 40 AÑOS DE EDAD , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN UNA VULCANIZADORA.ELLA LO AYUDA VENDIENDO ROPA DE PUERTA EN PUERTA EN SU COMUNIDAD , SU MERCANCIA LA COMPRA EN LACIUDAD DE COMITAN PORQUE ES MAS ECONOMICA Y ASI LOGRA MAS GANANCIAS .PERTENECE AL GRUPO CHIFLON 2 JUNTO CON LAS SEÑORAS : LIDIA LOPEZ SOLIS ( ELABORA BLOCKS DE CEMENTO PARA LA CONSTRUCCION ) Y MARTHA HERNANDEZ LOPEZ ( TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA )ROSALVA ESPERA CON SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO COMPRAR MAS ROPA YASI DISMINUIR LA CANTIDAD DE VIAJES QUE TIENE QUE HACER . LIDIA COMPRARA MAS CEMENTO PARA AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION DE BLOCKS.Y MARTHA POR SU PARTE CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA COMPRAR MAS ALIMENTOS NO PERECIBLES PARA SU NEGOCIO..

loans.use: VENTA DE ROPA

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
N. Jalia is a member of Kigasa Akimanya, literally meaning "It helps one who knows it." She started with a loan of USD 28 in 2001. Her business went smoothly and she decided to increase the loan amount to USD 150 the second time. She paid it very well and currently she is applying for a loan of USD 450.

N. Jalia is married with four children, three girls and one boy. Two of her children are working whereas the other two are still going to school. One is in senior four and the other in senior five. She treasures education and this is why she wants all her children to finish at least college. She is 52 years of age and still going strong. She is confident she will pay back the loan without any difficulty because of the ready market and her previous experience.

loans.use: Increase stock of green bananas

loans.name: Felícita Justa

texts.es:
Mrs. Felicita is 53 years old and spends her time daily in the business of growing and processing wheat in order to prepare it for distribution in the town of Tarma. This helps her husband and family with their daily expenses. Thanks to her work, they have been able to give their children an adequate education, and today 4 of her 6 children work in the city of Lima. Mrs. Felicita now has the desire to give the remaining 2 underage children the same level of assistance towards their education and quality of life in order to set them up for their future. However, even with this desire and her enthusiasm, she has been unable to function with the same strength due to her age and certain financial troubles which have come upon her, due to the fact that prices have fallen, and she hasn't been able to sell larger quantities of her product. Now, after thorough analysis, she is hoping that this loan will help her increase her product and its quality in order to distribute more and generate more sales. This is why she is requesting the sum of $500 USD to invest in improving and increasing her wheat product. With your contribution you will enable Felicita to keep her clients and children happy.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Felicita D. 53 años D. edad, dedica su tiempo al negocio D. la venta D. trigo que ella misma tuesta y muele en su hogar, para distribuirlo en la ciudad D. Tarma y con ello ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera diariamente su familia.Gracias a su actividad pudo ofrecer a sus hijos una adecuada educación y hoy 4 hijos D. los 6 que tiene trabajan en la ciudad D. Lima.Ella ahora mantiene el mismo ímpetu D. antes para ofrecer a sus menores hijos que aún comparten su pequeña morada una educación prometedora y solvente para sus vidas.Pese a sus ganas y su entusiasmo, ella ha dejado D. desenvolverse con las mismas fuerzas, debido a su edad y ciertos malestares que le aquejan sumado al decaimiento D. su situación financiera por la disminución del precio y ventas D. su producto.Luego D. haber realizado un exhaustivo análisis está proyectándose para llevar sus productos con más frecuencia a los mercados, abastecer a más personas y complacerlas con un producto mejorado. Es por ello que solicita la suma D. 500 dólares para invertirlos en la mejora e incremento D. sus productos.Con su contribución harás que Felicita pueda tener contentos a sus clientes e hijos.

loans.use: to increase and improve her wheat crop

loans.name: Alberto Abel

texts.es:
Alberto comes from a humble family. 16 years ago he saw the need to become independent and to work hard to ensure his own welfare and security. He is now working as a custodian in the Continental Bank of the city of his birth, Juliaca. At the same he is studying computing in a prestigious institute in the city where he lives. This enterprising young man would like to purchase an optical drive and update his computer, which he obtained through much hard work and sacrifice. He would like to offer typing and printing services, ans by doing so generate extra income so that he can shortly open a small service business. To complete his project, Alberto is asking for a loan. He promises to repay your kind support within a lapse of six months.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Alberto, proviene de una humilde familia; desde los 16 años se vio en la necesidad de independizarse y trabajar arduamente para velar por su seguridad y bienestar. Actualmente se desempeña como personal de limpieza en el Banco Continental de su ciudad natal, Juliaca, y al mismo tiempo estudia computación en un instituto muy prestigioso de su ciudad. El deseo de este emprendedor muchacho es comprar una lectora y repotenciar su computadora que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio adquirió, con el fin de ofrecer servicios de tipeos e impresiones, y así tratar de generar ingresos económicos extras a fin de emprender en mediano plazo su pequeña empresa de servicios.Para concretar su proyecto Alberto solicita un préstamo y te extiende su compromiso de reembolsar tu noble apoyo en un lapso de seis meses.

loans.use: Update his computer and purchase an optical drive in order to begin his service business soon.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar R. is a widow with two school-age children who, with much sacrifice, words hard to support her children and provide them with all of the support that they need.

Two years ago she started her general store with $450. Over the months she has used this money to supply her business with more products. This woman is a great example that despite the fact that she doesn't have a husband at her side she has been to support both herself and her children.

She has received 7 loans from CEPRODEL over the last two years and thanks to these loans Pilar has been able to succeed in her business. She confesses that her dream is to one day she her children graduate with a university degree.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Pilar R. es una madre viuda y con dos hijos en la edad escolar que con muchísimo sacrificio se esfuerza para mantenerlos y brindarles todo su apoyo en lo que amerita.

Con un monto de U$ 450 desde hace dos años inició su negocio de pulpería de los cuales a través de los meses ha venido surtiendo de mas productos. Esta dama es un gran ejemplo que a pesar de que no tiene a su esposo a su lado ha logrado superar su vida y la de sus hijos.

Ha realizado 7 créditos en Ceprodel desde hace dos años, esta es la razón por la que la señora Pilar ha podido salir adelante. Confiesa que su sueño es ver algún día a sus hijos coronando una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Investment in her business

loans.name: Emma Janet

texts.es:
Emma Janet is single and has a son. She lives in the Escuela Quemada neighborhood. Emma used to work as a janitor in a hotel in the capital city. However, because the wages paid were so low, she decided to continue with her business selling assorted merchandise. She has been operating this business for 17 years and with a lot of hard work she has made it prosper.

Emma sells her merchandise in an market in the city, at her house and to order. She wishes to improve her financial situation, therefore she wants to invest in the purchase of clothing, shoes and silver jewelery for ladies. This will enable her to expand her business and continue to accumulate funds.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Emma Janet es soltera y tiene un niño a su cargo, habita en el barrio Escuela Quemada. Emma solía desempeñarse en Mantenimiento y Limpieza de un hotel de la Capital, pero debido a los bajos ingresos que obtenía decidió seguir con su negocio de venta de mercadería variada que con tanto esfuerzo ha ido prosperando y el cual tiene 17 años de tenerlo funcionando. Emma vende en un Mercado Capitalino, en su casa de habitación y también vende por encargo. Actualmente quiere mejorar su situación y quiere invertir comprando ropa, zapatos y prendas de plata para damas, para poder seguir expandiendose y acumulando capital.

loans.use: To Purchase Clothing, Shoes and Silver Jewelery for Ladies

loans.name: Dia's Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Dia A. is a 40 year old married woman with 3 children, ages 20, 20 and 9. She and her husband also take care of 1 other person, age 76. Dia sells clothes, a business she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan of $700 to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in decoration and charcoal selling.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya B. is married with an 11-year-old son named Pavel. They live in Novaya Kahovka, in the Kherson region. Nataliya sells clothing at one of the local markets. One of her fundamental policies has been to always have an individual approach to each of her clients. Nataliya has been in this business for 5 years. Currently, her net profit is about $100-$160 a month.

Nataliya is very open-hearted and sincere. She and her family are Christians and approach everything, including business, with a Christian mindset. Nataliya believes that being honest in doing business and dealing with customers is paramount to business success. Using this loan of $500, Nataliya is hoping to expand her trade so she can save enough money to purchase a new vending location, do well in the world of business, and help to ensure a secure future.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. is thirty-two years old. She is a wife and the mother of four children, ages fourteen, ten, six and three. She retails food items like plantain, tomatoes, avocados, pears and fresh fish. Comfort dreams of owning her own shop to help the sale of her products and also provide good security. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of plantains, fresh fish and vegetables to increase her sales and income. She believes with increased working capital she can expand her business to materialize her dream. She belongs to the community group called Love Trust Group. Group members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fresh fish, vegetables, and plantains

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en: Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Zubeda C.. She is widowed and has 4 children, aged between 5 and 16. In 2000 Zubeda established her café and crop wholesaling business. Zubeda has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA, and she now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice and maize in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice and maize in bulk

loans.name: Luz Janeth

texts.es:
Luz belongs to the "Las Riojanitas" ("The Rioja Girls") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "region" of San Martin and earns a living buying and selling fresh fish brought inland from the coast. She built her business working at home and selling in the surrounding neighborhood. Her goal was to support herself working at home and after trying various businesses, she decided on buying and selling fresh fish.

With the S/.3000 (3000 Peruvian soles) loan, to be repaid in 6 months, she will buy bulk supplies of fresh fish, of all types and sizes, along with ice to keep it fresh.

Luz lives with her husband and 4 children, all of whom support her. She works tirelessly so that she can see the results of her work and feel useful. She has a lot of plans for the future, one of which is to have a shop in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Luz Yaneth R. H. pertenece al Banco de Crédito “LAS RIOJANITAS”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de RIOJA, distrito de Rioja, se dedica a la venta al por mayor y menor de pescado fresco traídos de la costa, desarrolla su negocio en su domicilio que está ubicado en el jr Raymondi, y propia casa y recorriendo comunidades cercanas. Con la finalidad de apoyar económicamente en el hogar, y después de probar en otros tipos de negocio decide cambiar de negocio, ahora se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado fresco traídos de la costa.

Con el crédito de S/. 3000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará pescado fresco traídos de la costa, en mayor cantidad de todo tamaño y variedad y comprar hielo en barra para conservarlos frescos

La señora Luz Yaneth, vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposo quienes lo apoyan, trabaja incansablemente para poder ver los resultados y sentirse útil en la vida, ella tiene con muchas perspectivas en el futuro una de ellas es tener su tienda en su casa.

loans.use: Buy products and supplies for retail shop.

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa is 31 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children aged 11 and 5. She became a food seller in 1997. Every day, she works from 6am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

In the past, Arafa has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Arafa now hopes for a loan to buy more food items such as rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables, and bananas for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items to increase her stock

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, like many Bolivian women, was abandoned by her husband. Now she alone supports her 4 small children, ages 12, 10, 8 and 4. Therefore she works making small artisan pieces in macramé, sewing blankets, and embroidering by hand (her main source of income). She lives in the Villa Ingenio (Rió Seco) zone of El Alto city.

With the loan she will acquire a semi-industrial sewing mahine that will improve the quality of work that she creates.

This is her first loan with Impro, our evaluation was favorable and therefore she can access this line of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Antonia como mucha mujeres bolivianas, fue abandonada por su esposo. Ahora ella sola debe mantener a sus 4 hijos pequeños de 12, 10, 8 y 4 años de edad. Por eso trabaja con pequeñas artesanías en macramé, tejidos de mantas y bordados a mano (su principal fuente de ingreso). Vive en la zona Villa Ingenio (Rió Seco) de la ciudad de El Alto.

Con el monto del crédito adquirirá una maquina semi-industrial que le facilitara para mejorar la calidad del trabajo que realiza.

Este es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la favorece y por eso puede acceder al préstamo.

loans.use: Buy semi-industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Jigiya (Support) Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre (4) membres du groupe Jigiya sont toutes des femmes mariées vivant dans des foyers polygames avec en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles résident dans le village de Tentou de la sous préfecture de Ouéléssébougou (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des liens d’amitié et de famille et font de la transformation des graines de néré en Soumbala. (une pâte alimentaire de couleur noirâtre très appréciée et sollicitée dans la fabrication des sauces alimentaires dans la sous région Ouest africaine). Elles ont appris la production du Soumbala dès le bas âge auprès de leurs mères c'est-à-dire de génération en génération.
Dans le souci de satisfaire une clientèle de plus en plus importante, elles décidèrent d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe (prêt solidaire) et tous les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter chacune, 450 kilogrammes de grains de néré (arbre oléagineux de la région sahélienne) et du bois de chauffe. Les grains de néré après achat sont bouillies, pilées et pétries afin de donner la dite pâte alimentaire. Le cycle (production et vente) dure trois (3) semaines.
Le soumbala ainsi fait est acheminé sur Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) souvent en république du Sénégal pour être vendu au comptant ou à crédit à des grossistes. La vente une fois effective, elles achètent des pagnes wax pour venir les revendre au village.
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 28.000 FCFA chacune et ambitionnent devenir des grandes productrices afin de ravitailler toute la sous région en Soumbala.
texts.en:
The four members of Jigiya group are all married women living in polygamous households. They are on average 35 years old and have 4 children. They live in the village of Tentou in the Sous-prefecture of Ouéléssébougou (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met because of bonds of friendship and family and they process néré seeds into "soumbala" (a black-colored paste that is much appreciated and is essential to making sauces in this area of West Africa.) They learned how to make soumbala from their mothers when they were young, that is, from generation to generation.

Intent on satisfying an ever growing clientele, they decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their fourth group loan, with all the earlier loans correctly reimbursed.

With this loan, each of them intends to buy 450 kg of néré grains (which come from an oil-producing tree native to the Sahel region) and firewood. The néré seeds are boiled and then ground and crushed in mortars to make the paste. The cycle production and sale) takes 3 weeks.

The soumbala that they produce is goes to Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) and often to Senegal to be sold for cash or credit to wholesalers. Once they have concluded the sale, they buy high quality "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored batik-like cloth) that they re-sell in the village.

They each expect to make a monthly average profit of 28,000 F CFA and their ambition is to become important producers who supply the whole region with soumbala.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of raw materials (néré seeds and firewood) to produce soumbala

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget S., who lives in Angk Prasath Village in Takeo Province, is both a farmer and a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock for later resale at a better price.  Her husband, Mr. Lay Sophon, is a duck breeder who currently does not have enough money to buy sufficient food for them. Thus, his wife is requesting a loan to buy food for this purpose. 
	
Nget is 28 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the remaining two, one and five years old, are at home.  Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy duck food for her husband's business.

loans.name: Kobiljon

texts.en:
K. Kobiljon has been farming for six years. He owns a small plot of land in Shahrituz, Tajikistan, where he cultivates wheat, potatoes, and onion.  He also raises some livestock. Kobiljon and his wife (pictured in the photo with his mother) have 3 children. Kobiljon does not have a formal education and has very limited reading and writing skills.

With this loan, he will be able to buy much needed seeds and fertilizer.  He believes that his farm will continue to generate profit. He hopes to provide his children with the education he did not have the privilege of receiving himself.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Bertha Lidia

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 2 niños, es estudiante de la Carrera Profesional de Derecho y vive en el Jr. Ilave  s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Desde el año pasado es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Siglo XXI”. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró materiales para confeccionar ternos. Su esposo, junto con ella, también se dedica a confeccionar ternos para damas, caballeros y niños. 

Actualmente cuenta con un puesto de trabajo en el Mercado de Abastos de Juli, lugar donde confecciona las prendas anteriormente mencionadas (ternos) y donde acuden todos sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará telas de diversa calidad  para la confección de ternos.

Su mayor sueño es concluir su carrera y trabajar para mejorar su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Bertha is a 31-year-old woman with a husband and 2 children. She is studying law and lives on Jr. Ilave s/n, in the Juli district of the Chuchito province, department of Puno.

Since last year, she has been a member of the “Mujeres al Siglo XXI” (21st Century Women) microfinance institute. With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased materials to make suits. Her husband, who helps her, also makes suits for men, women and children.

She currently has a stand in the Wholesale Market of Juli, where she makes the garments and where her customers buy her merchandise.

With this 500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase different quality fabric for making suits.

Her biggest dream is to finish her studies and work so that she can improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric to make suits

loans.name: Poeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Poeun M. lives in the Kanthorm village in Kampong Speu province. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. She is a 59-year-old widow with a child who is attending the local school.

This family has only the income from their rice business, so they cannot provide a better life for the family. Thus, Mrs. Poeun M. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income when she sells the cow.

loans.use: Buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Mrs. Yim S., 38, lives in Kror Bak village in Takeo province. She is a mother of six children, two of whom stay at home to help her in her chores, while the two are attending the local school and the remaining two are too young to work or study. She is a duck breeder. Her husband, Mr. Yorng Mos, cultivates rice on a plot of land they own. The farm has poor yield because the soil is infertile. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Yim S. is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer to make the farm more productive. Her husband is with her in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to make her farm more productive.

loans.name: Noufo Wayi

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de tokoin Soted, elle exerce dans la restauration, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2006, elle a besoin d’acheter des produits de première nécessite pour la restauration  et pour pouvoir varier les plats qu’elle propose c’est pour cela qu’elle s’adresse à wages pour obtenir un prêt afin de s’acheter 3 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs d’haricots et 02 sacs de riz. Elle est mariée et son mari est  un sécretaire administratif, avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce, elle arrive à aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Tokoin Soted district. Her work involves food catering, a business she has been in since 2006. She needs to buy essential ingredients for preparing meals and to vary the dishes she offers. This is why she is enquiring at WAGES to obtain a loan, so as to buy 3 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of beans, and 2 sacks of rice. She is married, and her husband is an administrative secretary. With what she earns from her work, she manages to help him cover day-to-day household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for catering

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
CONSUELO P. RAMÍREZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza” su casa se ubica en el Jr. Mariano Melgar Mz. 142 Lt. 5 del Distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 47 años, 03 hijos, su cónyuge se dedica la construcción civil.
Está trabajando desde hace 6 anos con Manuela Ramos, y su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, invirtió en la compra de pollo y su crianza, un negocio que es rentable pero tiene algunos inconvenientes, por lo que hoy se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.

Una tienda que está bien surtida tiene buena clientela, por ello el préstamo de S/.1000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertiriá en surtir su tienda con una lista de productos que le faltan, y con productos de primera necesidad, que tienen rápida salida, así como bebidas.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la confianza y rapidez con que salen los préstamos, y que estos van aumentando a medida que uno requiera, además por las capacitaciones que dan en cuanto a ventas, atención al cliente entre otros.
texts.en:
CONSUELO P. RAMÍREZ, 47, is a member of the communal bank “La Fortaleza” ("The Fortress"). She lives in the district of Yarinacohca with her husband, who is a construction worker. They have three children. Consuelo has been working with Kiva partner Manuel Ramos for six years. The first loan she received (300 soles) was used to buy chickens to raise. This business was profitable, but had some disadvantages. Today, Consuelo has a small grocery store. A well-stocked store attracts a large clientele, so Consuelo is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles to stock her store with many products, including staple food products, which have a quick turnaround. and sodas. Consuelo thanks Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for trusting her, for providing loans fast, and for the training she has received on sales and customer service, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing staple food products to stock general store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik que significa Nosotros en quechua.
Maria es casada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Maria los días sábados viaja a las ferias a vender ropa.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa niños.
Los sueños de Maria son mejorar su negocio, surtir con mas productos y tener un puesto propio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Kuskanchik communal bank, which means "Us" in Quechua. She is married, is 40-years-old, and has 2 children. She sells clothing as a street vendor in the Nery García market. She acquires her products in the city of Lima. On Saturdays, Maria travels to different markets to sell clothing. She needs a loan of 900 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of children's clothing. Her dreams are to improve her business, to stock it with more products, and to have her own stand in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Rafoatniso

texts.ru: Рафоатнисо 37 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3-х детей. Муж занимается частным предпринимательством. Дети учатся в школе. Рафоатнисо занимается продажей кондитерских изделий на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда. Все ее импортные товары поставляют фирмы Nestle, СладкО, Марс и др. Рафоатнисо берет кредит у нас уже 2 года. Сейчас у нее  большой ассортимент товаров. Она продает разные импортные конфеты, печенья, вафли, пирожное. Сейчас ее поставщики предложили хорошую сделку. Если она закупит большое количество товара за наличные деньги, то поставщики дадут за очень выгодную, низкую цену. Поэтому Рафоатнисо берет очередной кредит, чтобы закупить товар по низкой цене.
texts.en:
Rafoatniso is 37 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband has his own business, and the children are in school. Rafoatniso sells candy at the Panchshanbe market in the city of Khujand. The candy is all imported, and includes brand names such as Nestlé, SladKo (a Russian brand), and Mars, et cetera. Rafoatniso has been a client of MicroInvest for two years. At present she carries a wide selection of items. She sells various imported candies, cookies, wafers and pastries. Her suppliers are now offering her a good deal. If she places a large order and pays cash, the suppliers will give her a very advantageous, low price. So, Rafoatniso is taking out another loan in order to purchase goods at a low price.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sweets, candy and confectionary products

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 57 años, es casada, junto a su pareja y a sus dos hijos viven en la casa que con mucho esfuerzo lograron construir. Por muchos años se dedicó a la venta de verduras en los mercados, pero por motivos de salud ya no pudo salir de casa, esto no fue impedimento para dejar de trabajar, pues instaló un quiosco en la puerta de su casa, donde vende todos los días desde las nueve de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche, así descansa en su hogar y atiende su negocio. Adicionalmente, alquila habitaciones, pues su casa es muy grande y sus hijos mayores ya no viven allí, y para no sentirse sola, comparte con sus inquilinos algunos recuerdos de su vida que la llenan de alegría. Sin embargo, su deseo es volver a trabajar en el mercado y ocupar su antiguo puesto que ahora está alquilado, pero pronto regresará a doña Teodora, quien ya está recuperada y tiene muchas ganas de invertir sus ahorros en la compra de mercadería para su nuevo puesto que lucirá mejorado. El tiempo que viene trabajando con MFP es de 7 años, este es su quinceavo crédito, lo que refleja el esfuerzo y responsabilidad que tienen ella y sus compañeras para seguir creciendo económicamente. El dinero que solicita está designado para su retorno a su puesto en el mercado, comprará mercadería para implementar nuevamente su negocio.
texts.en:
Teodoro, 57, lives with her husband and their two children in a house it took them great effort to build. For many years she sold vegetables in the markets. But, for health reasons she could no longer leave the house. This was not a reason to stop working. She put up a kiosk in the door to her house. She sells every day from nine in the morning until eight at night. This way she can rest in her home and tend her business. Aditionally, she rents rooms. Her house is very large and her older children no longer live there. So that she does not feel lonely, she shares with her renters some of the memories of her life that fill her with joy. Never the less, her desire is to return to work in the market at her old stall that is now rented. But, soon Teodora will return. She has recovered. She has a big desire to invest her savings to buy merchandise for her new stall that will have an improved look. She has worked with MFP for seven years. This is her fifteenth loan, which reflects the strength and responsibility to grow economically that she and her colleagues have. The money is for her return to her stall in the market. She will buy merchandise to restart her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa S., fifty-one years of age, is a divorced mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. She says some are in the university, senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with the children in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Yaa is a trader. She works very hard to provide for the children. She trades in ladies’ wear: underwear, blouses, etc. She buys from Kumasi and hawks (goes door to door) to sell in her community. Yaa says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for five years.

She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy ladies’ wear to sell

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es:
La señora Marisa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 39 años y es madre soltera de 03 hijos, 02 que aún dependen de ella ya que estudian.

Marisa, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas y pollos  a la brasa, en un local  muy bien acondicionado, ubicado en una parte céntrica de la ciudad de Rioja, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la rica sazón que le da a sus preparados, es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, en las mañanas de 10:00 am a 3:00 pm, y en las noches vende sus pollos a partir de las 7:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que la caracteriza y también con la ayuda de susu hijos.

Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz, azúcar, aceites en galones, sacos de papa, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida como implementar otro local bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marisa belongs to the “La Mujer Riojana” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martín Region of Peru. She is 39 years old and a single mother of 3 children, 2 of whom still depend on her and attend school. Marisa decided to sell prepared meals and rotisserie-style chicken at a well-equipped space in the Rioja city centre. She tells us that her sales are good every day, she is well-received and well-known for her delicious flavours. She currently runs the same business and is very happy in the work she does day by day from 10:00am to 3:00pm and at night, selling chicken, from 7:00pm. She personally serves her customers with her characteristic charisma and her children’s help. With this 2000 PEN loan, she plans to purchase ingredients used in the daily preparation of her dishes, like rice, sugar, oil by the gallon, sacks of potatoes, live chickens, vegetables and utensils to stock her business and better serve her customers. She feels full of life and wishes to succeed. She has many dreams and life goals such as setting up another well-fitted location. At the same time, she also thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients (rice, oil, sugar, sacks of potatoes, chickens y others) used to prepare her dishes and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Philomène

texts.en:
Philomène S. is married and the mother of four children. Her two oldest children are in the workforce; one is a schoolteacher and the other is a hairdresser. Philomène’s younger children still live at home. Her husband is a tailor.  Philomène lives with her family in Cotonou, the largest city in Benin, which is located on the coast, not far from Nigeria.  In Cotonou, Philomène prepares food at her home and sells it on the street. In Benin, this is a common activity for many women. Philomène sells dishes of pasta, meat, fish, cheese and tofu.  
 
Philomène says her business is going well, but that she needs more supplies. With a loan, Philomène would like to buy corn, peanut oil, condiments, and charcoal for cooking. In the future, she would also like to start selling drinks along with her meals. Philomène hopes that the profits from her business will help support her family. One day, she would like to buy a house of her own.

loans.use: Purchase of meat, fish, cheese, tofu and pasta

loans.name: Flor De Retama Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Flor D. Retama es parte del proyecto Wari, El Banco Comunal inicia su Quinto ciclo con 17 socias. Las socias son del distrito D. Pomacocha, Provincia Acobamba, Departamento D. Huancavelica. Las actividades principales son L. agricultura D. trigo, cebada, arveja y crianza D. animales,
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. abarrotes en general, cereales, animales menores, frutas, comida.

Como es el caso D. Sandra que es L. presidenta del Banco Comunal, Sandra es conviviente tiene 26 años, Sandra tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, además prepara chupetes, actividad que realiza todos los días.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 400 soles, 500 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 5,900 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. trigo, cebada, arroz, azúcar, animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Flor D. Retama” is part of the Wari project. The bank is starting its fifth cycle and has seventeen members who come from the Pomacocha district, in the Acobamba province of Huancavelica. They mostly make a living by farming wheat, barely, peas, and raising animals. The group’s members have various businesses like: selling groceries, cereals, small animals, fruits, and food. Sandra is the communal bank’s president. She lives with her partner, is 26 years old, and has a small grocery store in her house. She also makes lollipops every day. The members of the group need various loan amounts like 300 soles, 400 soles, 500 soles, and 1000 soles making a total of 5,900 soles. They will invest the loans in buying wheat, barely, rice, sugar, and small animals. The group’s members would like to grow their businesses and hope for their children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat, barely, rice, sugar, and small animals.

loans.name: Hoegnon

texts.fr: Ce Monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente d’habits, il fait ce commerce depuis 1990 à Bè-Château à Lomé, il s'approvisionne dans le marché local de hedzranawoè. il fait face en ce moment à une rupture de stock, voulant se réapprovisionner, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des chemises de nouveaux modèles et une vingtaine de pantalons . Il est marié et a un enfant à sa charge. Il compte sur son expérience pour mettre à profit ce prêt.
texts.en:
This gentleman has been selling clothing since 1990 in Bè-Château in Lomé and is asking for a loan to stock up by buying shirts and around 20 pairs of pants. He is married and raising one child. He is counting on his experience to allow him to make the most of this loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shirts and pants for resale

loans.name: An

texts.en: In order to meet the harvest season for rice, P., who is twenty-nine years old, is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She is a local farmer and the mother of three children who are still young and attending school. She is married to Rin, who is thirty-one years old and a motor taxi driver.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Ma. Isabel D., a 48-year-old woman from Malaria, Caloocan City, converted her house’s balcony to a general store six years ago. Her husband, Oscar, 59, is a bookkeeper. Two of their six children are still in school. She sells basic home necessities. Recently, she also started selling food items and fresh eggs. She enjoys her business a lot because she can help augment her family’s income without the need to leave the comfort of her home. Ma. Isabel now earns 13,000 PHP net income per month.

Ma. Isabel joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007. She says the most valuable lesson she has learned with the cooperative is the need to save for the future. Ma. Isabel needs a loan of 12,000 PHP for the expansion of her general store. She wants to see her children finish their education.

About CCT: The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response to poverty and social injustice. It is carried out through a fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. CCT serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Heriberto Alejandro

texts.es:
El Sr. Heriberto tiene 47 años esta casado con la señora Benita  de 46 años,cuentan con 2 hijos que estudian en el colegio.
El señor anteriormente trabjaba con sus padres en la compra y venta de mercaderias, no cuenta con una profesión ya que solo el colegio termino. Gracias a la experiencia que adquiro en las ventas y con los clientes que contaba pudo crecer pronto en el ramo en que se dedicaba ( venta de guitarras).
Actualmente no cuenta con un local propio ya que se dedica a la venta directa posee varios clientes por la zona de luque y alrededores.
Le gustaría  contar con un local propio mas adelante y que sus hijos terminen una carrera universitaria ya que el no tuvo la misma suerte, ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos.
El préstamo fue invertido en la compra de Guitarras. Arpas, Sombreros etc.

loans.use: Para comprar guitaras, arpas,sombreros para vender.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “Corazón Pampuyo” ubicado en el centro poblado de Corazón Pampuyo del distrito Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno; tiene 43 años de edad, estado civil casada, tiene 03 hijos, vive en Ticaraya, ella estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 7 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá aumentar a su capital para la compra de ganado vacuno para engorde y luego comercializarlo en las ferias de la zona.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las charlas.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Community Group "Corazón Pampuyo", which is located in the centre of Corazón Pampuyo, in the district of Pomata. This is in the province of Chicuito, in the department of Puno. She is 43 years old and is married with 3 kids. She lives in Ticaraya and has been educated to primary school level.

Sabina has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 7 years, and she began with a loan of 300 soles which allowed her to increase her business' (the buying and selling of groceries) capital.

She currently requires a new loan of 1500 soles, which will allow her to increase her capital in order to buy cattle to feed and then sell in the local markets.

Her greatest desire is to continue to work.

She enjoys the group's talks and savings.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle/Para la compra de gando vancuno.

loans.name: Gumersinda

texts.en: Gumersinda M. is from the village of Poblacion 11. She is 40 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Gumersinda owns and operates a fish-vending business, selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Gumersinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Gumersinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina N. is from the village of  Pala-o, Iligan City. Ludivina is 37 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ludivina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ludivina has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ludivina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ludivina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ludivina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
