Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julenne

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 03 enfants, cette femme a commencé depuis 2005 le commerce de pagnes. Elle est très dynamique et fait son commerce de façon ambulante. La période des fêtes approche, elle veut augmenter son stock, c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite de WAGES un prêt pour acheter une trentaine de pagnes de grande qualité et de qualité moyenne.
texts.en:
Married with 3 children, this woman began selling pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth) in 2005. She is very dynamic and runs her business door-to-door. With the holiday season approaching, she wants to increase her stock; it is for this reason that she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy thirty pagnes of high and medium quality.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of West African cloth)

loans.name: Derlina

texts.en:
Derlina A. is a 38-year-old woman from the town of Maddurulug Enrile, Cagayan. Derlina is married, and she has three school-age children.

To make a living, Derlina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. Specifically, she raises livestock (primarily sheep) and later sells the animals for a profit. Derlina notes that she just started this business. In 2009, Derlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services; as a result, she now has the ability to engage in business activities, and she expects to improve her family's standard of living. Derlina is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and to sell in the future. This loan would be the first loan taken out by Derlina via ASKI. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas of the country, and its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen/women, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional livestock

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary, 48 years old, is married with four children. Her husband sells foodstuffs, while she sells mouth watery Nigerian food and drinks. Her greatest joy is the one-on-one interactions with her customers. She is a hard working woman and wants to lift her business and family above poverty. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Merlyn E., 50 years of age, is married and is a resident of Purok 6 Garang, Tangub City. She is married to Armando who is a farmer who manages their own riceland in their barangay (village). They are also receiving daily income from rental of their motorcycle for hire.

In order to help her husband financially, Merlyn decided to engage in a business. She opened a sari-sari (general) store and for five years already she has been able to maintain this business. Now she is earning an average net income of not less than P3,500 per month which is very helpful in meeting the basic daily needs of her family.

Merlyn maintained a good credit performance with her first loan and so she has been given the privilege of obtaining P10,000 as her second loan to add to the capital of her sari-sari store. The future income from this loan will be used for loan repayment and as savings for their children's education.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more beauty products

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
Con cuatro hijos que mantener brindándoles los estudios a cada uno de ellos, la señora Luisa Vilchez se ha destacado por haber apoyado a sus hijos para que estudien ya que ella trabaja en un centro de labores en el municipio de Somotillo.
Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de algunos materiales de construcción como cemento, piedra, arena y otros para el mejoramiento de su vivienda y de esta manera brindarle a sus hijos las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen y así continúen estudiando y con un techo digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
With four children to support and educate, Luisa Vilchez has stood out for having helped her children go to school through her work efforts in one of Somotillo's employment centers. She is asking for funding to buy some building materials and supplies like: cement, stone, sand, etc. to do some home improvements in order to provide her children with the necessary conditions for their growth and development so that they will stay in school and have a proper home in which to live.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana tiene 52 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa que le heredó su madre, junto a su hijo y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado cultivar le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas trabaja en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuado los ve grandes y abundantes. Lleva 22 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar lo cosechado hasta el mercado de la ciudad, pues los sacos con los productos son muy pesados. Para más adelante, espera mejorar sus productos para poder obtener mejores precios.

Este es el primer préstamo de Maximiliana con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja para sembrar, también comprará abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 52 years old and a hardworking and cheerful mother. She lives in the house she inherited from her mother with her son, for whom she wants to improve their quality of life.

The products she grows require much effort and dedication, and have helped her progress in life. Every morning she works on her land, knowing that the care she provides her crops will determine their quality. What she enjoys most about her work is looking after her crops and feeling joyful whenever her harvest is large and abundant. Maximiliana has been farming for 22 years and considers the most difficult part to be hauling her crops to the city market because the bags of produce are so heavy. Later on she hopes to improve her products so that she can command better prices.

This is her first loan with MFP. Maximiliana knows she has to submit all of her payments on time and is committed to doing so. In her Communal Bank, she is a very cooperative and responsible member. With her loan of 1000 PEN, she plans to buy seeds for her crops of peas. She will also buy compost and insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds, compost, and insecticides

loans.name: Beatriz Rafael

texts.pt:
Beatriz Rafael Chaquela T. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo, sul de Moçambique tem 55 anos de idade viuva e mãe de 5 filhos de 32, 31, 30, 29 e 15 anos de idade, o mais novo vai a escola. Fez 12ą classe e formação de professores. Vive na casa própria com os seus 2 filhos menores e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Nunca saiu da cidade de Maputo, trabalha no Ministério da Educação como docente desde 1974, afecta no Distrito de Boane. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário mensal de 5.585.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária
Já teve empréstimo em outro banco (BIM), conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, ferro, pedra e chapas de zinco) para dar continuidade com o melhoramento da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.300.00mt, 10.400.00mt e 13.500.00mt, para a mesma actividade. 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua casa e oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade.
texts.en:
Beatriz Rafael was born in the city of Maputo, in the Province of the same name, South of Mozambique. She is 55 years old, a widow and mother of children who are 32, 31, 30, 29 and 15 years-old. The youngest is in school. She completed 12th grade and teacher's certificate. She lives in her own house with her two youngest children and doesn't support anyone else. She has never left Maputo. She works with the Ministry of Education as a teacher since 1974 in the Boane District. She does not have any employees and earns 5.585.00mt per month, which goes to household expenses and a savings account. She has had loans with another bank (BIM). She came to know Hluvuku through her friend who is also a partner of the same institution. This loan, in the amount of 17.000.00mt is his fourth. She intends to buy building materials (cement, sand, iron, stone and tin screens) in order to continue her home improvements. The previous loans were for 10.300.00mt, 10.400.00mt and 13.500.00mt and were all applied towards the same activity. In the future, she would like to request more loans to finish her house and provide better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials (cement, sand, iron, stone and tin screens)

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata S.  est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala (région de Sikasso) avec son mari, sa co-épouse et leurs enfants. 
N’ ayant pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école,  elle n’a pas pris du temps à embrasser le commerce depuis à bas âge  auprès de sa mère et exerce pour elle-même il y a 6 ans . Après avoir mené plusieurs activités, elle finit par choisir l’achat et  la vente des tissus  avec les bazins teintés, de l’atièké et  divers autres articles. De temps à autres elle fait également de la teinture. Sa notoriété est bonne car elle vend une grande quantité d’articles dans le mois. 
 Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle en quantité et en qualité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 4 ans. Après  5 prêts  solidaires tous payés correctement, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel, le précédent a été correctement payé.  
Avec ce  financement  Fatoumata  compte acheter, 5 pièces de bazin moins riche, 10 sacs d’atiéké et autres articles divers. 
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et à Bouaké en (Côte d’Ivoire) et effectue sa vente dans le marché Hamdallaye de Koutiala à une clientèle  constituée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000 FCFA  qu’elle envisage  utiliser pour  le remboursement du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata S. is 42 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives in a polygamous family in the Hamdallaye district of the Kouitala prefecture (the region of Sikasso) with her husband, the other wife of her husband and their children. As she did not have an opportunity to attend school, she lost no time in dedicating herself to working besides her mother from an early age on. She launched an independent business six years ago. After having tried various activities, she settled on the resale of dyed “bazin” cloth [traditional damask-like cloth in West Africa], “atieke” [processed cassava product for a couscous-like dish] and various other items. She sometimes dyes fabric as well. She is well known and sells a large volume of items each month. In order to satisfy the demands of her customers in terms of both quantity and quality, four years ago she decided to seek help from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She had obtained five joint loans as a member of a group, all of which have been properly repaid. This would be her second individual loan, and the previous one was properly repaid as well. With this loan she plans to purchase five pieces of simple "bazin" cloth, 10 bags of “atieke” and various other articles. She purchases her stock in Bamako, the capital of Mali and in Bouaké in Côte d’Ivoire and sells at the Hamdallaye market in Koutiala to a customer base composed of both women and men, for cash and on credit. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 90,000 West African Francs, which she intends to use to repay her loan to Soro Yiriwaso, contribute to the family budget and invest the remainder in her business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various articles (for resale)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 54 Años, es separada, tiene 3 hijas, D. las cuales una D. ellas vive cerca D. su casa, actualmente la apoya en el negocio. Rosa vive sola su casa propia. Hace mas 15 años que decidió tener su propia fuente D. ingreso mediante la agricultura, la crianza D. animales y también con la venta D. productos necesarios para el consumo humano, siendo este último negocio compartido con su hija, que es casada e independiente. Durante las mañanas Rosa sale al campo para verificar sus terrenos D. cultivo, lo que pueda cosechar lo lleva a vender a su tienda o a la ciudad para venderlos al por mayor, paralelamente a esta actividad lleva su vaca y sus ovejas a espacios abiertos donD. puedan comer pastos frescos, así consigue mantenerlos sanos y vigorosos para luego venderlos. D. esta manera alterna sus dos trabajos primarios. Durante todo ese tiempo D.  trabajo ha visto sus beneficios en las rentas, por lo que esta planeando incrementar su producción e intensificar más la venta D. animales. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que le será  muy útil este aporte en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono para su próxima siembra y en la compra D. 2 ovejas más.
texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old, separated from her spouse, and lives alone in her own home. She has three daughters, one of whom lives near her and currently helps with her business. Rosa has been earning her own income by farming, raising animals, and selling products for human consumption for more than 15 years. Her daughter, who is married and independent, later joined her in her business venture.

In the mornings, Rosa leaves for the fields so that she can survey her farmland. What she is able to harvest she sells either at her store or to wholesalers in the city. At the same time, she also takes her cows and sheep to the open spaces where they can graze on fresh grass that keeps them healthy and vigorous prior to being sold. She divides her time between these two activities. Throughout all the time she has been working, Rosa has been able to generate a profit. She now plans to increase her production and sell more animals.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Rosa promises to be responsible with her payments since she considers the loans to be useful in advancing her business. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of sacks of compost for her next crop. She will also buy two more heads of sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & two heads of sheep

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Kotognogontala sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans,  3 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames à KAMALEN SIRAKORO un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt. Les  prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
Les membres du groupe font la vente  de condiments alimentaires,  de savons,  de médicaments traditionnels,  des friandises  et  des poissons fumés.
 Avec son nouveau prêt, Minata D. qui fait les condiments alimentaires compte acheter, 4 colis  de condiments (tomates + oignons + poivres + choux + gombo +sel + huile + pâte d’arachide etc.). Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elle revend au marché de KAMALEN SIRAKORO  et à domicile, au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes.
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 32.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle compte avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et  aménager son point de vente.
texts.en:
The members of the Kotognogontala group are all married women and are on average 30 years old with three children. Most live in monogamous families in KAMALEN SIRAKORO, one of the villages in the commune of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy their customers’ needs and are requesting a third group loan. All past loans have been repaid in full. Group members sell food condiments, soap, traditional medications, sweets and smoked fish. With her new loan Minata D. (who prepares food condiments) will buy 4 packages of condiments (tomatoes, onions, peppers, cabbage, gombos, salt, oil, peanut paste, etc.). She gets her supplies from the market in Sikasso and from neighbouring villages. She resells at the KAMALEN SIRAKORO market and through home delivery, for cash and often for credit, to women customers. She is hoping to attain an average monthly income of 32,500 FCFA of which part will be put into savings and used for family expenses, while the remainder will be reinvested in the commercial activities. She is hoping to accumulate more capital to better satisfy her customers and to fix up her stall.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene D. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Irene owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling-daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for less than a year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Irene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Irene is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina lives in Borewala, city of shrines, in Pakistan. She has two sons. Her elder son is a daily wage labor and her younger son reads in 2nd standard. Sakina wants her younger son to complete his education. To provide him with a better education, she sells cosmetics in her community, and in the shops as well, which she purchases from the Shahalmi market, Lahore city . Her business produces approximately 8,000 PKRs. 

Her husband runs a business selling vehicle tires. He has a good reputation amongst his customers. He has been in this business for over fifteen years. Sakina has successfully completed three loans to Asasah and now is applying for the fourth time for a loan to invest capital in her husband’s business. The capital will allow him to purchase the vehicle tires and sell them to his customers in order to generate a good income.

loans.use: To purchase vehicle tires to sell.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo María Auxiliadora lo conforman tres mujeres esforzadas, decididas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Waleska del Rosario R., coordinadora del grupo, ella hace dos años que empezó a comercializar ropa y zapatos con la ayuda de su madre. Esta joven de 21 años sueña con mejorar su negocio y seguir aprendiendo.

Sus compañeras de grupo son María Elena V.  la cual comercializa ropa y zapatos hace tres años y  María Mercedes H. la cual en el 2000 instalo sus pequeña venta la cual ha idop surtiendo y mejorando poco a poco.
texts.en:
Three hard-working and determined women make up the María Auxiliadora Communal Bank. One of them is Waleska del Rosario R., the coordinator of the group. Two years ago she started selling clothes and shoes with help from her mother. This young woman is 21 years old, and she dreams of improving her business and continuing to learn. One of her colleagues in the group is María Elena V., who has been selling clothes and shoes for three years. Her other colleague, María Mercedes H., set up a small sales business in 2000. She has been stocking it and improving it little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothes and shoes

loans.name: Patricia Fatima

texts.es:
Doña Patricia tiene la edad de 47 años, madre de tres hijos, el cual crió sola,  ya que es madre soltera, su trabajo ha sido la venta de ropa, peluches, zapatos en poca cantidad por que no cuenta con mucho capital, pero ha sobresalido adelante.
Su mama la apoyado siempre, a ella y sus hijos. Ahora cuenta con el apoyo de Su hijo mayor el cual da para que pague los gastos básicos.
En estos años ah adquirido clientela, en donde le hacen encargos. Pero necesita aumentar su inventario para incrementar las ventas, es por eso recurre al financiamiento para comprar una variedad de productos como: una docena de pantalón de mujer, bikinis, bóxer, sandalias, y gel de cabello, crema de cuerpo, pinturas de uñas entre otros producto para atraer al cliente.
Con el objetivo que si no vende de un producto, vende otros.
Contenta por que a trabes de esta inversión mejorara su economía.
texts.en:
Doña Patricia is a 47 year old single mother with three children who she raised by herself. Her business involves selling clothing, plush toys, and shoes in small quantities since she has very little capital. This has enabled her to get ahead.

Patricia’s mother has always supported her and her children. Now she has the support of her oldest child who contributes toward basic expenses. In recent years she has acquired more customers and received more orders, so she needs to increase her inventory in order to keep up with sales. For this reason, Patricia is requesting another loan to buy a variety of products such as a dozen women’s trousers, bikinis, boxer shorts, sandals, hair gels, body crèmes, nail polishes, and other goods to offer to her customers. Her goal is to sell different types of products, not just one. She is happy that this investment will improve her financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher has been operating his mixed farm for the last eight years in Kitale town, Western Kenya. He sells his milk, vegetables and fruits to the local market. He also operates a hotel (restaurant) in the same area.

Christopher is 59 years old. He is married and has 11 children between the ages of 10 and 29. Seven of the children are attending school.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 31,200 Kenyan shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This being his second dairy loan from Juhudi, he believes that his milk production will improve and this will earn him more income. He faces, however, the challenge of transportation of milk to the market and diseases that attack his dairy cows.

He says that in the next five years, he wishes to have three dairy cows and be the main milk supplier to the local market. He says that the loans he has been given have enabled him to acquire productive assets that he would not be able to acquire alone.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto D. is 43 years old, married and has four school-aged children. He is from the village of Tapon in the municipality of Mambajao, a part of Camiguin province on the northern Mindanao islands. Roberto owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop from which he sells an assortment of products to the local community. Roberto has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Roberto joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. He is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan he has taken out from HSPFI. Roberto plans to use all additional revenue to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 29 years old and a single mother of two.  She runs a salon to earn a living. She was previously selling clothes and plastic containers to earn an income. 

Joyce is a registered member of Faulu Kenya under Quotet Group. Through Faulu Kenya, she was able to open up her salon, which is two years old.  She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes to add stock of beauty products. She hopes to improve upon her former business for selling clothes and plastic containers. In ten years, she wants to have built rental houses.

loans.use: To add stock of beauty products

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen C. is a 36-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  seaweed (guso) farming and food vending. She lives in Pulo, Brgy Cervantes, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She cultures Eucheuma seaweed (guso) along the coast line and sells it as raw material for carrageenan, a very in-demand binder used in food products. Because seaweed farming does not involve constant work, Arlen can earn additional income by selling cooked food, doubling her earning capacity.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1996 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her seaweed (guso) farming and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 15,000. 

Arlen is now borrowing PHP 19,000 to purchase seaweed materials and use as additional capital for food vending.  This will be her 8eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Arlen aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at Kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional capital to sustain her seaweed business

loans.name: Sany Yanett

texts.es:
Sany de 34 años, vende productos naturales y vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Comenzó hace tres años atrás a vender algunos productos naturales que le medicaron y como le dio muy buenos resultados el decidió comprar estos productos a base de noni, calcio y frutos y los vende a sus amigos y conocidos. Ahora ella visita varias empresas vendiendo los productos naturales. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas productos a base de noni, calcio y frutas. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Sany is 34 years old, sells natural products, and lives in a suburban area called Duran, which is characterized by its endangered environment. 

Three years ago, she began selling medicines made from natural products. Since they gave very good results, she decided to buy products made from noni [a plant], calcium, and fruits and sell them to her friends and acquaintances.  She currently visits different stores selling her natural products.

With this loan, she would like to buy more products made from noni, calcium, and fruits.  In the future, she would like to have her own store to sell her products.

loans.use: Purchase products made from noni, calcium, and fruits

loans.name: Hasifah

texts.en:
Hasifah Namaganda is 35 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  She has a retail shop, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Hasifah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more items like soap.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hasifah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Hasifah hopes to educate her children for a better life.

loans.use: to buy more items like soap to sell

loans.name: Chuma Group

texts.en:
Abdalah J. is in his mid-twenties, single, and is the father of a one year old boy. He has been selling several types of bananas from his fruit store since 2002. The shop is open between 8:00 and 8:00 pm and earns Abdalah a small monthly profit.

This will be Abdalah's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He aims to use this loan to increase his stock of bananas so that he will always be sure to have enough to meet demand. Abdalah's dream is that one day he will make enough money to be able to open a clothes store. 

Abdalah will share this loan with his loan group, Chuma, which totals 21 members. The members of this group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Abdalah can be seen third from left,back row, wearing green and yellow.

loans.use: Increasing Stock.

loans.name: Choem's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Choem R. is a 58-year-old married woman who lives in Veal Thum Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. R. was selected as the Village Bank President by its thirteen members. The village members will use their portions of the loan to support their different businesses. 

Mrs. Choem R. and her husband, Mr. Huon Neang, are farmers who own 1.15 hectares of land.  The couple does not have any children. They use this land to grow rice and different vegetables for a living. In addition to working as a farmer, Mr. Huon Neang is also fisherman.  In order to support her husband's fishing business, Mrs. Choem R. would like to ask for a loan to buy fishing supplies.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Fortunee

texts.en:
Fortunee is 28 years old and is married with one child, who is three years old.  No one else works in her family.  Fortunee's store is open from 5am until 8pm and she has a clean and well-stocked store selling local traditional beer. She has been in this business for four years.

Fortunee has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to grow her business. Fortunee will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to reinvest in her business so that her revenue can keep growing. If successful, Fortunee will continue taking care of her children by providing more food for them as well as building a secure future for them.

loans.use: To purchase more local traditional beer

loans.name: Taddeo

texts.en: Taddeo is a 26-year-old married man with three children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate his children to higher levels of education. He is a businessman who has operated a retail shop for three years. The income generated has helped him pay school fees for his children. Taddeo needs the credit facility's loan to buy soap, sugar and salt for resale.

loans.use: Buying soap, sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años, de estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos (02 dependientes), realizo estudios de educación secundaria.

Trabaja hace más de 08 años con el Movimiento Manuela  Ramos, su  primer préstamo  fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual lo utilizó para invertir en su negocio de venta de granos, actualmente vente mana.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar trigo, fideos, azúcar, gas, etc., para su negocio venta de mana, lo realizan junto con su esposo.

Su sueño en el negocio es progresar, tener una casa para vivir cómodos y un carro para trasladar la mercadería.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y  la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the communal bank “3 de Mayo II”  (May 3rd II) in Puno District, Puno Province, Puno Department.  She is 42 years old, married and has 5 children, 2 of whom are dependent.  She completed secondary school.

Sonia has worked with "Movimiento Manuela  Ramos" for more than eight years.  Her first loan was for 300 PEN, and she used it to invest in her business selling grains.  She currently sells maná (a Peruvian marzipan-like candy).

Sonia is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1500 PEN ($550 USD), which she will invest in the purchase of wheat, noodles, sugar, gas etc. for her business selling maná.  She makes the maná together with her husband.

Her dreams are to progress in her business, to have a house so her family can live comfortably and to have a car to aid in transporting their merchandise.

Sonia likes her communal bank's meetings and promptness.

loans.use: To purchase wheat, noodles, sugar and other products.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa, de 37 años, vive con su esposo  Edmundo  (42) y sus  tres hijos, juntos residen  en el distrito de Quimbiri, donde  cuentan con su propia casa.Su trabajo es labrar la tierra junto a su esposo, y durante gran parte del día se encuentran en su chacra. En su parcela cuenta con las plantaciones de cacao, coca, café entre otros y ya esta  trabajando exitosamente siete años, el método de trabajo consiste en diversificar sus plantíos porque cada tipo de cultivo tiene una  temporada determinada  de cosecha es por esta razón  que obtiene dinero de sus distintas plantaciones. En tiempo de cosecha necesita el apoyo de los peones para facilitar la extracción de su producto, y su  planta más rentable es la hoja de la coca pues por cada arroba (que equivale a11.5 kilogramos y medio)  que vende le pagan 120 soles.  El resto de sus plantaciones como el cacao, café entre otros no se comparan con el precio de la hoja de coca; es por esta razón que en el futuro quiere sembrar más hoja de coca porque le permite tener mayores ingresos.Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y  se compromete a  seguir cumpliendo puntualmente  con su cronograma de pagos, es por esta razón que se siente satisfecha con el desempeño de su banco comunal, debido a la buena familiaridad  que existe en las reuniones mensuales.Luisa tiene planeado invertir  los mil soles solicitados en el pago  pagos de los peones; quienes le apoyarán en sus cosechas, de esta manera espera seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Luisa is 37 years old and she lives with her 42-year old husband, Edmundo, and their three children. They live in the district of Quimbiri in their own home. She works the fields together with her husband, spending a large part of the day in the land. On her land they have plantations of cocoa, coca leaves, coffee and other products, a business they have had for the past seven years. 

The best way to manage a field is to diversify the types of harvest because each type has a specific season to harvest, which is why he is able to have so many different products. 

During the harvest she needs to hire help in order to gather the entire product. The most profitable of all the harvest is coca leaves. For each load of 11.5 kilograms she gets 120 soles. The other harvests such as cocoa and coffee are not comparable in price to coca leaves. In the future she hopes to plant more coca leaves, to increase her profits. 

This is her second loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to established payment schedule. She is very happy with her community bank for the great collegiality that exists in the monthly meetings. Luisa plans on investing the requested one thousand soles to hire farm hands. They will help her with the harvests and it will ensure her future success.

loans.use: To hire help for the harvest.

loans.name: Gresilda

texts.en:
Gresilda I. is from the village of Olingan, Dipolog City. She is 49 years old. Gresilda is single and has no children. To make a living, Gresilda owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Gresilda operates this business for over 3 years and earn approximately PHP 3,000 a month.

In 2010, Gresilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully paid her previous loan of PHP 10,000.Gresilda is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gresilda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional capital for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Naserian Enole

texts.en:
Naserian Enole T. is 43 years old. She is married and a mother of six children. For the last five years, Naserian has been farming her own piece of land.

She learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her third loan, which she will use to buy farm supplies. She hopes to use the profit from the loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Naserian's dream is to educate her children to a higher level and expand her farming. She is a hard working lady who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El Sr. Julio tiene 52 años de edad, tiene tres hijos en edades de 23,21 y 18 años, quienes le ayudan en las actividades diarias, habitan en el Sector de Puerto Diaz en la Jurisdiccion de Juigalpa chontales; El Sr. P. se dedica a la astividad de la pezca en el lago de Puerto Diaz, sacando peces para comercializarlos en la Ciudad de Juigalpa y en el mismo puerto Diaz; es una persona seria en sus cosas, muy responsable y dedicado a su negocio, esta actividad le permite desarrollarse en el ambito economico de modo que obtiene sus ingresos para cumplir con sus compromisos de pago y los gastos del hogar, son una familia bien unida ya que sus hijos le ayudan en gran cantidad aportando sus mano de obra y los ingresos los comparten.  

Solicita su credito mediante el apoyo de Kiva para compra de Fardos los que ocupa para la pezca artesanal.
 
Su obtevido en la vida es que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada dia y que continuen como él en esta actividad para que lleguen a tener un patrimonio.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio is 52 years old and has three children, ages 23, 21 and 18 who help him with his daily activities.  They live in the Puerto Diaz sector in the jurisdiction of Juigalpa Chontales.  Mr. P. has a fishing business on Puerto Diaz lake.  He sells the fish in the city of Juigalpa and also at the Diaz port.  

He is a very serious, responsible man who is dedicated to his business.  His work has allowed him to develop financially and obtain income necessary to cover bills and household expenses.  He has a close-knit family and his sons not only help him in the business but also share their income.

He is requesting a loan through Kiva to buy equipment for his artisan fishing business.

His goal is to ensure his children have food on the table everyday and continue in the business so they can one day own assets.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy has a mixed farm in Kitale town, western Kenya, that produces milk, maize and beans. He has been in the farming business for fifteen years now and employs one farmhand. He also runs a retail shop in the same region.

He has requested for a loan of 62,400 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to expand his existing businesses and also meet his family's needs. He plans to acquire a high yield dairy cow and also venture into zero grazing in the next 5 years.

Willy is 35 years old and married, with 3 children aged between 8 months and 9 years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 58 años, es una mujer muy tierna y amable. Es separada y vive junto a sus dos hijos de los 5 que tiene  en total. Hace más de 13 años Gladys se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza, zapatos, ropa casual, maletas entre otras cosas que le piden sus clientes. El negocio que realiza le gusta mucho, por ello siempre esta visitando a sus clientes, y en cuanto le hagan sus requerimientos, acude a los  emporios comerciales del centro de  Lima; si se trata de prendas, en caso de calzados, viaja a la provincia de Chiclayo, de donde compra al por mayor y a menor precio, y solo así gana mucho más, a pesar de sus pasajes y otros gastos. Por ello, prefiere dejar a crédito, y así captar mayores utilidades, aunque se demoren en pagarle. Y, ahora requiere contar con tu ayuda, para abastecerse de más mercaderías y continuar desarrollando su negocio. Pero, lo que también, anhela es dedicarse al arte culinario, por ello en adelante cuando tenga mayor capital,  le gustaría instalar un restaurante en un local céntrico de la ciudad. Es su 22avo crédito que tiene con MFP, dice “estar agradecido por la ayuda que recibió y que recibirá en esta oportunidad; y que no desconfíen, ya que pagará puntualmente sus cuotas”. Gladys, compra mercaderías necesarias cada 20 días, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará más  prendas casuales y zapatos, para abastecer sus pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
58 year-old Gladys is a very loving and kind woman.  She is separated and lives with two of her five children.  For more than 13 years, she has been selling beauty products, shoes, casual clothes, suitcases and other products that her customers ask her for.  She really enjoys her business and is always visiting her customers.  As soon as her customers make requests, she heads to the department stores in the middle of Lima.  If, however, they request footwear, she travels to Chiclayo province where she can buy wholesale, for a lower price.  In this way she earns a lot more, in spite of having to pay for her transport and other expenses.  Gladys prefers to offer her goods on credit because that way she makes more profits, even if her customers take a long time to pay her.

Right now, Gladys would like to be able to count on your help so that she can stock her business with more merchandise and continue to make progress.  What Gladys would also really like to do is work in the culinary profession.  In the future, when she has more capital, she would like to set up a restaurant in a central location in the city.

This is Glady's 22nd loan from MFP and she says that she is grateful for the help that she has received in the past and also for the help she will receive on this occasion.  She says that she can be trusted to make her loan repayments on time.  Gladys buys merchandise that she needs every 20 days.  She will use the loan she has requested to buy more casual clothes and shoes in order to fill some orders that she has.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and footwear

loans.name: Tierra Fertil 4 Group

texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the “Tierra Fertil 4” (Fertile Land) group. A single mother, her family is composed of her three children who she works very hard to sustain and educate. Yolanda tells us that her most difficult challenges have been, and always will be, supporting her children both economically and educationally.

Yolanda has had her business for about a year, having started it with savings after acquiring skills in a beauty center school. She is very excited about getting her first Esperanza Internacional loan and will use it to buy manicure and nail products, allocating her additional profits to business expansion.

Yolanda lives in one of the Los Alcarrizos communities, a very active city with a large population that goes about the streets creating a very busy city. It is located west of the city of Santo Domingo and, like many other cities, lacks many basic services.

loans.use: to buy manicure and nail products

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with a grown daughter, Adelina. He is a farming entrepreneur from Kamenka who grows tomatoes. He owns 4 spacious greenhouses. He plants 7,000 high-growing tomatoes annually. He has been working in this sphere for 15 years. Alexander has invested about 100,000 grivnyas in his venture. Annually he spends about 43,000 grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film. 

Alexander is requesting a loan of 15,000 grivnyas to purchase fertilizers, polyethylene film and to install a drip irrigation unit in his greenhouses. He is planning to spend 7,000 grivnyas on fertilizers, 5,000 grivnyas on plastic protection film and 2,000 grivnyas on a drip irrigation unit. In the future Alexander is hoping to extend his greenhouse for seedlings which would allow him to grow better quality plants. Some of his long-term plans include construction of two more greenhouses and installation of a heating system in them.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, plastic film and a drip irrigation unit

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is 44 years old and has been in active farming for the last 20 years in her home area of Kitale in Western Kenya. She is married with four children, two adults and the others of school age. Her farm produces maize, beans and tomatoes with the help of two farmhands.

Linet has made a request for a loan from Juhudi KIilimo amounting to 70,000 KES to expand her poultry project by buying more birds and constructing a poultry unit for the birds. She hopes the loan will improve her income and support the family in terms of food provision. Linet points out that poultry feed has become expensive and animal diseases are also common.

loans.use: to buy more poultry

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 36 years old.  He is married and has three children. He has been a farmer for the last five years.  Patrick learned about KADET Ltd through advertisements done by KADET.   He has been a good client who repays his loan well.

Patrick has applied for a loan of KES 60,000 to buy farm supplies and animals.  This is his 3rd loan with KADET.  He plans to use the proceed from the loan to plough back into his farm.

Patrick is an honest man who can achieve and thrive if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and animals

loans.name: Kayraba Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 19 octobre 2001. Il est composé de sept femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Aissatou (à la droite de la photo levant la main) est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants.

Elle fait la vente de légumes et de l'huile de palme. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plusieurs années

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was formed on October 19, 2001. It is made up of seven women who live in the same neighborhood. Their principal business is buying and selling various small items. 

Madame Aissatou (on the right in the photo, raising her hand) is the leader of the group. She is 40, married, and the mother of six children. She sells vegetables and palm oil. She has been in this business for several years. 

This loan will permit her to expand her capital and develop her business further. The profit will let her improve living conditions for her family (health, nutrition, clothing, etc.) and put aside more in savings.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and vegetables.

loans.name: Anna Liza

texts.en:
Anna Liza is 31 years old and married with two school-age children. She lives in Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, Anna Liza has a home-based business making and selling native food, a Filipino delicacy called "suman" (sticky rice wrapped in banana leaves or coconut leavesf). She makes and sells "suman" for merienda or snacks around the village. Anna Liza has had this type of business for two years with a monthly income of PHP 3,000. She wanted to expand her business, so she requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to buy ingredients for "suman" making.

Anna Liza has been a member of GDMPC for one year. She hopes that someday the "suman" business will be economically in demand by the public and she can continue her business with a refreshment building.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make "suman"

location.town: Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Berdhan

texts.en: Berdhan is 52 years old and lives with his wife and five children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd Province, Mongolia. His older son is a construction worker, while his wife manages a mobile food-selling business in her town. He conducts a vegetable planting and trading business. He started his business in 2008. He used to have land where he planted vegetables for daily consumption. However, the land wasn't fruitful enough. So he sold the land and began planting his vegetables at a rented plantation. He is a polite man who attributes his business success to his good managerial skill. He is requesting a 1,500,000-Mongolian-togrog (MNT) loan to purchase land where he can plant his vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase land

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: Esmeralda is a single mother who lives in the province of Valle, Honduras with her nine year-old son. She earns a living by selling freshly-squeezed orange juice and a local crepe-like dish called a baleada. Esmeralda sells her food near the border between Honduras and El Salvador where there is always a lot of traffic. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 15,000 in order to purchase ingredients for making orange juice and baleadas.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, sugar, cornmeal, beans, cheese, eggs, and avocados.

loans.name: Shakar

texts.en:
Shakar is 66, widowed and has three grown children.  She worked for a long time as Director of the local school and is known as a very accurate and persistent person.  In order to find an additional means of subsistence for her family, she started her business in gardening. She has been growing cherries, raspberries and apples. The earnings from selling her harvest allowed her to diversify her activities by engaging in breeding cattle.  Today she has a farm with cattle, which still needs to be developed. For this reason, Shakar has applied for a loan of 100.000 KGS to purchase more cattle for fattening and reselling. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Emmilia

texts.en: Emmilia is 30 years old. She has two children. One of her children is in school. She is married. She has been in this business for two years and she says that the extra income from this loan will help her too build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more bread and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 26 years old and married. She has a business selling meat in the market. She has been running this business for six years and is able to earn about PHP 15,000 a month. She is grateful because her business is improving and all her meat is sold out immediately.

Josie is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 which will be used to buy different kinds of meat such as chicken, pork and beef for her business. She hopes that through this loan she can improve her business by offering good qualities of meat to her valued costumers.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of meat such as chicken, pork and beef

loans.name: Kamwe A Group

texts.en:
Peter is the facilitator for Kamwe A group in Chwele.  He and his group members joined One Acre Fund in 2011. Peter has a family that include five children and his wife.  He joined One Acre Fund in order to be able to harvest more maize on his farm, to access hybrid fertilizer and seed, and to move out of poverty.   

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Peter and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

This year Peter harvested 15 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land with his One Acre Fund inputs. Peter says the harvest was very good, especially compared with the 5 bags of maize that he used to harvest from the same area.  

With profits from his harvest, Peter will buy livestock, save money for the plowing costs of the 2012 season, and help his disabled child to access special education.  

On the far left is Peter's Field Officer Josephine.  Peter is pictured holding a file folder.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 3 filhos que ainda frequentam a escola. Não estudou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos avós. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é trabalhador da bananalândia ha mais de 2 anos e tem um salario de 3.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao DE UMA CASA (chapas, areia, pedra, barrotes, ferro, e outros.) para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Rosa was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. She is single and the mother of three children, who go to school. She never went to school because of her grandparents' difficult financial circumstances. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
She's never left Maputo. She's worked on a banana plantation for more than two years and earns about 3,000 meticals a month. She uses her salary to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in a bank account. She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her first loan, in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which she will use to purchase construction materials (sheet metal, sand, stone, rebar, iron, etc.) to continue the construction on her house. She hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish her house so she can provide her family with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sheet metal, sand, stone, rebar, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Nuria

texts.en: Nuria is married and has four children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband is a teacher who helps support his family, which lives in a house with both electricity and piped-in water. Their greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the last five years, Nuria has earned a living by running a poultry farm. Her main clients are nearby retailers’ and wholesalers. Her biggest challenge is poultry diseases, but this has not stopped her from dreaming of expanding her flock and also starting a dairy farm. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy 50 chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu because it offers low interest rates.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and 50 new chicks.

loans.name: Kelia Judith

texts.es:
La joven Keyla tiene 25 años y se dedica a la venta de dvd's de películas, cd's musica en formato mp3, conciertos y videos de musica en dvd's, sus principales clientes son las pesonas que visitan el mercado de Nacaome.
su negocio le genera ganancias para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de dvd's y cd's ya grababados, sus clientes la prefieren ya que la calidad de video y sonido que vende son buenos.
El sueño de Keyla es mejorar y ampliar su casa de habitacion.
texts.en: Keyla, 25, sells movie DVDs, music CDs in MP3 format, concert and music videos on DVD.  Her main customers are people who visit the Nacome market.  Her business generates profits to cover household expenses.  She will use the loan to buy previously recorded DVDs and CDs.  Her customers prefer her because the quality of video and sound she sells is good.  Keyla’s dream is to improve and enlarger her house.

loans.use: to buy film DVDs and music CDs and DVDs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Pedro Daniel

texts.es:
El Señor Pedro Daniel es casado, tiene 35 años de edad, cursó sus estudios de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales estudian se dedica al tejido y amarrada de hilos y telas típicas, inició este trabajo siendo operaria y hasta el momento lleva 1 años de experiencia.


Decide solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferente colore y clases ya que espera mas adelante contar con trabajador3es para su negocio.
texts.en: Pedro Daniel is married.  He’s 35 years old and finished elementary school.  He has three children two of which are in school.  He works weaving and knotting threads and making traditional textiles.  He started this work as an employee and has a year’s experience to date.  He decides to request a loan that he’ll use to buy thread of different colors and types and hopes later on to hire employees for his business.

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Babie Rose

texts.en:
Babie Rose is 40 years old and single. She's from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. 

Babie Rose owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products such as canned goods, instant noodles, diapers, and cotton in the local community. Babie Rose has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Babie Rose joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Babie Rose is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Chimeddulam

texts.en: Chimeddulam is 50 years old and lives with her son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. Her son is employed. She started her business in 2000 by purchasing salvaged cars and selling their parts. Now, she sells a broad range of parts and accessories; however, Japanese cars are increasing in province. Therefore, demand for their parts is high. She is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to buy car supplies. She is a sharp and hard-working woman who says, "My product's demand is decreasing, and I am getting into a danger where I could be kicked out of the market, and I need to act aggressively in order to survive".

loans.use: To buy car supplies for her business

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Isata. She is married and has four children, age 5, 10, 20, and 25. She has two additional dependents who live with her to help a sister with her child's education and to help with the house chores.  

In 1991, Isata established her cooking condiments business. She started the business by selling at home. The business is special because it helps in aiding her husband to run the home. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about 1,284,400 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Isata has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now she requires a new loan in order to increase her stock. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 256,880 SLL. 

In the future, Isata plans to expand to another store with the help of her sister  and to be able to meet the needs of her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cooking condiments.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 51, is widowed and has two daughters. Her first daughter is employed at a garment factory in Korea.  Sokha lives with her second daughter in Kampong Chhang Province, Cambodia. She stays home and cooks for her daughter.  Her second daughter embroiders clothing at home. Skha is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more cloth to embroider in order to make more embroidered clothing to sell. 

In the future, she would like to run a new business of selling gasoline to make more money to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to embroider

loans.name: Vyuka I Group

texts.fr:
Tite est un commerçant de bière et de beignets, âgé de 49 ans. Il exerce son métier depuis 18 ans. Il habite à Rutegama. Il pratiquait l’agriculture avant de se lancer dans le commerce.
Il a étudié jusqu’en 6e année primaire, Il est marié à Consolate et père de 6 enfants dont 4 étudient. Il est à son 7e crédit avec Turame.
Le crédit Kiva qu'il obtient, lui permet d’augmenter son capital et avoir une grande quantité de bières et beignets à revendre.
Il est membre du groupe communautaire « Vyuka I »
texts.en:
Tite is a 49-year-old shopkeeper who sells beer and doughnuts. He has been in this profession for 18 years. He lives in Rutegama. He was a farmer before going into business.

He studied up to the sixth year of primary school, is married to Consolate and father to six children of whom four study. He is on his 7th loan with Turame.

The Kiva loan which he gets will allow him to increase his capital and have a large quantity of beer and doughnuts to resell.

He is a member of the community group Vyuka I.

loans.use: to increase his capital and have a large quantity of beer and doughnuts to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Januaria

texts.en:
Januaria is 55 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban. Januaria is married and has seven children. 

Januaria has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 15 years. 

Januaria has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Januaria has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Januaria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Juán Rafael

texts.es: Juan Rafael, tiene la edad  de 54 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su señora que es su mayor prioridad. Él con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, almácigo y pagar mano de obra para la siembra y asistencia de café, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia en el manejo de café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad, y tener a corto plazo una producción adecuada. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan Rafael, 54, is single.  He lives with his wife, who is is biggest priority.

With his loan he plans to buy fertilizer and seedbeds, and pay for labor for the planting and attention to the coffee.  In this way he will be assured of doing a good job.

What he hopes for is to make the most of the good climate and soil conditions for this crop, and also put into practice his experience in the management of coffee.  Also, he hopes to be able to buy the best products of the best quality so his plantation will have good development and health, and to have a suitable production in the short term.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  Previously he had not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant coffee.

loans.name: Idriz

texts.en:
Idriz is a 64-year old Roma man from Sliven, Bulgaria. The Roma, commonly referred to as gypsies, are a severely marginalized group on the Balkan Peninsula of Europe.

For most of his working life, Idriz had a job at a state-run light bulb factory in Sliven. When communism was dismantled in the mid-90s, the factory was shuttered and Idriz was out of work with very few transferable skills. Being in his mid-50s at the time, Idriz and those of his generation were in a particularly tough spot. Under communism, he was not paid a significant amount and did not have considerable savings as he trusted that the state would continue providing for him in his retirement. Unfortunately, that has not happened. Those in his age range have been the hardest hit by the transition to free markets. Idriz’s pension from the government totals approximately 35EUR per month.

To support himself, he started a barbershop in the Roma ghetto of Sliven. He charges 1EUR a haircut, 0.5EUR for a shave. He is happy to have a way to support himself and is always thrilled when he can buy something for one of his four grandchildren with his earnings. Idriz’s shop runs on a tight budget, with a significant amount of the earnings from one week going to buy new supplies for the next week. As a result, the proceeds of this loan will be going into working capital for his shop.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
You can see in the picture a very kind, friendly, hard-working woman. She has had this business for 20 years.
Sevil was born in 1950 in the city of Baku. She is a widow and has 3 children.
She is a high school mathematics teacher. 
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy a new computer to make her work easier. She tutors students for examinations. The computer would provide her with internet access to advance her students' educational level.

loans.use: To buy a new computer to ease her work and to administer tests for students

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business by buying increasing inventory levels.

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.en:
Miguelina J. has opened a small store out of her home in San Pedro de Macoris. She uses her profits to care for her four young children: Anehicio J. (13), Ramonita J. (9), Gravier J. (8), Maria J. (5). Ramonita and Maria are pictured with their mother next to her small store, where she currently sells a variety of household items. Miguelina wants to expand her inventory to include shirts and pants, which is why she has requested this loan. She hopes to save up enough money to purchase a proper store.

NOTE: Miguelina is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, which have all gone through Esperanza's business training courses and will be accountable to each other for repaying $150 each of this $750 loan together. This group-lending method strengthens social needs in a community and ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Purchase shirts and pants

loans.name: Furkat

texts.en:
S. Furkat began to engage in business in 2004. He rented one room for his business in the big bus station ”Abreshim.” His business is to sell different kinds of toys. He is married and has two children. His wife is a housewife. He has a high education as accountant, but he could not find a job with a good salary for supporting his family's needs.

He decided to sell toys because he loves children very much. Every day he has many clients as his trade place is situated in the bus stop. He buys his goods every week from the central market Panjshanbe in Khujand. He says that he tries to attract his little clients by the variety of his goods. In the future, he plans to purchase a number of modern automatic toys. For this purpose he is requesting $1000.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Since Bertha Alicia’s husband doesn’t have a stable source of income in the company where he works, she decided to make tamales in her home and sell them. It was five years ago when Bertha Alicia’s cousin noticed that she had an excellent work ethic, so he helped her to move her small business a local market close to her house. Since then she has not had the means to paint the roofless structure where she operates her business. She has also been unable to replace the tarp that covers her place of business. The tarp is so worn out that it practically gives no protection from the sun! Bertha Alicia also needs funds to buy the supplies she needs to make her products. This is why Bertha Alicia is asking for your help. She would like you to help finance a loan of US $500 to be repaid in 6 months. With this loan she will buy supplies for her business, paint the structure that she operates her business out of and to buy a tarp to cover that structure. With your help you will make it so Bertha will be able to improve the appearance of her business and attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Ya que el esposo de Bertha Alicia no tenía un sueldo seguro en la empresa donde trabaja, ella se decidió a elaborar y vender tamales en su casa, y con el tiempo un primo de ella, vio que Bertha tenía muchas ganas de trabajar así que le traspasó un local en un mercadito muy cerca de su casa esto hace cinco años y desde entonces no a pintado la estructura de su local y tampoco a cambiado la lona que ya casi no la cubre del sol, además de necesitar material para la elaboración de sus comidas.

Por eso acude a usted para que la puedan apoyar con un crédito de US $500 en un plazo de seis meses para poder comprar material, pintar la estructura de su local y comprar una lona. Con tu ayuda lograrás que Bertha pueda hacer de su puesto un local mejor para atraer más clientes.

loans.use: Paint her restaurant site and buy a new tarp for its cover and also buy ingredients to make the food.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa, 48, owns a food stand at the market near Offinsu. As Christmas is nearing, Yaa is preparing for the business that she will be receiving. Families will be gathering and cooking large meals with rice. Yaa hopes to be well-stocked so people will come to her for their Christmas foods.

The profits from her shop will be reinvested into the business and in finishing the home for herself and her three children. They are currently living in a half-built house. There are only two complete rooms. The rest have dirt floors.

Yaa is a member of the lending group, Eye Nyame. This group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To expand her stock for Christmas by purchasing tomatoes, onions, rice, oil, canned fish, and other food products.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
I am Shamim H. and I live with my family in Lahore, a city in Pakistan with a long history. My family consists of my husband and three kids: two daughters and one son. My husband buys and sells cows as well as selling their milk. For his milk-selling business, he owns four cows and sells their milk twice a day. Now we need to buy an additional cow for our milk business.

Our other group members are

Koser S. (she requires a loan for her husband’s restaurant);

Parveen G. (she needs to buy her son an overlock machine for his business);

Akbari B. (her husband needs a loan to invest in his vegetable and garlic business); and

Razia N. (who needs a loan for her husband’s nursery/garden center).

We all hope to have a very positive impact on our businesses with your loan.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow for my husband's business and help our other group members' businesses

loans.name: Yasemin

texts.en: Yasemin is 36 years old , she is married (her husband is in the picture) and has 3 children. Yasemin has lived in Saatli for 15 years. She is an internally displaced person from the area disputed by Azerbaijan and Armenia. Yasemin and her husband have been engaged in sheep breeding for 15 years now. She wants to buy more sheep in order to increase her business profit. Therefore she applied to  the Saatli branch of Normicro for a loan of 600 USD for 12 months.

loans.use: to expand business turnover

loans.name: Namataba 2 A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Faith H.. She is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan to expand to bulk selling. Faith is 47 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 12 to 22 and her children go to school. Each week, Faith makes approximately UGX 150000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for her children's school fees. Faith has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600000 in order to add to her charcoal business and the loan was paid back on time.

Faith is joined in her small group by Justine B., Norah M., Rose N., and Sarah K.. Justine B. has a business running a retail shop and wants to purchase more shop items. Norah M. is currently operating a business selling edibles and wants a loan to invest further in her business. Rose N. operates a canteen business and wants to purchase a fridge. Sarah K. is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan to increase stock.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Moradeké Fasilatou

texts.fr:
Born April 16th, 1977 in Lomé, Mrs. Madeké Fasilatou B. is married and the mother of four children. She is a retailer of plastic bags and table cloths in Lomé’s main market. She has been doing this work since 1998 and has now become a wholesaler. She currently receives merchandise from Accra in Ghana and Lagos in Nigeria, and resells it to sub-wholesalers and retail dealers in the main market. The 500,000 franc CFA loan she is seeking will allow her to increase her stock with the wholesale purchase of necessary bags. She can thus increase her sales and improve revenues.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 16 Avril 1977 à Lomé, Madame B. Moradeké Fasilatou est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de sachets et de nappes de tables au grand marché de Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1998 et est devenu aujourd’hui grossiste. Elle reçoit actuellement ses marchandises d’Accra au Ghana et de Lagos au Nigeria et les revend aux demi-grossistes et aux détaillants du grand marché. Le crédit de 500.000 FCFA qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’augmenter son stock par l’achat en quantité suffisante de sachets. Ainsi, elle pourra augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et donc améliorer ses recettes.

loans.use: Stock plastic bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Her biggest plan is to educate all her children.

loans.name: Comíté Mujeres Luchando Group

texts.en:
The committee “Mujeres Luchando” (women fighting) is a new group in its first cycle. All the members dream of having their own house. Some of them belonged to another group before but they decided to form a new one and start from the beginning. They are all very hard-working people who want to bring benefits to their families.

The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya that targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans.
