The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities that enable them to live with dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women committee members the energy and motivation to reach success.

Among the businesses they run are grocery stores and businesses selling CDs, fruit, vegetables, clothing, drinks, lingerie, cosmetics, and food.

The money provided by the credit will be used for the purchase of sugar, rice, fruits, vegetables, drinks, and fabric.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, fruits, vegetables, drinks, fabric, and other items.

loans.name: Kay

texts.en:
Mrs. Kay H. sells baskets in Spork Reach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Kem Soam, is the village chief, and earns only a small salary. They have two children. One is a subsistence farmer; the other one attends school.

Even though these family members have different business activities, they cannot support and improve the family's conditions. Thus, Mrs. Kay H. decided to ask for a loan to start her own business as a "rice middlewoman," a person who buys rice to keep in stock and sell for a better price later in the year.

loans.use: To start a business as a rice middle(wo)man

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.pt:
Jacinto H. is 39 years old and was born in the province of Zambeze in the center of Mozambique. He is married and the father of 2 children who are 12 and 8 years old respectively. Both go to school. Beyond his children he supports his mother-in-law and a nephew who live with them.

Jacinto studied until the basic level of agriculture. He stopped when his country called upon him to join the Armed Forced of Mozambique. He began very young living away from his parents in the house of his uncle so he could go to school because the area where his parents lived did not have a school.

He moved from the province of Zambezia in 1987 when he entered the armed forces, and in 1990 he got married. Now he lives in his own home. Jacinto has worked for the Ministry of Defense since 1987 and works from 7:30am to 3:30pm with a monthly salary of 9,650MT. He is able to save a little money at the end of every month.

This is his fourth loan in his life, one of which was from the International Bank of Mozambique, 2 were from Hluvuku, and all were used to purchase construction materials. He has a dream to purchase a vehicle, and to realize his dream he counts on loans.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Jacinto H. tem 39 anos de idade e nasceu na província da Zambeze no Centro de Moçambique, casado maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos com 12 e 8 anos de idade respectivamente. Ambos vao a escola. Para alem dos seus filhos sustenta uma sogra e um sobrinho que vive com eles. Jacinto H. estudou até Nível Básico em agricultura. Parou de estudar quando a pátria chamou por ele para ingressar nas FADM – Forcas Armadas de Mocambique . Muito cedo começou a viver fora dos seus pais em casa do tio para poder estudar dado que lá no campo que viviam os seus pais não tinha escola. E mudou se da provincia da Zambezia em 1987 quando ingressou nas FADM e em 1990 se casou. Neste momento vive numa casa própria. Jacinto trabalha no ministério da defesa desde 1987 e tem um horário das 7:30 às 15:30h com um salário mensal de 9.650,00mt e consegue poupar algum no fim de cada mes. Este é o quarto empréstimo na vida dos quais um foi na BIM banco internacional de Moçambique e os dois foram na Hluvuku e todos foram aplicados na compra de material de construção. Tem como sonho comprar uma viatura e para concretizar seu sonho conta com os empréstimos.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Maty M. est mariée, mère d’un enfant avec 03 autres dont elle a la charge. Elle souhaite faire un petit commerce de divers condiments alimentaires locaux au marché et souvent aussi de vente de mangues puisque c’est la saison. Elle veut assurer de meilleures conditions de vie à ses enfants et une bonne scolarité. <b>Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois et en une seule échéance <b/>.
texts.en:
Maty M. is married and the mother of 1 child with three others for whom she is responsible. She would like to sell, at the market, various local seasonings and mangoes since they are in season. She wants to ensure a better quality of life for her children and a good education. She will reimburse the loan in one single payment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and re-sale of various seasonings at the market

loans.name: Ushirikiano Kiburugwa Group

texts.en:
Saumu S. is 40 and married. She has three children, ages 14, 9, and 8. She opened a shop in 2000 where she sells clothes and general household items such as food. She works daily from 7am until 8pm and earns a monthly profit of about $86.

This will be Saumu's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the stock of her shop and has paid them all back successfully. However, the employee who was working for her shop by selling door-to-door recently stole many of her things and disappeared. Therefore, she will be using this loan to restock her shop and recover from the losses of the robbery.

Saumu is part of subgroup F of the Ushirikiano Kiburugwa Group. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Saumu is with her subgroup and is sitting third from the left in pink. Other members of the subgroup include Mwajuma A. (food vendor), Chiku S. (fruit and vegetable stand), Jamira Y. (tea seller), Tatu O. (food vendor) and Mariam S. (fruit stand).

loans.use: Restock general store.

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Mrs. Kun B. was born in 1953 and now lives in Preal Village in Takeo Province where she and her husband, Mr. Sin Song, are rice farmers. Kun is requesting a loan to hire two laborers, one to plow the rice field and another with a pump to water her field, and to purchase pesticides. 

Kun has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers to plow and water the rice field, and to puchase pesticides.

loans.name: Magbanie Group

texts.en:
This is Yabom Kaprr S., Isatu K., Ramatu K., Thatha K. and Iye T.. They named their group Magbanie, after the village where the group leader was born. They are local entrepreneurs in a village called Massori, about fifteen miles from Makeni City in northern Sierra Leone. This is the second time they’ve received a Kiva loan through SMT. Previously, each one of them in the group received a loan of 500,000 LE. That loan created meaningful impacts in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Today, they are requesting a loan of 700,000 LE each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Yabom (second from right) is the leader of the group. She is forty years of age. As noted earlier, she was born in Magbanie village. Marriage brought her to Masorie village, where today she is managing her business. She is married with one child. Her child is also married. Her husband serves as a local chief whose duties include arbitrating disputes among members of the community.

Yabom sells local produce like palm oil and pepper. With this new loan, she will expand her business: she will be able to buy an additional ten to fifteen barters (five gallons to a barter) of palm oil to add to her current stock. In the village of Masori, a barter of palm oil cost her 30,000 LE. She will pay a fare of 14,000 LE round-trip to transport herself and the palm oil to Makeni. So far, Yabom faces no serious challenge in her business worth noting. She enjoys what she does for a living.

To Fatmata and colleagues in the group, an increase in profit means making their lives better. They will be able to take care of their children, specifically with their educational and nutritional needs, as well as saving some for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil for resale

loans.name: Kpènagni

texts.fr: Née vers 1988 à   HETIN DOGODO dans la commune de DANGBO, dame   H. Kpènagni est mariée et mère de 2enfants allant à l’école. Elle cultive dans le village de  HÊTIN SOTA  de la vallée de l’Ouémé situé à proximité de la source thermale de dangbo ; elle vend aussi du poisson. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Moussiliou Houinsou is a farmer, married and the father of one child. He lives in the district of Houedome, one of four enclaves that make up the township of Dangbo, and more precisely, in the village of Ahovilekome.

He works his field after the river waters recede. His primary activity is growing maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc. In general the population grows market gardens after the river waters recede and during the rainy season.

The local practice of selling off crops before the harvest does not provide them with security, on the contrary, it leaves them worse off. This practice involves selling the future harvest at rock-bottom prices to an affluent person to get hold of the money required for farming. Tired of this practice, he has asked for a loan of 200,000 FCFA to farm about 1.5 hectares of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1.5 hectares in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Abdulatif

texts.en: Abdulatif is a 35 year old married man with 3 small children, living in Jalala in the Bekaa valley. Abdulatif has owned a photography studio for 3 years. He has had a passion for taking pictures ever since he was a young man. Today, he wants to request a loan in order to buy a new camera, along with filters, for better quality pictures.

loans.use: To buy a new camera and filters

loans.name: Tum

texts.en: Tum R. is 49 years and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She grows rice and makes around US$1 each day. Her husband is a village chief and wedding chef. On average, he makes approximately US$2.50 per day. Currently, the couple lives with five of their eight children. Two children are construction workers building houses and three others are students. Mrs Tum R. is asking for a loan to rent farmland to grow beans and rice.

loans.use: To rent farmland to grow beans and rice.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary T. is twenty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a boy and a girl. She says both of her children are in the basic school. She lives with the family in a rented apartment in a small town called Simpa. Simpa is a farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana. Mary works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family.  Her husband deals in second-hand clothes.
She deals in ready-made clothes and ladies’ fabrics. Mary procures her materials from big shops in the nearby big towns. She says she sells in the local market and treks to nearby markets to do business. Mary has been in business for three years.
Mary wants a loan to procure a variety of textiles in bulk so she can trek to many places to do business. It is her dream to sponsor her children to have the best education.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es: REMBERTO TIENE 26 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SOLTERO, NO TIENE HIJOS Y VIVE EN SU PROPIO DOMICLIO. SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE DE PASAJEROS CON SU PROPIA VAGONETA EN EL AREA URBANA EL MISMO QUE PERTENECE A UN SINDICATO DE TRANSPORTE "OBISPO SANTISTEVAN". CUENTA CON MAS DE 4 AÑOS EN EL RUBRO DEL TRANSPORTE. SIENDO SU ACTIVIDAD ESTABLE DURANTE TODA LA EPOCA DEL AÑO POR CONTAR CON PARADA FIJA, DE FORMA QUE LA COMPETENCIA NO LE AFECTA. EL CREDITO LO DESTINO PARA ARREGLOS EN SU VAGONETA Y LA COMPRA DE MEDIO PAQUETE DEL MOTOR. ES CLIENTE DESDE EL AÑO 2007, CON 3 CREDITOS EN LA INSTITUCION Y CON PAGOS PUNTUALES, LA MISMA QUE TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN OTRAS INSTITUCIONES FINANCIERAS
texts.en:
Remberto is 26 years old. He is single, with no children, and lives on his own. He works transporting passengers in his own minibus in the area. He belongs to the transportation union Obispo Santistevan. He's been working in transportation for more than four years. He has steady work throughout the year because he has a spot at a taxi stop, so he's not affected by competition. He will invest his loan in repairs to his minibus and the purchase of a motor package. He's been a client since 2007, and has made punctual payments on his three loans with the organization. He also has experience with other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his minibus

loans.name: Paupau

texts.en: Paupau T., 23, is married with two children.  She has one year of experience in the Pancake business. She sells to the general public, villagers and school children four days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala.  SPBD loans are Paupau’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will mainly be used to buy things for her pancake business.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients such as sacks of sugar, flour, baking powder, etc.

loans.name: Muaimalae

texts.en: Muaimalae A., 39, is married with five children.  She has three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public six days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (~$265 US).  SPBD loans are Muaimalae’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed killer, a gallon of Gramoxone, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
"My experiences in farming has taught me to be critical, especially when you select variety of seeds to sow in your farm. I have been into farming since I married a farmer and our harvest is what we utilize to feed and clothe our family," says Eleuteria L., a 49-year old mother of six children.

She is asking a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to purchase eight sacks of fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides. The loan will eventually help the whole family increase their harvest.

CEVI aims to help businesses grow. CEVI offers not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase eight sacks of fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is forty-two years of age. She is married and has given birth to three children: one son and two daughters. She says they are in the senior high, junior high and primary schools. Rose lives with the children and her husband in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana.

Rose is a trader. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Rose trades in ladies’ clothes such as dresses, underwear, etc. She also sells bed sheets. She buys from Kumasi and hawks (goes door to door) to sell in her community. Rose says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for two years.

Rose is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin. She desires to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Salome Gabriela

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82755&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Salome es socia del Bancomunal San Juan
Salome no tiene hijos ha estudiado cosmiatria, trabaja cuando la llaman pero ella también vende  por catalogo lencería colombiana. 
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió ahorrar, y a ser responsable en todo. 
Salome necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para invertirlos en compra-venta de ropa interior por catalogo. 
El  sueño  de Salome es poner un spa de belleza.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82755&_tpos=... Salome is a member of the San Juan Community Bank. Salome does not have children. She has studied cosmetology. She works when called, but she also sells Columbian lingerie by catalog. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to save and to be responsible in everything. Salome needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy and sell underwear by catalog. Salome’s dream is to have a beauty spa.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy-sell underwear by catalog

loans.name: One Goal Development Group

texts.en:
Abraham is a 33-year-old married man with 2 children, ages 9 and 1.  He was able to go up to his third year in university.    He has been running a business buying and selling VCDs, DVDs, and cellphones for 6 years.  One of the challenges that he faces is that customers come and buy things on credit.  However, they then delay payment for a long time.  This creates issues.  

He also commented that there are a lot of other people who do the same business so sometimes competition is too much.  This cycle, Abraham wants to take out a loan to purchase engine oil for the trips he takes to purchase materials.

loans.use: To buy engine oil for travel to expand the business

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Juan Pablo de 22 años de edad, es casado, no tiene hijos, labora para el MINED de Santo Tomas desde hace 4 años como docente, su esposa labora como empleada domestica, y lo apoya con los gastos del hogar, esta solicitando su primer credito para levantar una pared para un anexo en su casa, a pesar que son un matrimonio joven desean contar con las condiciones basicas para cuando lleguen los hijos.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo is 22 years old, is married and has no kids. He has worked for the MINED of Santo Tomas as a teacher for four years, and his wife works as a maid. She helps him out with the household costs, and is asking for his first loan in order to put up a wall to extend his house. Although they are newly-weds they want to be able to have the baisc conditions for when their kids arrive.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Levantar una pared

loans.name: Colquiri Group

texts.es: El grupo “Colquiri” Esta representado por el señor Jorge Reymundo y conformado por 13 miembros dentro D. los cuales todos los varones del grupo se dedican al transporte público D. pasajeros y entre las socias mujeres se dedican al comercio D. diferentes productos como la venta D. refrescos, pollo, ropa, comida, y panadería. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero las socias saben como salir adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación entre los socios que trabajan en el transporte público existe gran oferta D. rutas pero la demanda D. pasajeros también es alta por lo que cuentan con ingresos seguros, pero sus herramientas D. trabajo siempre requieren D. mantenimiento es por esta razón que requieren el financiamiento para la reparación D. sus vehículos y a las socias comerciantes para el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo. Las socias cuentan con experiencia en créditos solidarios gracias a su experiencia en entidades similares a la Fundación Agrocapital, pero la institución le da mayores ventajas para poder incrementar mas sus ventas y hacer crecer sus negocios para poder darles a sus familias y a sus hijos una mejor calida D. vida y una mejor educación.
texts.en:
The group "Colquiri" is chaired by Jorge Raymundo and comprises 13 members. All the men in the group offer transportation services to passengers and all the women have stores in which they sell refreshments, chicken, clothes, food and bakery. The members operate in a highly competitive environment, but they know how to get ahead with hard work and dedication.

The members who work in public transportation offer a large variety of routes and have a secure income, as passenger demand is high. But their tools need permanent maintenance, which is why these members require a loan for the repair of their vehicles.

The women, for their part, must increase their working capital. They have some experience in solidarity loans due to their previous membership in organizations similar to Fundación Agricapital. However, they prefer this institution, because it offers them better opportunities to boost their turnover and expand their business. They can thus make sure of a better quality of life for their families and a better education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio, or “ Unyol” as he is called in their village, is a farmer.  He lives in Brgy. Almaguer South, Bambang, Nueva Vizcya. He is married to Elvie and they are blessed with two children. The couple helps one another to earn a living for their family and for the education of their children. 

Rogelio is a college graduate but due to lack of job opportunities, he decided to venture into farming.  He is planting rice and vegetables that he harvests twice a year.  He would like a loan of PHP 10,000.00 that will serve as additional capital.  He will use the loan to purchase farm inputs and some supplies for the maintenance of their crop production. He hopes that he can produce bigger harvests and earn a higher income with the continuous support of the lenders.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu M. is a married Tanzanian entrepreneur and businesswoman. She runs a food shop in  Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam selling varieties of food crop products to customers. Business goods are purchased direct from the producers and wholesale shops and are sold to retail customers at her shop. Zainbu has been in the business for four years and her business income is used to meet her daily family needs. Zainbu requests a loan of TZS 1,200,000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize the business by increasing the business stock

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
La señora JUSTA S. C. tiene 55 años de edad, vive en el distrito de MACHE , provincia de OTUZCO, departamento de La Libertad, Perú. JUSTA es casada La empresaria presenta estudios Hasta 2DO de primaria, porque desde esa edad empezó a dedicarse al campo .
Refiere que en cuando ella era niña los padres solo se preocupaban en que aprendan a escribir su nombre y firma, para que mas adelante puedan trabajar por ese motivo ya no la mandaban al colegio después de que aprendió a escribir su nombre y firmar.
 JUSTA  se dedica a la crianza de animales como: chanchos, patos, pollos, cuyes y también a  la compra y venta de leña.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles empezó con la crianza de cuyes que poco a poco fue aumentando y luego empezó con la crianza de pollos.
Con el crédito de 2,000 lo invertirá en la crianza de chanchos que los criará para venderlos y también para comercializar su carne en los pueblos cercanos y en Trujillo. 
JUSTA también  se dedica a la compra y venta de leña.
JUSTA sueña con aumentar la crianza de sus animales y empezar a criar ganado vacuno.
texts.en:
Sra. Justa S. C. is 55 years old, married, and lives in the Distirct of Mache, Otuzco Province, Department of La Libertad, Perú. She only has a second grade education because she started working in the fields at a young age. As a girl, her parents were only concerned that she learn how to write and sign her name. Once she mastered that skill, they no longer sent her to school so that she could begin working.

Justa raises animals such as pigs, ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs. She also buys and sells firewood. With her first loan of 300 soles, she started breeding guinea pigs and her numbers gradually increased. She later started raising chickens.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will buy pigs that she plans to breed for resale and will also sell pork in the neighboring villages and in the city of Trujillo. Justa dreams of expanding her animal breeding business and begin raising cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs to breed for resale & to sell as pork

loans.name: Balhumor

texts.ru: Балхумор Тошова проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 41 год. Замужем, имеет 7 детей. Муж работает в "горсети". Сама Балхумор занимается земледелием. Они имеют 5 гектаров земли на котором, хотят в основном выращивать пшеницу. Кредит просит для покупки семян и удобрений для посева. Погашение кредита будет осуществленно после сбора урожая и  дальнейшей продажи.

loans.use: Покупка удобрений и семян

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina D. is from the village of Tuyabang Alto. She is 48 years old. Fedelina is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Fedelina owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Fedelina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Fedelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fedelina has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Fedelina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Fedelina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina B. is from the village of Inobulan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old and married with seven adult children. To make a living, Dina owns and operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Dina has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately $175 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Dina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Dina is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of fish for her business.

loans.name: Nou

texts.en: Nou C., 30, lives with his wife and one young child in Phnom Penh. He buys bread from a bakery, which he then resells. On average, he is able to make about USD $7 of profit every day. His wife, pictured here, has been selling duck eggs on the roadside to earn a living, and is able to make around USD $5 of profit each day. Nou C. is asking for a loan of USD $500 so his wife can reinvest in her business. She will sell more duck eggs as well as roast beef and beer.

loans.use: to help his wife expand her business

loans.name: Lois

texts.en:
Lois is married with 4 children. She is 38 years old. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to lift her business and family above poverty.

Lois sells textbooks to make a living. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. Her greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 170,000 to purchase more textbooks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks to sell

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en: Mrs. Yoem P. lives in Dei Chrab village in Takeo province. She is 66 years old. She is a widow who has a child. Her child is a driver. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare to cultivate rice on to support her family. This family can not earn much income; however, they try to work with their rice field. So Mrs. Yoem P. has a plan to start breeding animals but they have only a little money to start up this new business. Thus, Mrs. Yoem P. decided to request a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Karimova Labarhan's Group

texts.en: Labarhan, 57, is the leader of this group. She was born in Aravan village and has been living there since then. She is married and has three children, all of whom are married and live separately except her youngest son. Like Labarhan, her husband is also a farmer. Here, in our country, usually the youngest child stays with the parents and looks after them, especially when they become older. Her son is 29 years old and works as a taxi driver in the village. He has three children, and two sons are twins! Quite a rare case for almost everybody! Labarhan’s daughter-in-law is a housewife and also looks after the family business. Labarhan and her family have land where potatoes and cotton are cultivated. For this loan Labarhan is planning to buy seed potatoes, mineral fertilizer and get prepared for sowing. She has been in this business for sixteen years. In the future her family is planning to buy additional land and also to start livestock breeding. Maybe later loans will be disbursed for this purpose. Bahtiyor, 38, is the father of four children: three daughters and one son. The middle daughter is a disabled person but all the others go to school. Bahtiyor is a farmer and he will use the loan to buy cotton seed and fertilizer. Bahtiyor also keeps two bulls for breeding and wants to increase the number of his livestock. Sabahathan, 55, is also a farmer. Her family has a total of 0.5 hectares (1.25 acres) of land and she cultivates potatoes and wheat there. She needs a loan to prepare for spring sowing, which requires her to plow and buy seed potatoes. She is married with one son who in turn is married and has one son. All the family members, including Sabahathan’s husband, take an active role in the family business. This year Sabahathan is planning to make repairs to her house. Gulanarahon is 25 years old and the youngest member of this solidarity group, but not the least. She is married with one son. She will use this loan to buy textiles to start a new business. Before getting married she helped her mother and they had a little sewing workshop. So she is planning to open her own workshop to produce garments, coverings, etc. This is her number one priority as well as to bring up a good son! This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy seed potatoes, mineral fertilizer and to get prepared for sowing

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco C. M., tiene la edad de 38 años, está casado, y tiene 2 hijos que es son mayor prioridad. Ellos tiene 13 y 11 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una vaca de leche y además arreglar el corral. La idea es tener ganado con producción de leche para venderla y así maximizar sus ganancias. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Don Francisco trabaja desde hace muchos años a la agricultura, pero sobre todo a la cría del ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y sobre todo como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Francisco C. M. is 38 years of age. He is married and has 2 children that are his greatest priority. They are 13 and 11 years old. He wants a loan to purchase a dairy cow and also to fix the corral. The idea is to have cattle for producing milk to sell and thus to maximize his profits. It is not the first time he has had a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very pleased with the facilities that have always been offered to him. Mr. Francisco has worked in agriculture for many years, but above all he has raised cattle. He hopes in the future to offer his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and above all as a provider. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and mend the corral

loans.name: Tepora

texts.en:
Tepora A. is 46 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Tepora has 2 years of experience in this business.  Tepora needs a loan of WST $1500 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or US $63 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2008, Tepora joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tepora's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Tepora A. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.9 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.7 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Adzaguenou Ayao

texts.en:
Adzaguenou Ayao D. lives and works in the Hédzranawoé district of Lomé, selling motor oil. He purchases his supply from the Grand Marché of Lomé and then sells his product in the slightly smaller Grand Marché of Hédzranawoé. 

Since the main method of transportation in Lomé is by motorcycle, the demand for Mr. D.’s product remains high. He has been in this business since 2006 and is now asking for his first loan from WAGES. He will use this loan to purchase 10 barrels of motor oil for sale in order to satisfy customer demand.

He is single and does not have children.

loans.use: To purchase motor oil for sale

loans.name: Moeurn's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Moeurn L. is 40 years old and she is the village bank president who has selected by all ten group members who are located in Toul Krosang village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Moeurn L. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate lotus to earn a living. She decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and gasoline to support her crops. Her husband, Mr. Ros Yin, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has five children. Two of the children are construction workers who support their father's business, one is a laborer and the last one is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 57 años de edad, él vive en su casa propia a lado de su hija quien ya es independiente. Hace más de 7 años trabaja en el servicio de transporte en su motocarro, logrando adquirir su moto, única herramienta de trabajo, gracias a su esfuerzo. Es así que desde tempranas horas de la mañana va rumbo a su paradero, lugar que ya se estableció, puesto que se encuentra en una zona de mayor concurrencia de clientes. En todo este tiempo ha ganado la confianza de sus pasajeros. A Juan le gusta su trabajo, pero debe procurar siempre mantener su motocarro en buen estado, ya que el constante uso hace que presente algunos contrariedades en su funcionamiento. Es  por ello que desea comprarse un auto, para que pueda brindar más comodidad a sus clientes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser puntual como en anteriores veces. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en el mantenimiento de su motocarro y dejarlo en óptimas condiciones y poder trabajar con tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hardworking man who is 57 years old. He lives in his own home along with his daughter, who is independent. For more than 7 years he has worked providing transportation services with his motocar (light, 3-wheeled passenger vehicle.) He managed to buy his own motocar, the only tool of his work, thanks to his own efforts. He gets up early in the morning and heads for his taxi stop, a place that he already established, because it lies in an area where there are large numbers of customers. Over time he has gained the confidence of his passengers. Juan likes his work, but he has to always maintain his motocar in good condition, since with constant use the vehicle will tend to have some problems. That is why he wants to buy himself an automobile, so that he could provide more comfort to his passengers. This is his 2nd loan with MFP, and he promises to be punctual with his payments as he was the last time. With the loan he requests, he will invest in maintaining his motocar, leaving it in optimal condition so that he can work without problems.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to maintain his motocar

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Soeurn S. is 47 years old and lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns one and a half hectares of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she also breeds ducks for their eggs. Mrs. Soeurn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, pesticide, and duck food. as well as to hire a farm laborer. She is a widow with three children -- one is a duck breeder who helps support the business and the other two are students.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, pesticide, and duck food, and to hire a farm laborer.

loans.name: Perly

texts.en:
Perly J.'s main source of income comes from selling Ready-to-Wear and slightly used clothing in her community. She is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. Perly has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2010, Perly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Perly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Perly is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Remember Group

texts.en:
Morris B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Remember. He is 58 years old, married and has four children who range in age from 5 to 7 years old. He was only able to attend vocational school due to financial difficulties. He also cares for one sibling.

For 17 years now, he has been selling soap, bread, milk, sugar coffee and other provisions in a shop in the Paynesville community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He says customers get attracted to his business because he sells quality products and talks to them in a friendly manner. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more soap, bread, milk, sugar coffee and other provisions. He describes himself as a caring father.

His dream is to grow his business, to build a house and to continue to support his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more soap, bread, milk, sugar coffee and other provisions.

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en:
Medarda H. is from the village of Francfort, Bumbaran, South Cotabato. She is 48 years old. Medarda is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Medarda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Medarda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Medarda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Medarda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Medarda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Medarda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna F. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 37 years old. Digna is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Digna owns & operates a business providing motor transport services. Digna has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Digna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Digna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Digna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with seven children, of whom five go to school and the eldest two are working. Currently, she is not taking care of any additional family members. She resides in and rents a three-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and food.

Fatuma changed her business enterprise from a retail shop to fruits and vegetables and has been in this business for a few months. She buys fruits and vegetables from the same villages where she works and so doesn’t incur any transport costs to and from shopping. She sells both retail and wholesale to all categories of people. Her business challenges are thieves and the fact that most fruits are seasonal.

Fatuma wants to use this loan to buy more baskets of fruits like mangoes, pineapples and cabbages. She is hoping to see her business grow big and to start buying directly from farmers.

Fatuma decided to work with MCDT SACCO because of its good customer care.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of mangoes, pineaples and cabbages

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 45-year-old housewife who lives in Borewala, Pakistan. She has four sons and two daughters.  Her eldest son is illiterate and works as a laborer. He couldn’t get an education due to financial problems, but now his financial situation has changed, and his younger brothers and sisters are able to attend school because of his financial support. 

Shakeela has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. He sells vegetables, and will be investing the loan money in his business by purchasing seasonal vegetables. Shakeela hopes that her family’s financial condition will improve through this venture. This is her 2nd loan from Asasah; her previous loan for the improvement of her husband’s business resulted in good profits, and she is expecting the same again.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal vegetables for reselling

loans.name: Victor Justo

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor cliente antiguo que ingreso en el año 2006, durante todo este tiempo el cliente demostró ser una persona responsable aunque en algunas ocasiones por motivos de salud ha tenido algún tropiezo en sus cuotas. El cliente esta implementando otra actividad para su esposa gracias a prestamos de Emprender.  El Señor Víctor es uno de los mejores torneros de la zona El Tejar quien tiene muchas obras y ganas de trabajar para seguir adelante con los estudios de sus tres hijos , dos de ellos con estudios superiores en la Universidad y la menor en colegio. El señor tiene una visión de que sus hijos se superen y que sean profesionales para afrontar un día mejor para el mañana.  El destino del crédito es el de comprar mercadería para su esposa ya que tiene poco capital de trabajo porque quiere colaborar para que se independice.
texts.en:
Sr. Victor is a former client who started with Kiva partner Emprender in 2006. During this time he showed himself to be a responsible individual although on one or two occasions he had to miss repayments because of health problems. Now Victor and his wife have started another business thanks to a loan from Emprender. He is one of the best lathe operators in the El Tejar area so he has a lot of work and a big desire to get ahead and support his three children with their education. Two of them are university students, and the youngest is in high school. Victor’s hope is to see his children do really well so that they get good jobs and do well in life. He will use the loan to buy merchandise (footwear) for his wife's business as she has little capital and he wants to help her become independent.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy footwear

loans.name: Bwavumpologoma Women's Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
Eva N. belongs to Bwavumpologoma Women’s group-Lugazi.  Eva has been a hard worker with entrepreneur skills ever since she began her food sell business 4 years ago in Kiyoola-Lugazi. She began this business under the auspices of her close friend who often told her she was destined for success. In retrospect she says she was living by her wits being a housewife. Circumstances have taken a favorable turn for this widowed mother of 5 as she is now able to live within the ways and means provided by her business. 

She has been selling  mostly staple foods for families in Uganda like bananas, sweet potatoes and fish. 180,000 shillings a month is what her business generates for her. With this loan, Eva is upbeat she will be able to purchase more bags of these foods that she will resell and at length, make more profits.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of staple foods like bananas and sweet potatoes for resell

loans.name: Mary Julia

texts.es:
Mary Julia tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que produce principalmente frutas como limón, mango y maracuyá. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace once meses al comercio de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega – tienda que se encuentra instalada en un pequeño ambiente de su domicilio. En ese establecimiento ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos artículos de calidad brindando un trato amable al momento de atenderlos, por este motivo su negocio suele contar con buena acogida por parte de sus clientes.

Mary desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que su stock de productos aumente y pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir un mayor número de ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Mary es una joven emprendedora y constante. Su anhelo es consolidarse como empresaria para poder percibir el dinero suficientes que le permita ayudar a sus padres a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mary Julia is 21 years old and single; she lives with her family in the area of Olmos, an agricultural zone that primarily grows fruits like lemons, mango and maracuya.  Olmos is part of the province of Lambayeque and is located and hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past 11 months, she has worked selling basic goods and groceries in a store that she has installed in her home.  She offers her customers a variety of goods and treats them very well; this is why her business is highly trafficked in the area.

Mary would like to grow her business by buying more popular products and increasing her supply of products to improve her sales and her income.  To achieve her goal, she is seeking her first loan from Edpyme Alternative; she is seeking $200.

Mary is an enterprising young woman.  Her dream is to grow her business to earn enough money to help her parents improve their quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase basic products and groceries to grow the store in her home

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David I., a 45-year-old resident of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda, is married and has six children, none of whom are currently in school. He has operated a restaurant for the past year.

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase and store food such as rice. With the help of the loan, he hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, David plans to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy and store more food such as rice

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the communal bank "Santiago the Patron Saint," located in the district of Santiago de Pupuja, the province of Azángaro and the department of Puno. She is 58 years old and a single mother with three children. She studied until the third year of primary school. 

Lucia has worked with Manuela Ramos for five years. Her first loan was for the amount of 300 Peru Nuevos Soles (PEN), and she used the money to increase the capital of her business selling sweets, bread and other foods.  

She is now asking for a loan for 2,500 PEN, money that she will use to buy merchandise for her business. 

Her dream is to increase the capital for her business. 

Her favorite things about working with the communal bank are the terms of the loan, the meetings and the information sessions.

loans.use: Merchandise for her business selling sweets, bread and other foods

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es:
Raymundo es un padre de familia de 65 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola que se ubica en a casi dos horas de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde que era muy joven, actualmente el cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar granos y cereales. En esta oportunidad ha instalado el cultivo de arroz y con mucho esfuerzo espera obtener una buena cosecha. El desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y lograr su objetivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Raymundo es un padre honrado y que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima, confianza y respeto.
texts.en:
Raymundo is 65 years old, the father of a family, and resides with his wife and children in the district of Oyotun, an agricultural zone located almost 2 hours by highway from the city of Chiclayo.

He has dedicated himself to agricultural work since he was very young.  At present, Raymundo has a small parcel of cultivable land where he sows grains and cereals.  Currently, he has planted rice, and with great effort he hopes to obtain a good harvest.  

Raymundo wants to buy fertilizer to maintain his crop and reach his objective. For that reason, he thought it convenient to approach Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 new sols.

Raymundo is an honored father who always does his best to advance his family.  People who know him have much esteem, respect, and confidence in him.

loans.use: TO BUY FERTILIZER TO MAINTAIN HIS RICE CROP

loans.name: Teresa Anyoso

texts.en:
Teresa Anyoso E. is a hardworking, 44-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of four children ages 18 years, 16 years, 10 years, and 8 years. She has been selling fresh maize for the past 15 years and she earns a monthly income of KES. 10,000.

She learned about KADET LTD and registered as one of our clients. She has no previous credit history with any other MFI. She has now applied for her first loan of KES. 35,000 from KADET LTD to purchase more maize to sell. She will also use part of the money to build a stall to store the maize.

Teresa hopes to expand her business and become the leading local investor in Eldoret, Kenya and to see her children realizing their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh maize and build grain storage

loans.name: Sokim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokim P. (pictured) is 40 years old. Her husband, Mr. Mengly Phorn, is 41 years old, and they have been married since 1993. The couple has four children – two sons and two daughters. The family lives along National Road Number Six, approximately 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Sokim sells clothes. Her husband is a motorbike repairman. Sokim is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to build a fence around her house and to provide her husband with capital to purchase motorbike spare parts.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house and to provide capital for her husband to purchase motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Leticia's Group

texts.en:
Leticia M. is from the village of Mambabanga Luna, Isabela. She is 51 years old. Leticia is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Leticia is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Leticia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Leticia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leticia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Leticia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & use as working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Leticia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & use as working capital

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Believe In God” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, increase profits and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Koloneh K.. Koloneh is age forty. She was born in Magburaka town, where she is currently residing with her husband and five children. Her husband is a businessman. Two of her children are attending secondary school and three are already grown-ups. For four years now, Koloneh has been selling cooked rice. With her share of this loan, she will buy cooking ingredients – rice, palm oil, firewood, etc. – in large quantity.

(Included in the right of the photo is loan officer Mohamed L. Tarawalie handing over the loan to the clients)

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients – rice, palm oil, firewood, etc. – in large quantity

loans.name: Joel Cheruiyot

texts.en:
Joel Cheruiyot M. is  48 years old, married, and a father of six children. His wife Monica M. runs a poultry business and adds to the family income.  Joel does dairy farming and sells milk in Tuiyo on the outskirts of Eldoret town. He has been in this business for eight years now and gets a monthly income of nine thousand shillings.


This will be Joel's first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to buy a dairy cow so that he can increase his income by selling the milk that the cow produces. With the income he is going to get, he plans to pay school fees for his children. 


In future he desires to improve and grow in the dairy farming business and also continue running a school which he started a few years ago.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 39 years old and married with six children.  She sells products in Nyabugogo, a market area in Kigali, Rwanda.  She has had her well-organized store for one year and employs four people to help her.  

Ester will use her loan to improve her facilities and purchase more products to sell like sorghum,rice and beans. She plans to first reinvest any profits, and if possible save some money for the future.

loans.use: To expand  more products to sell.

loans.name: Help We Self Group

texts.en:
Memuna B. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 28 years ago in Kenema city, Memuna is married and has two children. For five years now, Memuna has been selling used clothes and will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her enterprise through the purchase of another bale of used clothes.

This is the first loan that Memuna and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes to add to her business

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S.,age 39, married woman who has one small house, Reussey Keo commune,in Phnom Penh city. Presently, she always goes to her homeland a farmland , where border to Phnom Penh and Kampong Speu, to plant the different of her corps on her farmland which comes from her grandparent for many years. In addition, she also sells small rocks (she breaks the big rock from the mountain into small pieces and then selling). She and her husband depend on income from their farming business, whose core activity is cultivating various vegetable and fruit crops for harvest and sale to buyers. Because of a lack of money, Mrs. Chea S. doesn’t have enough capital to grow her crop-planting business, so she would like to ask for a loan of $700 USD. She will use part of the loan to buy watermelon seeds for growing in the second step and the remainder to dig a well for her family's use. The couple is blessed with two children who are going to school.

loans.use: To buy watermelon seeds for growing in the second step and dig a well for her family's use.

loans.name: Blanca Marvin

texts.es: Blanca Marvin F. de 34 años de edad, vive con sus tres hijas y su esposo en casa de un familiar. Doña Blanca vive en condiciones muy humildes y durante mucho tiempo a trabajado duro para poder ayudar a la economía de su hogar y no dejar todo el trabajo a su esposo que trabaja como motorista de transporte público. Su sueño es ver a sus hijas en mejores condiciones  por lo que desde hace años se decidió con poner un puesto de tortillas dentro de su casa ubicado en Ciudad Delgado del Departamento de San Salvador. Con la confianza de que este negocio le dé un poco de ingresos para complementar el presupuesto necesario que les permita mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Por tanto solicita a INTEGRAL este crédito para invertir en los materiales necesarios como: maíz, gas propano, agua, una mejor cocina, etc. Y así poder mejorar su servicio ya que los clientes la buscan mucho por ser una mujer de confianza y además está ubicada en lugar bien estratégico en donde puede abastecer a muchas personas.
texts.en:
34-year old Blanca Marvin F. lives with her three children and her husband in a relative’s house. Her living conditions are very basic. She has worked hard for a long time to help support the household and not leave it all to her husband who is a driver in public transportation.

Blanca’s dream is to see her children living in better conditions, so some time ago she decided to open a tortilla stand in her home located in Ciudad Delgado in the department of San Salvador. This business is giving her the confidence to put aside some money to improve the family’s living conditions.

She is now seeking a loan from Kiva partner INTEGRAL to buy corn, propane, water, a better stove etc. She will then be able to improve service to the many customers who seek her out as she is a trustworthy person. Also her stall is located in an ideal place to serve the many passersby.

loans.use: to improve the tortilla stand in her home

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Zarela

texts.es:
La señora Zarela es socia del banco comunal Nuevas Amigas del Distrito calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 40 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.
Son 2 años que está trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de gaseosas y golosinas, cuenta con una vitrina pequeña para colocar sus productos.  Su esposo se desempeña como empleado público y como es sabido que el sueldo es muy bajo, Zarela colabora con un ingreso más para los gastos de la casa.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,900.00 nuevos soles comprará 3 jabas de gaseosa, 2 cajas de galleta, 1 caja de chicle, 1 bolsa de caramelo, 5 tiras de chizitos, 2 tiras de chupetín, 2 tiras de maní tostado.
De esa manera, trabajando es que las mujeres han sabido salir adelante, porque dan todo por su familia, cualquier sacrificio por parte de los padres para dar bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ms. Zarela is a member of the Nuevas Amigas community bank in the Calleria district of the department of Ucayali. She is a 40-year-old married mother of two school age children. She has been working with loans from the Manuela Ramos microfinance institute for two years, and she runs a small business in which she sells soda pop and candy. She owns a small display case to place her products. Her husband is a public worker, a job that is known to pay a low salary. Zarela collaborates with this extra income to cover the household expenses.

With this new 1,900.00 PEN loan, she will purchase 3 crates of soda pop, 2 boxes of cookies, 1 box of chewing gum, 1 bag of candy, 5 units of cheese puffs, 2 units of lollipops, and 2 units of roasted peanuts.

Working is how women have been able to get ahead because they give their all for their family. Parents make whatever sacrifice they need to for the well-being of their children.

loans.use: to purchase soda pop, cookies, and other snacks.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en: Miatta is a 54-year-old married woman with three children. She sells local foodstuff and operates a guesthouse business. She started business in 2004, using initial capital from her personal savings. Miatta needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to buy drinks and local foodstuff. She is hardworking and honest. Miatta thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff for her business.

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en: Phylis is a single mother of a three-year-old. She runs a salon to earn a living.  She has employed one person in her business.  She has managed to sustain her business for five years because of her hard work.  She hopes to stabilize her business and employ more people.  She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy shampoos, a hair dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy shampoos, a hair dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is 32 years old and single.  He weaves baskets and carpets.  He has sustained his business for five years because of his artistic baskets and carpets.  He also runs a barber shop to supplement his income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused in his business.  He hopes to move his business to a spacious room so that he can train people on how to weave.  He wants 30,000 Kes to buy thread and a weaving machine.

loans.use: to buy thread and a weaving machine

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 40 years old and married.  He does tailoring to earn a living.  He has been in the business for five years and has employed two people to assist him in his tasks.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in financial management. He used his previous loan to boost his business.  In five years, he hopes to expand his business and employ more people. He has requested 40 000 KES to buy fabric to make clothes and a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.en:
Ainagul lives in Osh city, in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 46, married and has four children. Ainagul graduated from the Pedagogical University and worked at the school of Achy village as a librarian. 

Unfortunately, her salary did not cover the expenses of her household at all. That’s why, in 2004, using her start-up capital of 10,000 KGS, Ainagul started her business in trade. Year in and year out, she managed to broaden her business and earn about 30,000 KGS in a month. Her loyal customers were attracted by her optimistic attitude and cheerfulness. 

But in June 2010, when violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in the Osh city, Ainagu lost her business. Her sales place was robbed and looted. 

However, Ainagul isn't giving up and is ready to resume her lost business and continue to work. For this very reason, Ainagul is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her activity. She plans to purchase more dried fruits and nuts to resell at the local market. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fruits and nuts.

loans.name: Gabina Cristina

texts.es: a señora Gabina se dedica a la venta de golosinas. trabaja desde hace 2 años empezó vendiendo en la calle como ambulante y ahora tiene su triciclo propio.Ella es madre soltera, tiene una hija la cual que esta e edad escolar, eligió este tipo de trabajo por que le generaba buenos ingresos, los desafios que enfrenta es el transporte para su casa,y tener que dejar a su hija al cuidado de otras personas, gabina como muchas personas tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es poner su propia bodega en casa y asi dejar de salir a la calle, gabina  es una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora, trabaja  en las fuera de un colegio desde las 9 de la mañana y luego se translada a las afueras de una empresa de transporte, en la cual se queda hasta altas horas de la noche, el préstamo es para comprar mucha mas mercaderia para su triciclo, como golocinas gaseosa chocolates entre otros y poner una pequeña tiendita en casa, gabina esta muy agradecida con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Gabina works selling sweets.  She has done this work for two years.  She started selling in the street as a traveling vendor, and now has her own stand.  She is a single mother of a school-aged daughter.  She chose this type of work because it generates a good income.  The challenges she faces are transportation from her home and having to leave her daughter in the care of other people.

Gabina, like many people, has many dreams.  One of them is to have her own store in her home so that she can stop going out to the street.  Gabina is a fighter and a hardworking person.  She works outside of a high school from 9:00am and later moves outside a transport company, where she stays until late at night.

This loan is to purchase more merchandise for her cart, like candy, soft drinks, chocolates, and more, and also to put a small store in her home.  Gabina is very thankful for the confidence that is being given to her.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like chocolates, soft drinks, and cookies and to install a small store in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fragrances from the Zermat brand: the "Caribe," "Nicole," "Prive" and "Status" perfumes, and the "Kiddy's," "Baby," and "Xtreme Jovencita" colognes

loans.name: Khursanoy

texts.ru: Хурсаной проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 32 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж находится на заработках заграницей. Сама Хурсаной после отъезда мужа занялась бизнесом. Она более шести лет занимается торговлей арбуза. Ее бизнес является сезонным. Она берет кредит для закупа дыни. Хурсаной хочет расширить свою деятельность и получить хороший доход.
texts.en: Khursanoy lives in ​​Vahdat. She is 32 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is working abroad. After her husband left, Khursanoy went into business. For more than six years, she has been selling watermelons. Her business is seasonal. She is taking out a loan to buy melons. Khursanoy wants to expand her business and make a good income.

loans.use: Для закупа дыни

loans.name: Olinda

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Manjacaze, provincia de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos de idades entre 14 a 23 anos de idade. Fez a 12ª classe e frequentou a formação de professores. vive na casa propria com a  sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Manjacaze para Maputo em missão de serviço, é professora a mais de 20 anos e tem um salario de 10.806.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Fez emprestimo no BIM para dar inicio a sua obra, e conseguiu concluir o pagamento sem dificuldades. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que também é cliente e este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para sua obra DE CASA PARA HABITACAO ( areia, pedra, blocos, ferro, chapas, e outros ).  
Sonha em concluir a sua casa e mobiliar para oferecer mais conforto a sua familia, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Olinda was born in Manjacaze in the province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique. She’s single and the mother of 4 children between the ages of 14 and 23. She completed 12th grade and attended teacher training. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

Olinda left Manjacaze for Maputo for work; she has been a teacher for more than 20 years and has a salary of 10,806 meticals (MZN) per month, which she spends or household expenses and saves in her bank account (BIM).

She obtained a loan from BIM to start her construction work and managed to pay it back without difficulties. She learned of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client and this is her first loan from Hluvuku for the value of 15,000 MZN, with which she intends to buy materials for the construction work on the house in which she lives (sand, stone, blocks, iron, sheet materials and others).

She dreams of finishing her house and furnishing it to provide greater comfort for her family, for which she intends to solicit more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: buy materials for the construction work on the house in which she lives (sand, stone, blocks, iron, sheet materials and others).

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж занимается животноводством. Сама Нодира занимается посевом зерновых культур и овощей для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Nodira lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 42 years old. She is married, with four children. Her husband raises farm animals. Nodira  grows grains and vegetables for sale. She has been doing this line of work for 20 years. She is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 37-year-old married man who has worked in vehicle repairs for 20 years. This long experience gave him a special position in his area. Customers come requesting his services from nearby villages because of his good quality of work. 

Bilal is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy new tools and updated machines necessary to improve his quality of work given. He is an Al Majmoua borrower for two successful cycles.
