His previous loan was invested in his business, and reflected positively on his social and financial situation. He is a borrower in good-standing, a man with special skills recommended by most of his customers. Bilal has worked hard to prove himself since he started with a very small capital and now he's proving successful.

In addition to repairing vehicles, Bilal buys used cars, does necessary maintenance for them, and sells them at a good price, so he's starting a new business which deals with selling used cars and hopes to support it as much as he can. 

Bilal is planning to expand into the car-selling sector and hopes he can achieve what's requested as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy new tools and machines necessary for his business

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 27-year-old young woman. She is married and has one son. She lives in Khanyounis city in Gaza, Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a modest salary. 
Samar wants to purchase new basic home appliances that will make her family life easier and healthier, such as a refrigerator, stove, etc. However, because her husband's salary is only modest, she doesn't have sufficient funds to make these purchases so she wants to take a loan of $1,500 from Kiva partner, FATEN. When Samar takes the loan, which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase the home appliances she needs and provide her family with better and healthier living conditions. 
Samar is a conservative woman so her husband is photographed instead in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: to purchase needed home appliances.

loans.name: Samba

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié qui pratique la culture de mil et d'arachide et des légumes.Ancien chauffeur, il est sociétaire de l'UIMCEC qui lui a déja octroyé un pret de 200000f qu'il a payé sans retard.Il sollicite un second pret de 500000F pour acheter une motopompe 4 pousse, des accessoirs et des semences.Les bénéfices tirés de cet investissement lui permettront de prendre en charge sa famille mais aussi d'épargner.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man who grows millet, peanuts, and vegetables. He used to be a chauffeur and is a member of UIMCEC. He has already been granted a loan of 200,000 francs which he repaid without delay. He is requesting a second loan of 500,000 francs to buy a 4-cylinder pump motor, accessories, and seeds. The profit made from this investment will permit him to support his family, but also to put aside savings.

loans.use: to buy a 4 cylinder  pump motor, accessories, and seeds.

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Vilma tiene 40 años es madre soltera de 2 hijos. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, empezó el negocio realizando ventas de comestibles como pan, galletas entre otros productos, luego poco a poco fue vendiendo productos de consumo familiar como granos básicos, azúcar, harina, aceite, pan, galletas, entre otros productos. Ella comenta que su negocio es bien concurrido por sus clientes. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad como ser fideos, galletas, arroz, aceite, azúcar, leche, huevos y otros productos necesarios para abastecer su local y de esa forma cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en: Vilma, 40, is a single mother of two children.  She has a grocery store.  She started the business selling foodstuffs like bread and cookies, among other items.  Gradually she started selling basic family consumption items like sugar, flour, oil, bread and cookies, among other products.  She comments that her business is well patronized by her customers.  She’s asking for a loan to buy basic need items like noodles, cookies, rice, oil, sugar, milk, eggs and other products needed to stock her store and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Wilson De Jesus

texts.es:
Wilson es un hombre trabajador, honrado y luchador, a sus 42 años de edad se encuentra emprendiendo negocio en una ciudad nueva para él, ya que toda su vida desde su nacimiento vivió en Abejoral, un municipio del departamento de Antioquia, pero hace 1 año tomo la decisión de emprender un nuevo negocio en la ciudad de Medellín.

Wilson compro un local, allí monto una tienda donde vende gran variedad de productos, como alimentos, licores, dulces, fritos y mucho más. Actualmente solicita un crédito para poder adecuar bien el negocio, y poder surtirlo más, con la ilusión que mejoren sus ventas, su negocio tenga acogida en el mercado y con el aumento de sus ingresos pueda traerse a sus padres desde Abejorral a vivir con el a la ciudad.
texts.en:
Wilson is a hard-working, honest and tenacious man.  At 42 years of age, he is starting out in a business in a new city.  He lived his whole life, since he was born, in Abejorral, a town in Antioquia department, but one year ago he took the decision to start a new business in the city of Medellín.

Wilson bought sales premises and set up a store where he sells a wide variety of products such as food, liquor, sweet treats, fried food and a lot more besides.  He is currently requesting a loan to fit out his business and stock it some more.  He hopes to improve his sales.  His business is popular and an increase in his income would enable him to bring his parents from Abejorral to live with him in the city.

loans.use: to fit out his business premises and buy a larger quantity of stock

loans.name: 5 De Mayo Group

texts.es: Las nuevas integrantes del grupo son la señora Maria Manuela va a comprar con su prestamo pollo para engordar, la señora Virginia va a comprar alimento para engordar cerdos, las otras integrantes siguen en su actividad que vienen desarrollando. La señora Yecenia tiene 33 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo es albañil, ellos tiene 3 hijos varones, dos están estudiando la primaria y el otro todavía no va a la escuela, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, pollos y becerros, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar cerdos lechones para criarlos y después venderlos, ella inicio su negocio hace 11 años, su mama criaba puercos de ahí ella aprendió, su mama le regalo la primer cerda criandera, su negocio es importante porque ayuda a su familia a vestirlos y a calzarlos, ella enfrenta los desafíos de costos elevados en el alimento de su animales el maíz subió el precio. Su negocio ha ayudado a su familia de ahí tienen para comer hay gallinas, huevos para preparar la comida. Sus sueños y esperanzas son construir su cocina y que sus niños tengan su recamara aparte, que tengamos recursos para mandar a sus hijos a la escuela y comprar sus útiles y uniformes. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias y que nos sigan prestando para que sigamos avanzando, gracias a ustedes podemos salir adelante nos ayudan a vivir mejor con la familia.
texts.en:
The new group members are María Manuela who will use the loan to buy chicks to raise and Virginia who will buy pig feed.  The other members continue with the activities they’ve been carrying out.  

Yecenia, 33, is married; her husband’s a bricklayer.  They have three boys, two are in elementary school and the other one hasn’t started school yet.  She raises pigs, chickens and calves.  She asked for the loan to buy piglets to raise and then sell.  She started her business 11 years ago.  Her mother raised pigs and that’s where she learned.  Her mother gave her her first litter of pigs to raise.  Her business is important because it helps her feed, clothe and provide shoes for her family.  The challenges she faces are the rising costs of animal feed; corn prices rose.  Her business has helped her family because they get food from it, there are chickens to eat, eggs to make into meals.  Her dreams and hopes are to build a kitchen and that her children have separate bedrooms, that they have resources to send their children to school, to buy school supplies and uniforms.

The group members want to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad: “Many thanks and please keep lending to us so that we can continue advancing.  Thanks to you we are able to get ahead and you help us live better with our families.”

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Ramel

texts.en:
Ramel is 31 years old, married, with one kid. Ramel describe himself as a kind and hard working person. He is willing to do everything just to provide for the needs of his family. Ramel has been running a rice farming business for 10 years. He has a one hectare rice field. 
To minimize his labor cost, Ramel and his wife are doing some field activities to lessen their expense for farm labor. Because the couple can do some farm activities, they will be to save some of their farming expenses. 
Ramel wants to continue operating his farming business. He is asking for a loan of P40,000 to pay for the labor of land preparation, transplanting and buying seeds to grow. He looks toward to the positive impact of the loan for him, his family, and his crops.

loans.use: to pay for the labor needed for land preparation, transplanting, and buying seeds to grow.

loans.name: Louis

texts.en:
Louis is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 40,000 Kes loan to purchase a drier, cosmetics, hair extensions and some clothes for her salon. In the future, Louis aspires to continue expanding her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Louis has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase a drier, cosmetics, hair extensions and some clothes for her salon.

loans.name: Shams

texts.en:
Shams is a 20-year-old single woman from Madaba, Jordan.

Shams has a grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to redecorate her store and purchase more goods to sell.

Shams is looking to expand her store and increase her family's income.

Due to cultural issues, Shams's father was photographed in her place.

loans.use: to redecorate the store and purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep, 58, is married and supports her family by designing and printing advertising signs. Her husband earns his income by making advertisement boards. She lives with her four children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Diep has been in business for eight years. She plans to use this loan to buy a greater quantity of plastics, papers and materials for printing. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of plastics, papers and materials for printing advertising signs

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORTY YUNGAQUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Concepcion; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de chanchos, la socia los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chanchos al por mayor y alimentos para los chanchos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the "Señor de Ccoyllorty Yungaqui" communal bank, located in the district of Anta, which is part of Anta province, Cusco department.

The borrower is Concepción. She is 28, lives with her partner, and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her business of buying and selling pigs. The borrower raises and fattens them, and then sells them in the various markets that exist in the district of Anta. Through this business, she is raising her children.  

Her dream is to have a shop where she can have her grocery store. The borrower is applying for the loan in order to buy pigs at wholesale, and feed for them. She is happy about the loan, and promises to make her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy pigs at wholesale, and feed for them.

loans.name: Eim

texts.en: Eim, 28, is married and lives with her mother, her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband is a construction worker. Due to low income, Eim is requesting for a loan of $500 US to purchase a piece of farmland for growing rice. She wants to generate extra income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and support her children's studies until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe,créé depuis juillet 2012,rassemble les membres qui habitent la même localité et ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Woury qui se trouve à gauche de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 31 ans,est mariée et mére de 04 enfants.Son activité est le commerce de légumes,d'oignons,de poissons fumés et de l'arachide.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 01 sac de poudre détergente à 8000f,100kg d'arachide à 500f le kg,des légumes pour 14000f,de l'oignon pour 35000f.

Une fois le bénéfice réalisé,elle désire acheter une vache pour faire de l'élevage et aider son mari à supporter les dépenses quotidiennes de la maison.
texts.en:
This group, created in July 2012, unites members who live in the same locality and are all small-scale merchants. 

Woury who is standing on the left in the photo and raising her hand, is the group representative. She is 31, married, and the mother of four children. Her business is selling vegetables, onions, smoked fish, and peanuts. 

With the loan she intends to buy one sack of powdered detergent for 8,000 francs, 100 kg peanuts at 500 francs a kilogram, vegetables for 14,000 francs and onions for 35,000 francs. 

Once she has made her profit, she wants to buy a cow to raise and help her husband with the daily expenses of the household.

loans.use: to buy a sack of powdered detergent, 100 kg of peanuts, vegetables, and onions.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Mr. Ricardo H. and his wife have 2 years with the business. This business have been growing too much, it’s was the first one in the neighborhood, they neighbors didn’t have a place to buy basic products. Mr. Ricardo H. is asking for a loan of $1200.00, he plans to buy a freeze and then offer to his clients, milk, and frozen foods. In this neighborhood there isn’t any Supermarket and that is an advantage for him. His business probably will grow much better. Mr. H. goal is to grow the business and be a good provider for his family. He wants to repay in a term of 12 months.

Español

El Sr. Ricardo Hernández y su esposa tienen 2 años con su negocio y ha crecido mucho, pues fue la primera tienda de su colonia. Sus vecinos no contaban con algún lugar para comprar productos básicos. El Sr. Hernández solicita un préstamo de 1,200.00 para comprar un congelador y ofrecer a sus clientes, lácteos y productos congelados. En este vecindario aún no existen supermercados por lo que considera podrá tener éxito en el crecimiento de su negocio. El Objetivo del Sr. Ricardo Hernández es hacer crecer su negocio, y ser un buen proveedor para mi familia.

loans.use: buy a freezer

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Maame O. sells fante kenkey to restaurants and individuals to retail. This is a local food prepared from maize. She cooks the kenkey per the demands of these restaurants and individuals.

At certain times she is unable to provide the quantity demanded. When asked, on a visit to her kitchen, why she could not provide, she said, "The price of a bag of maize is very expensive and I cannot afford to buy it, making me not cook when the quantity demanded is high." She is seeking a loan of $700 from Kiva.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Manizha

texts.en:
Manizha is 45 years old and lives in a household in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is widowed because her husband died during the war. She needs money because her son has a car part business. She wants to take a loan for her son to increase the business and buy more car kits to help his family and help his brothers to join him in school and support all parts of his family.

Note: the picture featured in this business profile is the son entrepreneur. In Afghanistan it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy car parts

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is a hard-working women. She is married and has three small children. Her husband is a bus driver, but his salary is too low to pay for all the family necessities. Marisol wants to offer her children a better quality of life and therefore she started to sell cosmetics six years ago. This way, she helps her husband to pay for household expenses and has time to take care of her children.

In order to satisfy customer demand, Maria is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise. This way she will be able to offer aid to its service to her customers and to continue doing what she likes most. She commits to repay this amount in three months. You can be a part of the growth of this business and improve the well-being of this family. Please help them.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Marisol es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, su esposo es chofer en un autobús urbano, pero su salario es muy bajo para poder cubrir las necesidades D. su familia. Marisol desea ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida y para ello desD. hace seis años se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, D. esta manera puD. ayudar a su esposo con los gastos D. su hogar y tener el tiempo para los cuidados y atenciones que sus hijos requieren.

Para poder cubrir las demandas D. sus clientes, Marisol solicita un préstamo D. $250 dólares que utilizará en la compra D. mercancía, D. esta manera logrará ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y continuar con su preferencia, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en tres meses.Tú puedes ser parte del crecimiento D. este negocio y mejorar el bienestar D. esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Lucrecia Vicente

texts.pt:
Lucrecia is a nurse, married with 1 child. She entered the program in 2004, with a loan of 1800 meticais to purchase domestic goods. On her 3rd loan, she invested in starting a business to sell basic goods. Today the business has developed and she would like another loan in September.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

'e infermeira ,casada com 1 filho, entrou para o programa em 2004, com um emprestimo de 1.800mts para compra de bens domesticos, no 3.emprestimo investiu para iniciar um negocio da venda de produtos de primeira necessida. Hoje o negocio desenvolveu e vai tomar outro emprestimo em setembro.

loans.use: Purchase of domestic goods

loans.name: Katy Alicia

texts.es:
Katy is 36. She is married and has two small children. The family lives with Katy's mother who has helped them open a small shop in their home. Income from the shop and from the husband's job in public transportation allow them to support their family. Still, the couple dreams of buying a plot of land where they can build themselves a home and open a new shop as well as an auto garage. This would give the family stability and the children a home where they can play and grow up. Katy is striving to give her family a better standard of living and to do so she is asking for a loan to expand the products she sells.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Katy tiene 36 años y junto a su esposo forman un matrimonio joven que hasta hoy ha contado con el apoyo de su madre, ya que los instaló en su casa y los apoyó para aperturar una tienda para que puedan trabajar y solventar los gastos de sus 2 pequeños niños.De esta manera han podido satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos y ha podido adquirir en corto tiempo algunos bienes propios que han podido ser alcanzados gracias al arduo trabajo tanto en su bodega como en el transporte urbano.Pese a tener una base económica, ésta no es suficiente para que comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa a donde podrían trasladar su negocio de abarrotes y abrir una cochera; esto también daría estabilidad a sus hijos además de un inmueble cómodo en el que podrían jugar y divertirse libremente.Ahora ha puesto todo su empeño para incrementar la variedad de productos y acrecentar sus ingresos en pro de mejorar su nivel de vida familiar.

loans.use: To stock a general store.

loans.name: Samir Yusef

texts.es:
Mr. Samir sells cell phones, which he buys outside of Nicaragua. He has been working 10 years in this business, which took an initial investment of $1,000 that he got through a loan. He came up with the idea of this business after seeing that people at the market La Terminal had a need for cell phones in order to be able to communicate. Before he started this business, Mr. A. worked for the city hall of Leon. Thanks to the loans that he got (this one will be used to buy cell phones and accessories) he was able to established his business, which has helped him get ahead and take care of his five children (three of them of school age) and his mother.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Don Samir se dedica a la venta de celulares, realizando compra de los productos fuera de Nicaragua. Lleva 10 años trabajando con este negocio, nos dice que su inversion inicial fue de $1,000 gracias a un primer prestamo. La idea de tener este negocio se dió al ver la necesidad que tenia la gente del mercado La Terminal en Leon para acceder a un medio de comunicación. Antes de tener este negocio, el Sr. A. era trabajador asalariado de la alcaldía de Leon pero gracia a la idea de poner el negocio y con el apoyo que ha recibido a travez de estos créditos, que son para la compra de productos tales como celulares y accesorios, ha logrado salir adelante, manteniendo a sus 5 hijos, tres de ellos en edad escolar y el cuido de su querida madre.

loans.use: To buy cell phones and accessories for his business.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Mrs. A. was introduced to fruit-selling in childhood, working alongside her father, who taught her this method of earning a living.

Over time she has asked for credit and she considers the financial support that CEPRODEL has provided to be a determining factor in the development of her business. Currently she has a small floor space in the local market with a plastic roof and no walls, but she hopes that through CEPRODEL financing she will be able to improve her business day by day.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. A. se inicia en este negocio desde su infancia, trabajando al lado de su padre, quien le enseña esta forma de ganarse la vida.

Con el transcurso del tiempo decide la solicitud de créditos y en este sentido considera que el aporte financiero que la ha brindado CEPRODEL ha sido un factor determinante en el desarrollo de su negocio actualmente tiene un pequeño piso en el mercado con techo de plástico no tiene paredes pero tiene la esperanza de que por medio de los financiamientos de CEPRODEL mejorar día a día.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Dinora

texts.es:
The business of señora Dinora C. has been selling clothing (especially underwear for women and men) for 20 years in the central market of Chinandega

She started the business selling outdoors using a small basket, later she used a cardboard box and, at present, she is located in the internal area of the market in one of the sections that certainly needs work.

Ceprodel has offered financial support, offering her loans that she has been known to use. Due to this she has improved her sales by acquiring greater quantities of clothes and she has managed to earn a living for her home. Her greater need is the acquisition of her products and for this she trusts that Ceprodel will support her with her need.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad de la señora Dinora C. se refiere a la venta de ropa (especialmente ropa interior para dama y caballero) desde hace 20 años en el mercado Central de Chinandega.

Inició el negocio vendiendo a la intemperie en una canastita pequeña, luego paso a una caseta de cartón y actualmente esta ubicada en lo interno del mercado en uno de los tramos que por cierto necesita remodelación.

Ceprodel le ha brindado el apoyo financiero otorgándole créditos que los ha sabido utilizar debido a que ha mejorado sus ventas por haber adquirido mayores volúmenes de ropa ha logrado llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación. Su mayor necesidad es la adquisición de sus productos y para ello confía en que Ceprodel le apoyará con su necesidad.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Eliaishi's Jitegemee Group

texts.en:
Eliaishi is a 19 year old woman who, along with her husband, takes care of 2 children, ages 15 and 10.  Eliaishi has been selling food since 2006.
She now hopes for a loan of $325 to expand her business, and she will share this loan with her subgroup member, who operates a tailoring business

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Immediately after her divorce, Lucy K. had difficulty supporting her two children - a 9 year-old girl and a 6 year-old boy. Because they were very young, she did not want to leave them alone. 3 years ago she decided to work as a seamstress. Little by little, she has been able to earn enough to support her young children and has been able to work in a way where she doesn't have to leave them alone.

She needs a loan of $250 that she will pay back in three months. The money from the loan will be used to buy a portion of material at wholesale so she can continue to be able to support her children. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Lucy K. a raíz de su divorcio tuvo problemas económicos para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos, una niña de 9 años y niño de 6 años, como no podía dejarlos solos puesto que eran muy chicos, hace 3 años decidió dedicarse a la costura negocio que poco a poco le ha traído beneficios económicos que le permiten mantener a sus pequeños y así no tiene que dejar a sus hijos solos.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $ 250 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir un lote de tela a precio de mayoreo y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Con tu apoyo esto será posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Allah Nsor Group

texts.en:
Members of the Allah Nsor group are motivated to make a difference. Toh Dusu is the group leader and a very dynamic woman. She is a development-oriented and business-oriented person, who encourages her fellow women to be industrious and cooperative. Dusu is 33 years old and is married with 5 children.

All the group members are farmers and would like to produce rice and vegetables for consumption and for sale. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 ($875 USD) to purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds and to hire labourers. In order to have a successful season they need a loan to purchase all their necessary inputs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and vegetable seeds and to hire labourers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 59 years old and the mother of 2 kids and 4 grandchildren whom she is taking care of. She has operated a grocery store in her neighborhood for 23 years now. Mary wants to buy additional varieties of products like sanitary towels, tampons, pampers, babies’ soaps, and other toiletries. She therefore wants to use her loan to buy more products to expand her operations. Mary is a member of the group called Elizabeth. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
Mrs. Saron M. is a 28-year-old widow with three children, two of whom attend school. The third is too young. Mrs. Saron M. sells "prahok" (Khmer fish cheese) in Tie Prumpie Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

Prahok, also known as "Khmer cheese," is a fermented mixture of small fish and salt. It is a widely used ingredient in Khmer cuisine. Because Mrs. Saron M.'s business is a great success, she wants to expand it. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy more ‘Khmer cheese’ to resell in the market.

loans.use: To buy more ‘Khmer cheese’ to resell i nthe market

loans.name: Aureline

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aureline M. was born on 1 February 1969 in Bymba in Rwanda, a country in central Africa. She has been married to a Togolese man since 1998 and has one child. She is a seamstress and has set up shop in Agoè in Lomé since 2004. She runs her business at home and primarily oversews clothing for her customers. Currently, she has many clients, and is unable to satisfy their demands quickly. The first loan she obtained allowed her to obtain her first oversewing machine.

She is asking for this second loan to buy a second oversewing machine and several haberdashery items such as thread and poplin in order to better serve her customers and make a profit.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame M. Aureline est née le 1er février 1969 à Bymba au Rwanda, pays situé dans l’Afrique de centrale. Elle s’est mariée à un togolais depuis 1998 et à un enfant. Elle est couturière et s’est installée à Agoè à Lomé depuis 2004. Elle mène son activité dans son domicile et fait surtout du surfilage des habits pour ses clients. Actuellement elle reçoit beaucoup de clients et n’arrive à vite les satisfaire. Le premier crédit qu’elle avait obtenu lui a permis d’avoir une première machine à surfilage.

Elle sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter une deuxième machine à surfilage et quelques articles de mercerie tels que le fil à coudre et les popelines afin de mieux servir ses clients et tirer de bénéfice.

loans.use: To buy an oversewing machine and various haberdashery supplies

loans.name: Jovina

texts.es:
Jovina B. is married and has three grown children, the oldest of whom works in Spain.

Jovina has been selling vegetables in the city market for approximately 30 years.

The Foundation’s loans have always been for the purchase of merchandise. Previously she sold in the street, now Jovina has a locale from where she serves her clients selling lettuce, tomatos, garlic, etc.

In the future Jovina wants to continue to expand her business as her earnings from her sales are what support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Jovina B. está casada y tiene tres hijos, todos ya mayores de edad, el mayor de sus hijos se encuentra trabajando en España.

Doña Jovina desde hace aproximadamente 30 años se dedica a la venta de verduras y hortalizas en el mercado de la ciudad.

Los créditos que la Fundación le ha otorgado siempre fueron para la compra de mercadería. Anteriormente sus ventas los hacia en la calle, ahora Jovina ya posee un local en donde recurren sus clientes para las compras de sus lechugas, tomates, ajos, etc.

Mas adelante Doña Jovina quiere seguir ampliando su negocio ya que la ganancia que sale del mismo es para el sustento de su familia.

loans.use: Buy lettuce, parsley, garlic, tomato, onion, season fruits, etc.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en: Anastasia E. is 45 years old. She is married and has three children who are currently in school. She is a petty trader who trades in yams. Her husband and children are very proud of her because of the enormous contribution she makes in the home. Selling yams has enabled her to support her family at home for two years now. She wants to use the loan to buy yam tubers to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her save for her children's education. She is member of the group called "Ntoboase" Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee the repayment of loans for each.

loans.use: To buys yam tubers.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Mrs. Pheng S., who lives in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province, owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Saom Srey Ny, is a construction worker who makes a small income that helps to support his family.  In order to reduce his high commuting costs, Pheng is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for him to use.  Her husband is presented on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Povi

texts.fr: M. Povi est née à Agbodrafo le 21/05/1966. Elle vit actuellement à Aného avec trois (03) personnes à charge. Elle fait le commerce des céréales depuis 13 ans. En période d’abondance elle achète pour les stocker afin de les revendre en saison sèche où les prix augmentent considérablement. Pour cela, elle sollicite un financement pour constituer un stock de maïs et de haricot afin de les revendre plus tard. De la vente, elle tirera des bénéfices lui permettant d'améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.
texts.en:
Povi M. was born in Agbodrafo on 5/21/1966. She currently lives in Aného with three people in her care. She has been in the business of selling grains for 13 years. In fruitful periods, she buys and stocks grains to sell them in the dry season when the prices go up considerably. To do this, she is seeking financing to build up a stock of corn and beans to be able to sell them later. From the sales, she will use the profits to improve her living conditions as well as those of her family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on and sell corn and beans

loans.name: Petrona Maritza

texts.es:
La Sra.  Petrona  tiene 45 años de edad, habitante del barrio 380 en la capital de Managua, casada, tiene tres  hijos de 8, 12, y 14 años de edad, todos estudian. Los planes de doña petrona para con su familia es mejorar su nivel de vida, ofrecerle seguridad y una mayor comodidad. Se desempeña como domestica desde hace diez  años, es un trabajo muy casado y agotador.
Sus metas en el ámbito laboral es cambiar a un mejor trabajo, conseguir un préstamo para construir completamente su casa. Para esto va a comprar materiales de construcción como piedra, arena, cemento Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra ofrecerle a su familia una mayor seguridad y casa digna.
texts.en:
Petrona is 45 years old, married, lives in the 380 neighborhood in the capital city of Managua, and has three children ages 8, 12 and 14 who are in school. Petrona’s plans for her family include improving their standard of living, offering them security and additional comforts. She has worked in housekeeping/domestic help for ten years, a job that is very exhausting. Her work-related ambitions are to switch to a better type of employment, and to obtain a loan to finish construction on her house. For this reason, she is going to purchase supplies such as stone, sand, and cement. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, she will manage to offer her family a safer living environment and a more dignified abode.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to finish building her house.

loans.name: Toem

texts.en:
Mrs. N. is 54 years old, widowed, and has two children, one of whom is married, while the other one is single and still lives at home. Mrs. N. earns income selling groceries at a local market. She sells a variety of products, including vegetables, various food ingredients, shampoo, perfume, and other home products.
The business is going well and provides the largest share of the family's income. With the growing demand for her goods, Mrs. N. would like to expand her business, and therefore needs a loan to purchase additional groceries for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries for sale
